description:
First time here and it was everything that I expected,now on to the  ordering i got the lunch plate 2 street tacos rice and beans comes with the little lettuce sour cream guacamole which took me an hour to eat LOL was really good lot of Carnitas it had fresh carrots radishes green onions cilantro and salsa.
It's really cute restaurant inside but it's hella hot and it gets hella crowded between 12 and 1 pm and I know  a lot of people from the hospital come in to eat here so you know the food is really good and the pretty fast with the orders. you ordering one room then go sit yourself down and then they call your number and make sure it's the right person with the food so keep your ticket with you self-service what the hot sauce. 
But  that doesn't mean you got to have 50 million bowls One customer had 15 of those little bowls and helped himself to a bowl of chips that's a No-No! the bathrooms big so if you're in a wheelchair you'll be able to fit that's for both men and women and children it's also dog friendly outside and they come and bring your food to you so that's a plus if you're outside. 
I also got a burrito to take home carne asada other 10 bucks and they charge you a fee if you use your credit card or debit card so if you have cash that will save you a few pennies. lol
So if you're looking for a good place to eat come check this place out there street parking which could be kind of hard to find they also serve alcohol here and they have free Wi-Fi so that was a plus. So the food that I order wasn't a mind-blowing but they gave you a lot of carnitas and that's what I liked and I'll definitely be back for lunch or dinner. 
Thanks for reading my El Metate review. ~Lizzie~
author: Lizzie G.

description:
Not really a sit down restaurant. Its an "order to go", or an "order and seat yourself and we will bring the food to you" place.

also, DONT COME WITH A CAR that you need to park. Its very challenging to find parking, specially in the evenings, when everyone in the neighborhood is home.  

The food was nice, but the guacamole and the margaritas were a disappointment. 
- Guacamole: watery - zero chunk, felt like it was coming from a box and wasn't made from scratch. Little flavor (under salted) and zero spice. 
- Margaritas: no option to have it on the rocks. Not made fresh, probably came from a pre-mixed bottle. Was super sweet to the point that my friend and I left the nearly full glasses. Melted slush. The salt was a nice touch, but it was still undrinkable.
- My burrito was alright. I enjoyed the chunky meets in my super burrito.
- Seating: most likely you will share a table with other people.
author: Zita M.

description:
We were running super late on lunch due to a delayed flight, and El Metate was perfect for a quick option (with good food of course!) that was open in the middle of the afternoon. 

* Carnitas Plate - 4 stars
I always love their crispy carnitas. Black beans were great, and you get some sour cream & guac on the side. Could've used more tomato/lettuce. I was able to make more than enough mini tacos for me and 3 friends to share. 

* Fish Burrito - 3.5 stars
Soft tender fish, but I wish the breading was more crunchy. Got quite soggy in the burrito!

* Enchiladas, Carne Asada - 3.5 stars
Good filling dish. The meat was just a bit tough.
author: Ziyan C.

description:
I wanted to try El Metate for so long and tried their 3 way shrimp burrito. Wasn't bad but wasn't mind blowing either. The burrito was soggy by the time I got it and perhaps they're not the best thing to be ordered delivered. The burrito was tasty, shrimp was large and very filling so kudos to that. There was a little stuff up with the order as well. I got a message saying that the order was cancelled and then the food arrived after I had ordered from elsewhere.

Looking forward to trying something else to see what everyone has been raving over.
author: Carmen P.

description: Legit Taqueria in the Mission""been doing great things for  15 years now. Francisco the owner is sweet as candy & treats his customers that way great prices, tasty Mexican food. Fresh! Fish tacos & chicken enchiladas with the red sauce my favorites.
author: Sean K.

description:
The food here is oh-so-fresh. We ordered a shrimp quesadilla and it was very yummy; the shrimp was not overcooked. My bf was pretty surprised with the portion size though because El Farolito is way bigger according to him. This order also came with some chips, and there was a self-serve station with salsa (and water) to go with it. 

Overall, really enjoyed this place - nice employees, delicious food, and spacious interior.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Nothing like a Mission burrito to brighten your day! While in San Francisco for work I grabbed lunch at El Metate with a friend before heading out to SFO. 

The restaurant itself is beautiful with its bright yellow exterior and homey interior full of greenery, murals, and general vibe of still being outside in a cute little town square. 

I ordered the pollo con chile rojo burrito and added the extra guac, cheese, and sour cream (it's only a dollar more and well worth it). El Metate's burritos are long and skinny, which looks somewhat hilarious in a world of chunky Chipotle burritos, but made for easy eating - I didn't have to try to control the filling falling out all over the place. The accompanying chips were crispy and came in a twisted up piece of paper. Salsa was tasty. I really enjoyed the horchata I ordered - creamy with a good kick of cinnamon. 

Metate isn't my favorite Mission joint, but you also aren't going to go wrong with it! Don't sleep on that horchata!
author: Stacey L.

description:
Stopped in last night for their Red Mole Chicken Enchiladas. I definitely recommend this dish as it had excellent flavor with just the right amount of spice. 

I was impressed by the restaurant layout and set-up. Walk-in, grab a beer from the fridge, order at the register, find a table at the restaurant. Utensils and water are self-served. It's a fast casual concept which you rarely see in a neighborhood taqueria. 

Large menu with a lot of options. Ready to go for catering needs. Can choose the type of beans which I liked. Zero guilt from eating inside and would even take a date there to try semi-authentic Mexican food when time is of the essence.
author: Luis G.

description: Seriously???!! Just like my grandma made. Carnitas tacos polo con Chile Rojo and pinto beans. Busy for Dia de los Muertos but the staff worked it out!!
author: Leslie D.

description:
I went to El Metate recently for a veggie burrito minus cheese & sour cream w/ guacamole. You pay first & take a seat. They call your number & bring out your food. There is also complimentary chips & a salsa bar.

The salsa bar was quite alright & loved the mango salsa which was unique. The veggie burrito was solid & feature a lot grilled veggies including broccoli, carrots, & zucchini. 

The only caveat was they forgot to put guacamole on my burrito so mentioned it & they gave me a side of guacamole which I appreciated. The same thing happened recently at Pancho Villa & they corrected it in a similar fashion.

Besides the salsa bar there is also a wall of assorted hot sauces bringing me nostalgia of burrito spots I used to frequent in the day. 

I have been to so many burrito spots in the Mission now & there are still so many more I have yet to visit.
author: Shane S.

description: Over hyped .. the owner treats you like s### when you walk in  he messes up orders. Food is overpriced and doesn't taste fresh .. everyone there working looks upset .. we went there for a very long time ... never going back
author: Loli S.

description:
I used to frequent this place when I worked in the area and somehow forgot all about it...until about 7 years later when my cousin moved into the neighborhood and led me here again a week ago or so. As soon as I entered I saw the familiar menus posted and immediately recalled how delicious this place used to be! I hoped not much had changed in 7 years and ordered a chicken quesadilla. IT WAS FANTASTIC. Hefty, wet, flavorful, and satiating. How could I have forgotten this place??? Also, if you can't handle spicy you should try the green salsa. Yum. 

I'll be back.
author: Kristy F.

description: Uninspired dishes. Funky curd cheese in and on the cheese enchiladas swimming in an oily red sauce.  Second and last visit. Thankfully the rice and beans, guacamole and chips were edible.
author: Tony S.

description:
El Metate is located a short distance from San Francisco General Hospital (I'm not sure I'll ever get used to adding Zuckerberg in that name), so it was a popular place for Mexican food for my friends and I when we worked nearby.  They offer typical Mexican menu items including tacos, burritos, quesadillas, etc., and during lunch time, it can get quite busy.

There's outside seating and a huge indoor area with wide tables, which can make it great if you are eating with a small or large group of people.  I tend to get tacos at other places in the Mission, but El Metate is my go-to for carnitas burritos.  The flavor of the pork is stupendous, hitting various savory notes without being too salty.  They have a variety of salsas to try, and you get a bowl of complimentary chips before your meal arrives.
author: Keith H.

description:
The 5 stages of eating a burrito at El Metate:

Stage 1: Frantic excitement
First-timers: You've read the reviews. The hype is too high now. It's time.
Regulars: You're about to spend time with a loved one--a burrito at El Metate. You remember what it's like to be with them, and you can't get anymore excited than RIGHT NOW.

Stage 2: Euphoric digestion
You've taken the first bite. You're eating the burrito. This is it--it's happening. You don't even understand why it tastes this good. It's a dream come true.

Stage 3: Fear of losing your [burrito's] composure
In the last quarter of your burrito, you realize this is a temporary event, and/or that your burrito might fall apart over your plate. What are you going to do? Is it going to maintain its composure? Will you maintain yours, when you've rid of this food? This will end soon.

Stage 4: Unbelievable victory
Wow, you really finished that didn't you? That was impressive. Their burritos are massive--nice job, no really.

Stage 5: Serenity (a), or panic (b)
5a. Your heart is beating at the minimum resting BPM now. You're completely satisfied. Absolute serenity. That was a GOOD burrito.
5b. Okay that was a LOT of food that you shouldn't have eaten all at once, maybe you're panicking a bit now. That was definitely a take-half-for-leftovers kind of meal. This place in no way sacrifices quality for quantity, or vice versa.

---

Stages aside, you will enjoy your burrito here. I've also found that in terms of maintaining its composure and ability to be eaten, this is one of the most efficacious (and tasty!) burritos I've ever had. So regarding my stage 3: I was losing my composure that it was ending.
author: Nick C.

description:
Such a gem of a restaurant!!! This is where to go when your friends say, "let's get Mexican in the Mission". Nothing on the menu will disappoint you. From the chips to the many salsas to the burritos to the enchiladas, every menu item is authentic and delicious. 

The tables and outdoor seating are lovely with their colorful, bright painted designs. The service is fast and they're so friendly. 

Highly recommend!!!
author: Sela B.

description:
Great fruit salsa and great choices on the salsa bar -- eight in all. 

It's really inexpensive. My total including tip for a cheese enchilada dinner with horchata was about fifteen bucks. 

Came here from San Francisco General. Saw a horde of people in scrubs going in which I considered a good sign. It was 11:30 and we were the first in but it filled up before I left. You order at a counter as you enter. It's cramped. Then you go to the dining room which is bright and airy and features a large communal table. There are smaller tables too. Overall not as large as it looks from outside. 

I played it safe with cheese enchiladas in red sauce (my favorite) but it's an extensive menu with the ubiquitous burritos but also tamale plates and abundant quesadilla choices. 

Food was very good. Plenty of cheese on everything. Sauce had a kick. Guacamole had good flavor. Rice was on the dryer side but went well with the refritos I chose. 

But the fresh salsas really stood out. 

Excellent horchata. 

They also had Mexican wedding cakes for dessert. I was tempted.
author: Tim P.

description: Great spot to grab a quick lunch. You order at the counter and then they bring your food to your seat. I got the carnitas quesadilla ($9), which came with guacamole, sour cream, and salsa on the side. It was delicious! The quesadilla was a large potion size and could have been split into 2 meals for me. The tortilla was a tad greasy, but it was packed with an ample amount of tender carnitas that were not too salty or fatty. It was very enjoyable. They also give you free chips and salsa to enjoy with your order.
author: Amy C.

description:
I'll give them a 5 star. Started off as a 3 because the staff wasn't so friendly, Slightly pricey  & table by the cooler wasn't level causing my food and drink to wobble uncontrollably, but I took action and moved to another table 
Then had my enchiladas and Taco which was good. Suggest sauce on the side because it overpowered the taste of the food. Then what got it a 5 was the homemade chips salted nicely. 
The decor is also very nice and is clean. Clean, Clean, Clean is always 
Key.
author: Kenny M.

description:
I wasn't expecting much from this little joint, but I was very pleasantly surprised! I ordered a torta with carnitas and it was honestly amazing. The bread was perfectly toasted, the jalapeños added the right amount of kick and the meat was exquisitely crisp on the edges. It also came with a small cup of tortilla soup topped with fresh avocado! 

My next visit I went for a bowl of the soup on its own. At a mere $6, it's a heck of a bargain jam-packed with chicken, avocado and overall flavor. The salsa bar is also pretty extensive! 

This place is a gem off the beaten path of Mission District but well worth it -- the staff are friendly, the price is right and the atmosphere is somewhere between a sit-down spot and a taqueria. Definitely recommend for a lowkey lunch, casual dinner or quick snack!
author: Alex K.

description:
The food itself was pretty good. We enjoyed the cheese enchilada, refried pinto beans and rice. The nachos were good but soggy. I would not recommend ordering them for delivery. Another weird thing is the vegetarian nachos contain odd vegetables like broccoli, zucchini and carrots. First of all, we asked for no vegetables but they included. If you're goin to add veggies, it should be something like grilled onions and red bell peppers. 

The cheese enchiladas were good. A bit spicy but not too hot. We asked for no sour cream but it was served on the side. Skimpy on guacamole. We asked for jalapeño on the side but didn't get any. No salsas included. I think the food is decent but you're probably better off eating at the restaurant. Avoid delivery.
author: Rude G.

description: Came here last night for dinner and must say I enjoyed this little hole in the wall. The chips they had here were a little different than usual as they were a little thicker. I started out my night with a margarita which was delicious although I do wish it was a little stronger. For dinner I ordered the steak taco and the carnitas tacos. In my opinion the steak taco was okay but I did enjoy the carnitas taco. The carnitas taco had a mix of fatty meats and was crispy so the flavor really stood out there. Overall a decent spot to try out. Definitely worth it for the prices and quantities.
author: Prasiddha H.

description:
I used to live across the street from here and loved their tacos and burritos.

I moved out of the city awhile ago, and today I decided to treat myself to a burrito since I  was in the area.

I kid you not, there was a F**CKING METAL SCREW inside of my burrito. Yes, the kind that you screw into furniture and walls, etc. Disgusted. Not only did i almost lose my front teeth and get hep, I honestly could have choked and died.

I'm sad I have to write this but it's a health hazard. I have no idea where this screw has been and if there were other metal parts that happened to fall into their ingredients :(
author: Mia H.

description:
Awesome Burrito. I got the veggie and was worried it might be watery, but it was great and the vegetables added a nice crunch.  Probably the best burrito I've had in San Francisco.

Given the high yelp rating, I thought he place would be packed. But very short line and ample seating at 12:45 on a Saturday. 

Only complaint was the small, awkwardly placed tv--not good for viewing the World Cup game that was on.
author: Umesh J.

description:
This is my go to for quick takeout, but the dining room ambiance is so lovely that I should stay to eat more often. I love the brightly colored walls and decorations! The Mission is full of wonderful Mexican restaurants, but if you're looking for a lovely place to dine in that makes you forget that you're in dreary Sf, el Metate is your spot. 

The food is very solid. My go to is usually an Al Pastor Torta, which comes with their delicious chicken tortilla soup. They're on Eat 24 so I'll order it on the way and have it ready to go by the time I arrive.
author: Sara M.

description: SUPER yum shrimp burritos - totally recommend! Staff here is always friendly, helpful, and smiling. My boyfriend and I love coming here after the climbing gym as everything always tastes fresh. For sure one of the better places in the Mission to satisfy your cravings.
author: Megan M.

description:
My friend and I both got food poisoning after eating at El Metate. 

It pains me to write this review. Since living in the Mission, I've been a loyal El Metate customer, often eating there twice a week. I believe it's the most accessible and date-takeable taqueria in the Mission. The food's also incredible. But food poisoning is not, so I had to write this review--even though it hurts. 

Thanks, El Metate. It was good while it lasted.
author: Bob G.

description:
I live in the mission, so I've had my fill of just about every mexican place in the neighborhood.  El metate is a bit further than Taqueria Vallarta and El Farolito for me, but every now and then I'll find it worth the walk.

This is a real mom 'n pop mexican joint, which looks like it's been around forever.  It's clean, and they have a much larger menu than the typical burrito place.  I'd recommend taking advantage of that by trying one of their specials or more traditional burritos.  Their carne asada is no better than Farolito, and their carnitas is probably not quite as good as Cancun.  But their chicken mole isn't to be found at either of those places.  Nor is their delicious fruit salsa.
author: Thomas R.

description:
As if you can get a burrito wrong...well actually, you can! Good thing El Metate is on it with the money and making burritos and other Mexican food favorites. And they're GREAT at it! It's no wonder the line is always out the door with folks trying to get into the cozy restaurant. Let's just say I'm glad they expanded to accommodate their growing fan base.

So back to their food. And yes, that burrito in particular. It has all the right things and all in the right combination: not too much beans or cheese, but just enough guac and rice. Sin crema? No problema! I also feel that their burritos aren't as greasy and the ingredients are a bit fresher than some of the other tacquerias. You can place an order via phone to go (my favorite), and it is actually ready by the time you arrive. Staff are pretty friendly and good. I also like how I can see the magic happening right before my eyes.

My other favorite thing about this place is the salsa bar. It's delicious! They also have a little variety of desserts. I finally picked up the Mexican chocolate and it was delicious! Nice and moist, yet good flavor  and a super subtle hint of chocolate. 

Definitely my go-to place for all things burrito and Mexican! Just be forewarned: parking sucks, so unless you're up for a ticket or like to waste time looking, I highly recommend public transportation or a car share service. You can also walk from downtown (why not get a little workout in before you stuff your face). Then again, the food is so good, the ticket may be worth it!
author: Tracy T.

description: So good. Burritos are as good as all but the best taquerias! Salsas are all amazingly on point! Beers are cheap enough to buy a couple!
author: Zachary T.

description: El Metate is a casual spot on the outskirts of The Mission. You order at the counter and seat yourself. Be sure to help yourself to the delicious salsa bar. They even have 2 variations of salsa verde which is my favorite. My go-to when I try a new place is a Carne Asada Burrito. Their version is long and slender rather than girthy but don't be fooled because it will really fill you up. Prices were fair and you can add cheese, sour cream, and guac for only $1 more. I loved my burrito but my friends got the Veggie Burrito which just had some frozen veggies thrown in. They liked it but it definitely didn't seem as good a vegetarian option as other places offer. Come for the meat and a classically good Mission burrito.
author: Morgan H.

description:
Too busy enjoying the chicken tamales to write a long review.   

Incredible flavors.  Authentic recipes.   Generous portions.   
Don't miss this spot!
author: Camille H.

description:
Passing the brightly colored restaurant, I spied one diner on the outside tables who had a rather succulent looking sandwich. I had come expecting tacos or burritos, common with Mexican restaurants in the Mission, but this looked like a welcome alternative.  It was a torta, filled with juicy pork, avacado, cheese...moist thick bread. I am never going back to cubanos!! This is one of the best sandwiches you can get. 

Oh, the chips delivered before the meal... Bright colors, puffy... mixed with regular corn chips. Help yourself to a variety of salsas.
author: Roopinder T.

description:
This is really cheap but tasty Mexican food!

I've tried the carnitas burrito with refried beans and the chicken enchiladas with black beans and red / green sauce. The carnitas meat wasn't too dry it had a nice fried outside but was still juicy on the inside. It was proportioned pretty well with the other ingredients such as the rice beans and all the other vegetables they put in it like tomatoes etc. They have some sauce in the burritos that add an extra kick that makes it pretty good.

The chicken enchiladas was pretty standard. It doesn't blow my mind, but it hits that spot when I'm craving enchiladas. I think I like my enchiladas cooked a bit more. It seemed a bit soggy when I was eating it.

I would prefer bigger portions here, but I guess I can't complain because it's cheap, though I've seen cheaper burritos elsewhere. this place has good vibes and feels very authentic when you walk in. They also have a nice seating area that's kind of small, so it's usually packed and there seems to be a line fairly often.

I'll definitely keep coming back here!
author: Christopher L.

description:
Just a typical San Francisco Mission-District Mexican place, nothing special. I ordered a burrito, but it was very bland and boring, seemed to be only rice and the meat. No, I didn't want sour cream or guac, but that's it?

My biggest complaint is, they advertise sides on the menu over the cashier at .75 cents, but on the receipt it showed up as $1.00. Not a major deal, but if you advertise something at a given price, charge the customer that price, not a higher one later. I believe this is illegal, even over .25 cents.

Anyway, the chips were very good. Burrito was mediocre.
author: James D.

description: They started us out with delicious corn and flour multi-colored tortillas. The cashier was very friendly and patient. They have a salsa bar with lots of homemade salsas. Our food came out with in minutes and was delicious and warm. Some of the best Mexican food we've ever had. They also have a cute little bar with a cantina sign on the front. Definitely a go to for the mission district in San Fran.
author: Opal B.

description:
Not sure how this place has good reviews!
They literally pulled out some precooked chicken and warmed it up on a flat top, then served us super watery guacamole and sour cream over our taco salads. It wasn't delicious... I stopped eating mine but my brother finished his and suspects he'll have diarrhea. Seriously. 
On the upside, the decor was cool. Nice paintings.
author: Roo K.

description: Carne Asada burrito was amazing (I did no beans and added guacamole and did a size of cheese) chips are a little weird but still fun to munch on since they have a salsa bar and a whole bunch of hot sauces. A little weird that you walk into the kitchen to order and then seat yourself in a different room but food came fast and was delicious. I came here on the recommendation of a friend who lived in San Fran for awhile and he was not wrong it was very authentic and a great mission burrito.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
El Metate is highly underrated when it comes to Mission taquerias. 

Big fan of the veggie super burrito (it has broccoli!) and the carnitas taco plate. Salsa bar is legit. 

I also love that they have a loyalty program through the Belly app. It's nice to get a free burrito every now and then!
author: Amy L.

description: A good local Mexican food joint (seems popular for lunch).  Definitely come here for the food (pork and carnitas tacos were quite nice) vs. the ambiance (not much to speak of)
author: Nikhil G.

description:
This place is about 8 minutes walking distance from my work, hence the frequent visits!

They HAVE Huge portions! My favorite is the the quesadilla ( both steak and chicken). It is super flavorful, flour tortilla was super crispy, and they put the sour cream, guacamole, and tomatoes on the side which is EXCELLENT. Prices are really affordable for such great quality.

I love how they provide you free chips and they have a variety of sauces for you. I love the most upper left sauce because it taste like watermelon:p.
author: Josie H.

description: 3 stars bc it was not bad not phenomenal and they forgot to add the sour cream we paid for
author: Genica R.

description: Just another Mexican joint in the mission! I'm giving it 4 stars and not 5 because I am from Los Angeles and the food doesn't compare but it's still delicious! Service is fast and friendly and the decor of the restaurant is so colorful and vibrant. There are many hot sauces/salsa to choose from and you know the place is the real deal when they offer all those different sides in the salsa bar. The portions are fairly large and you get a bang for your buck. It was my first time trying a chicken red mole enchilada and the flavor was very different and distinct. Although I really enjoyed it, my bf did not have the tasting palette for it. He's more of a simple burrito type of dude and I believe that it's just one of those types of foods where some people like it and some people don't. He ordered the carne asada burrito and said it was OK and average. What we both enjoyed was the chicken tortilla soup and I can't wait to come back for another bowl. We spent $30 flat on a carne asada super burrito (3.5/5 his rating), chicken red mole enchilada (4/5), and a large chicken tortilla soup (6/5).
author: Anastasya S.

description: Worst burrito I've ever had. Way too dry, no sauce in it. We ordered delivery and it was 24 minutes late and didn't come with any sauce. Can't believe this place has a 4 star rating.
author: Lorenzo G.

description: The service here is terrible. They aren't willing to make the smallest of substitutions (i.e. a bean and cheese enchilada for a vegetarian). Also after we paid a $20 bill and forgot to order drinks they wanted to charge an extra fee for a "small charge". What?!?
author: Lopa D.

description:
The absolute best taqueria in San Francisco 
Possibly
The 
Whole 
World.......

I love you el metate! 
Keep the tortas comin!
author: Chung L.

description: I was looking for a snack and stopped here for a taco. Tacos are $3.50 each. Everything is served with a side of chips- even single tacos (which is nice of them). I got the carnitas taco, and it was pretty dang good- served with a few pickled carrots and a sauce that really punched up the flavor! $5 credit card limit. Lots of table space for large groups.
author: Ricky D.

description:
Went here on Friday 9/15/2017 with my teenage son and husband.  We expected a sit down restaurant but you had to order then sit.  My total bill was $36.00 
And our food was terrible it tasted like everything came out of a can. 
The chips were stale and tasteless tasted like it was cooked in Lard.
When we left my husband stated never again.
author: Jay S.

description: This place is disgusting they lied about delivery they do not do delivery do not waste your time and call this place. When I told them that you're advertising delivery on Yelp they said go call Yelp and get food from there.
author: Mohamad S.

description:
The ENTIRE CREW at El Metate are great people.  Everytime I go, they welcome me with such warmth and enthusiasm.  
Pros: I've tried everything on the menu!  All delicious! Fresh ingredients, made to order.  They're patient even with the most pickiest people.
Cons: Limited parking space, dining area layout.
Overall: I highly recommend this taqueria above any in SF.
author: Ítala P.

description: One of the best taquerias in the Mission. Fresh ingredients and delicious homemade salsas. Highly recommend the fish tacos, Al pastor burritos and chicken nachos. Also, be sure to try the cucumber mix at the salsa bar if they have it.
author: Carlos S.

description:
I don't understand all the positive reviews that are written about this restaurant. I came here based upon these reviews and we were sorely disappointed. One thing that the restaurant does right is the ambience and salsa bar.  The salsa bar had cucumber salsa and fruit salsa, which I liked. None of the salsas are spicy, so if you are looking for authentic  spicy Mexican salsa, you'll be disappointed.
Moving onto the food - we had the vegetarian burrito and vegetarian quesadilla.  Both of these dishes had the same exact vegetables - mostly carrots, and some zucchini, green cabbage. Surprisingly the supposedly "grilled" veggies were actually raw and not seasoned. I don't know why the menu board says grilled vegetables when they use raw veggies.  I've never had a veggie burrito or quesadilla with raw crunchy carrots zucchini and cabbage before.   Texture is just wrong. Sadly the quesadilla had hardly any cheese. So eating a cheese-less quesadilla with raw crunchy veggies was highly unpleasant. And so was eating burrito with raw unseasoned veggies. I would definitely not go back. By the way, unlike most of the burritos in the Mission area, this burrito was small and skinny - basically not enough portion for a hungry soul.
author: Priscilla P.

description: El Metate is one of my favorite restaurants there food is always so so good , fresh and delicious...
author: Fabiola V.

description:
They already have 999 reviews, so for their thousandth I thought it would be very important to echo the sentiments of literally hundreds of other people. 

This (or maybe La Espiga de Oro) is the most slept-on out of the top-tier Mission burrito spots, it is right up there with La Taq, Cancun, and El Farolito in my opinion. We go here for work lunches a lot because they can usually accommodate big groups, we are often surrounded by gaggles of nurses from SF General. Whether you consider that a good or bad thing may depend on your relationship status. Decent street parking situation by Mission standards. 

For the thousandth time, people, El Metate is comfortably in the upper echelon of SF burritos, don't sleep (especially on the mole)!
author: Trav W.

description:
Popped by El Metate last Saturday night because I was looking for some casual, quick Mexican food before a big night out on the town. It's all about laying that base layer. Ya dig? 

I opted for the carnitas verde burrito and was not disappointed. The best part, the tortilla. All great burritos start with an even better tortilla and El Metate's was clearly home made. A free basket of chips with every order, and a great salsa bar are also mainstays at this place which is greatly appreciated. 

You order/pay at the front (before you enter the sit down restaurant), so it makes the experience pretty seamless. I was with a big group (9 of us) and they easily accommodated our crew at one of the larder tables. If you find yourself on the eastern part of the mission district I'd say it's definitely worth a visit.
author: Benjamin F.

description: The best chips and salsa in the world. (I do not say this lightly). The chicken burrito is insane and always memorable. Never change El Metate!!!!
author: Jasmine V.

description: Best veggie (vegan/vegetarian) burrito tied  in SF with Papalote. Roasted delicious veggies and best tortilla around. Guac is always fresh. Salsas are good. I also like the vibe of the restaurant itself which is cute and causal. It's comfortable to sit and not too loud. Service is fast.
author: Ilana A.

description:
Came here on a Sunday evening with a friend, and was quite a lively place. As you walk into the place, you are greeted with their ordering area with the open kitchen and then the menus up top. As you walk it in it does feel to be a little cramped, although there is an another section that provides seating.

From the first glance, prices seem to be quite reasonable, and there are a lot of options as you would come to expect out of a Mexican food place.  I ended up going with their daily special with Chicken Red Mole sauce coupled with a side of chips and guacamole. My friend ended up getting the tamales with a steak burrito. 

Upon sitting down, there is cutlery and also sauces on the side of the chips. We ended up trying most of the sauces and ended up with the spicy sauce to alternate with the guacamole. I do admit their guac is quite good and the fact that a pint could be purchased with 3 dollars so worth trying out. 

Upon receiving the entree, I was quite surprised with the portion that you receive. A portion of rice is coupled some salad + guac and refried beans. In the second plate is the entree being the mole. The mole was quite good. Flavourful with a bit of a thick chocolate taste with lots of sweetness which complimented the chicken well. The tamales had a bit of a citrusy taste which I appreciated a lot. 

Overall I would say this place would be a 4 out of 5 for the overall experience. Good seating with good guacamole some really gnarly tamales and some nice thick mole sauce.
author: Frank O.

description: late evening at work? meeting some friends? coming back from a road trip and can't be arsed to cook dinner? El Metate is THERE with their dependable burritos, fresh salsas, and quick service.
author: E. T. C.

description: If burritos like this existed in Mexico, this is what they would taste like! Walking up to the place I smelled Mexico and inside I heard and felt Mexico. The shrimp burrito was awesome!
author: John D.

description:
Awesome Mole, the meat isn't that great here other than the mole, but if you're craving some mole definitely come over and try it here!

It has a nice ambience, but parking is near impossible, so make sure to give yourself enough time!
author: Andrew T.

description: Love this place. Fresh vegetables, crispy and delicious burritos. Quick and fairly inexpensive.
author: michael s.

description: The best vegetarian burrito in the city!! It actually has vegetables instead of just a regular burrito without the meat. They also cook their vegetarian rice without chicken stock. Seems simple but it is very unusual. Also their salsas are fantastic and the staff is friendly and speedy and accurate.
author: Momo A.

description: This place was amazing and I highly recommend it. I got the flautas with an agua fresca (watermelon). The food was delicious, and the drink was sweet and very refreshing.
author: Ashley A.

description: Large servings, food was good (had a shrimp burrito with no cheese, guacamole or sour cream but added veggies) but didn't have the "wow" factor for me (wasn't as flavorful as I was expecting. Loved the complimentary chips. The location is great and I enjoyed the interior decorations. I'll be coming again!
author: Devika P.

description:
Happy to be the 1000th reviewer!

Really loved that they had seating so you can enjoy your burrito. I got the streak burrito and thought their rice was better than the rice at other burrito joints. I really wish they grilled the burrito after it was wrapped. 

Free chips & salsa were a great addition.
author: Jackie W.

description: I am a big fan of Mexican food and this place is amazingly traditional Mexican restaurant I very much enjoy my meal very cheap which in San Francisco it's not easy to fine high-quality for cheap price the staff are extremely nice and clean very Careful and understanding I will definitely come back
author: Aviad B.

description:
I ordered a chicken burrito and it came half hot and half cold - obviously this was pre-made and not freshly cooked.  I let the restaurant know and they started arguing with me! Finally they said that's how they serve a burrito!
Its only because I wanted to return the burrito because it was below my expectation did they finally decide to heat it up!!
There are a lot of taquerias in the Mission, and I certainly do not need to repeat this experience!
author: K W.

description:
First and foremost, probably hands down, the best chips and salsa I've ever had from a taqueria, ever, move aside Papalote. Chips were so good and crispy, just plain, but the pico and salsa that comes with it, crazy delicious. I'll come back especially for that.

Ordered two burritos, fish and chicken Milanese, the portion sizes and prices were great as well. I've seen other reviews complain about the girth etc, but it's just long. If you want a bigger burrito, head to chipotle. But we found them  lacking in flavor and  kind of dry. But definitely want to give it a 2nd try
author: Danny V.

description: Delicious food and friendly service. This is authentic Mexican food, full of flavor. I ordered the torta de asada and it was perfect and filling. It even came with a little caldo on the side. The ambiance is in the style of typical Mexican restaurants.
author: Sam D.

description:
Upon my knowledgeable cousin's proclamation that El Metate has the best burrito in San Francisco, my family opted to give it a shot over the Vietnamese meal we were originally planning on having. I'm so glad we did. It's an order at the counter, find a table and they bring it to you kind of establishment and the options are plentiful. Took a lot not to opt for something other than a burrito.

I can see how parking could be an issue, but we managed to find something fairly quickly at 6:30pm on a Sunday. The restaurant was decently packed, but there was still plenty of seating for our group of four after we ordered. The staff was friendly and helpful and made our experience very pleasant.

I ordered the chile verde burrito, which was skinny, but sizable, delicious, and completely filling. My boyfriend went with their special chicken mole burrito. I'm not usually a fan of mole, but the flavors were subtle and yummy. My mom went off-burrito and opted for the chile verde tamale, which was served with rice, beans, guac and sour cream and was possibly the best dish of them all. The free chips are excellent - an interesting mix of regular corn, sweet potato, and veggie. The salsas are all fresh and tasty as well. Can't even choose a favorite!

My dad gauges Mexican restaurants on their ability to deliver a solid carnitas burrito and I am bummed to say he was sorely disappointed. Having had a bite of his, I am with him. The carnitas was dry and chewy, the burrito lacking in the same bold flavors the rest of the food we ordered had in spades.

I guess the takeaway is that you should go bold with your choices. Maybe they just don't do basics quite as well. Regardless, if I'm back in the Mission and looking for Mexican I would probably stop here again.
author: Erin O.

description:
Really decadent and amazing burritos. Full of traditional mission burrito goodness and definitely enough for a full meal. Fresh and delicious. Free chips and a variety of salsas are a plus.

Really nice environment, friendly staff.

Nice next-door seating but really challenging to park.
author: Bob K.

description:
Fresh, delicious, and flavorful! 

Chicken mole is legit. It has a sharp flavor, as opposed to a deep/base flavor that you find with the more brownish moles. This one is red and vibrant, but complex and super yummy. 

Shrimp tacos are fresh and have lite spice. The shrimp are plump and cooked perfectly.

No bar/cocktails, only beer and sodas, etc. The restaurant is small and is divided into two rooms; order at the counter in one room and sit in another and enjoy chips and salsa while you wait for them to bring over your meal. 

The chip basket is special. Go for the chips, stay for the large menu of yummy Mexican food.
author: Danielle J.

description:
Great environment and food. We went with a group and they were extremely accommodating. I had a carnitas burrito (which was great but felt slightly small) but the tacos looked incredible. Perfect place for a groups to go get a meal together! Would recommend everyone come here at least once if they're into Mexican.

The entrance where your order and grab your Pacifico beer is a little cramped so we queue from outside. 

I gave 4 stars instead of 5 because of the location. Not ideal as you have to walk a bit (and not through the nicest neighbourhood) from mission station.
author: Michael C.

description:
Awesome selection of tacos! I got 3 tacos, the carnitas in chili verde, al pastor, and pollo de rojos. All were very tasty! 

The order came with free chips and the salsa bar is off the hook! 5+ salsas available and most of a spicy kick. Kicked my sinuses back to chinatown. 

Would definitely come here again for the tacos and salsa. I hear the burritos and the nacho plates are great too! I'll have to try those on my next visit!
author: Andrew S.

description:
I ordered from grubhub.  They didn't have any agua frescas which I always order from the taquerias because fresh right out of the fruit drinks are soooo much tastier & nutritionally healthier than megasweetened sugar/water sodas.  Their prices were so low and their menu so short that I wondered if their food was tasty and served in decent portions although I did remember that restaurants with short menus prepare/cook their food better than ones with long menus.  And considering 214 customers gave it an average of 90% tasty, I went ahead and ordered.  Well, their portions are more than decent and the food was fresh and all tasted like a real home-cooked meal.  Their carnitas burrito was big length-wise and tightly wrapped and tasted like a real meal burrito with soft carnitas well-marinaded.  

Just my Pork in a Chile Verde Sauce nachos seemed like 2 meals with lots of meat, beans, avocados, lettuce, sour cream.  If I had just ordered the nachos, that would be enough to fuel me for the whole day!!  And again, it was fresh, the meat was soft, and the flavors all melded nicely together.  I liked their chips even though they weren't freshly cooked, especially enclosed in their "Chevy's-like arsty" looking paper.  In addition, their food is so well-presented, so well-organized.  This restaurant truly gives VALUE-laden mexican meals!!  I would definitely order from here again even without the agua frescas and even with the delivery fees!! For my agua frescas, I'll just remember to stop by a latino fruit/veg grocery beforehand to get some fruits and then use my juicemaker!!
author: Frugal C.

description: This is my go to Mexican restaraunt the food is great the staff is kind and it's so clean it makes me feel so warm and good just sitting here.
author: Janiele M.

description:
After our prayer walk at the Mission district we decided to look for a place to eat. I love Mexican food and can never get enough.  This place was open so we decided to try it. 

When you walk in you have to order first, find a txt and then they'll bring you your food. They have a rack full of different hot sauce. Yummy!  When I go back I'll try them all. 

Ambiance is casual. This place was crowded when we were there. Which was between 8-9pm. 

I had the fish tacos- plate came with two tacos. I very rarely eat rice so I asked if they can double up on the salad and guacamole. Guacamole was delicious. 

My friend had the carnitas and she said it was very good and just had the right spices. She opted to have rice and she said it was very tasty. 

Our other friend opted for the chicken tacos. He said he would definitely order it again. It also came w two tacos. Moist and spices just right. 

Worth a try if you're in the neighborhood.  

Enjoy!
author: Nerissa D.

description: How did this place go from a 4 star to a 1 star? The last time I came was in 2011, did they change the owners since then?? I remember the meat being soo tasty! I raved about it to a foodie friend and he trusted my taste. We went there today and it was sooo disappointing! We first asked can we get the nachos with the meat on the side and they said no. That's really odd, I would think when they assemble the Nachos they can just put the meat on a side plate instead of on top?..then we got our food, the burrito my friend ordered had barely any meat in it, all rice! My vegetarian friend got the vege burrito and they had broccoli in it, how weird. Then I got the taco platter that was underwhelming. Shrimp taco, shrimps were big and good, that was the only con. The carne asada is their most popular meat, SUPER DRY and flavorless!! Eeek! also the rice and beans were just meh! Never again, sorry.
author: Karen T.

description:
I have El Metate on speed dial so I am surprised I haven't written a review yet. They are a brisk walk away from work at Zuckerberg SF General, and I always call in ahead of time to avoid waiting for my order. That's a perk because calling in ahead of time is not available to a lot other taquerias around the Mission. I call in and they say takes 10-15 minutes, but I have called from a couple blocks away and my order was ready within minutes which is the best so that I can swoop my burrito and go back to work. There is sometimes a line out the door, but they have quick service.

Because of location, I have been here about 5 times and I always get the super shrimp burrito, so I can't speak on their other choices. The shrimp as everyone else reviewing says is "plump, juicy, tender, tasty." That is no lie-- the shrimp is large and flavorful. El Metate is not stingy on the shrimp either. Every bite is biting into shrimp heaven. They have good proportion with the other ingredients and they know how to wrap their burritos. Tortilla and chips are homemade. The guac and sour cream are on point, and the burrito has tasty rice and beans. Be sure to load up on salsa at the salsa bar. Their green and red salsas make me sweat and I think I have a pretty good spice tolerance. I'm thinking ghost pepper?

They have good ambience for a sit down, and straw umbrellas on the outside for lunch in the sun with a burrito.
author: Jaime F.

description: Be ready for a party in your mouth when you go here. The shrimp tacos are the best in the city. Also, the service is always good.
author: Aubree H.

description:
So I first learned of El Metate a few years back in an episode of KQED's Check Please Bay Area. I was impressed by the episode, and by the diners' reviews on the place, but it must have been at least two years until I tried the place (which I regret, and you're about to find out why). 

I first went to El Metate with a friend. We had randomly drove to San Francisco out of boredom (I personally love random adventures), and decided we were hungry. I immediately thought about El Metate, so we decided to go. Upon arriving, I was surprised by the size of the place--it seemed larger on TV. I don't put that against the place, after all I think it's just the right size. I ordered the tacos, and also a tamale on the side. It was excellent, and fresh! Sometimes you'll go to a Mexican-inspired restaurant (I refuse to call places that drown their food in grease and cheese "real" Mexican, because once you've had traditional you know what isn't). I feel El Metate can be classed as traditional. The one thing I regret is not having come here sooner, and also forgetting to try the molé! 

Bottom line: the prices are reasonable and you get a good amount of flavorful food. Their salsa options are amazing, and their flour tortilla chips are even more addicting that the traditional corn chips!
author: Zachary D.

description:
You certainly don't have to drag me to a semi-remote corner of the Mission for solid Mexican food. So when a friend asked me to meet him at El Metate for beer and burritos, I zoomed over in an Uber without hesitation!

And I'm so glad I did. El Metate is a good-looking Mexican joint with a decent amount of dine-in seating. We ordered our treats at the counter - a carnitas burrito for me, tacos for him - and grabbed a table. But wait! Don't forget to visit the salsa bar for a spicy complement to those awesomely thick tortilla chips they serve. Yep, these chips were made for scooping.

I really enjoyed my carnitas super burrito - the carnitas are finished off with a bit of crispiness which I love, and all the ingredients were evenly distributed. I also appreciated how cleanly and tightly they wrap their burritos. Clearly, they're pros!

I'd definitely drop an Alexander Hamilton here again.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
I'm a little horrified by what is defined as a taco here. I got the al pastor and fish taco, and the al pastor was okay (had some unpalatable meat parts in there), but the fish taco... it was a taco with rice and a piece of fried fish on it. What?! Doesn't that sound like a super dry and flavorless taco? Yeah, it was exactly how you'd imagine it to taste.

But... I heard so many good things that I went back. This time, I tried the burrito, since that's what SF Mexican food is known for. Decided on the mole chicken burrito, because the signs said it was homemade and amazing and blah blah blah. It was fine. The mole chicken was pretty tasty and I wouldn't mind just eating that on its own, but it wasn't evenly spaced throughout my burrito. That was annoying because I was happily enjoying all the meat upfront, only to be left with lettuce and rice at the end.

Probably the only things I liked about this place:
Close to where I lived
Takes credit card
Lots of seating
There's a good fruity salsa with melons in it.
Yeah, that's it.
author: Alice T.

description: I love Mexican food. And tried a lot of places in SF. My previous favorite was La Taqueria on Mission and 25th, but El Metate might be even better! The food is amazing - particularly the quesadilla with amazing cheese. Burrito was great too, and so were tacos. Plus $4 beer... amazing. Not sure if we got lucky - but it wasn't busy at all at 5:30pm on a Tuesday and we got seated and the food very quickly.
author: Senya T.

description:
I grew up in the mission a few blocks from this place and to my surprise have never been. Little did I know how much I was missing out on!

The Set-up: You walk in and order & pay first, then make your way over to the the next room where they will bring your food when ready.

They have a lot of options on their menu which is a good thing, but made it so hard to choose. I finally decided on the Mole chicken Enchiladas and my gf ordered the pork green salsa tamale. Let me just say WOW! It had a been a while since I tasted an authentic, delicious mole sauce. The portions are very generous. Extra points for that. They serve your food on these huge plates and of course it  wouldn't be a Mexican dish without the rice, beans, avocado, sour cream, and small salad on the side. My Gf's tamale was also amazing! The food is authentic, fresh, tasty, and reasonably priced. 

Salsa Bar & Chips: Their salsa bar is where it's at! They have several green, red, and pico de gallo choices and their chips are thick and fresh. 

I will definitely be coming back and excited to try other things on the menu but if you ever need to satisfy that mole craving, Metate is the place.
author: Alexander L.

description: This place saved my birthday this year! After having a disappointing experience at another restaurant we ended up at El Metate and DANG. My tacos were delicious and generously portioned. The sauces for the chips (especially the green one) were amazing and the conveniently boxed desserts were incredible. A+ experience!
author: Katie C.

description:
SUPER DELISH! Met up with a friend here for dinner. I had the steak quesadilla with horchata and she had the chicken quesadilla with some kind of watermelon juice.

But first - the chips and salsa!! They have normal tortilla chips and these amazing, thicker chips that are so yummy. The standout was their mango salsa (along with the rest of the salsa bar) - OMG the mango salsa had some cantaloupe in it, too. I don't know what it was, but I just could not get enough of the salty, sweet, spicy salsa. Oh *drool* I need to go back and get some now!!

Both quesadillas were outstanding. Large portions, but I still finished because it was so delicious. I also really loved the horchata - it was so much creamier and tastier than I've ever had...almost rich in flavor. Needless to say, I was sad when I was full because I would have loved to have eaten more :)

I will return!! Must try their tacos, burritos, and tortas
author: Charissa L.

description:
Been coming here for years and finally think it's time to write a review about this little gem that's located off the beaten path in the Mission. And yes, not all of the great Mexican restaurants are located on Mission, Valencia, 16th or 24th streets...

This place started off as a small single entry way hole in the wall over 10 years ago that was known at the time for having one hell of a quesadilla with multi colored chips. It has since expanded down the block to where the corner store was located at 22nd and Bryant streets. Now there is plenty of seating and the menu is packed full of authentic dishes from Chicken Molé to Platillo Del Mar. 

I personally am a huge fan of the Carnitas as it is seasoned and cooked to perfection and the tossed on the flattop to crisp up prior to being served in the "vehicle" of your choice... I typically smash down the block with a super burrito and I always think why don't I come here more often? Yes it is tough to park in this neighborhood as well as it is all around the Mission but if you circle a coupe times you will usually find a spot to park so you can enjoy your grub at your own pace. 

There is a small salsa bar located in the back that has more than enough options to please your palate. The chips they serve are like no others, there are your typical crunchy chips as well as what seem to be double fried pieces or strips of flour tortilla that are surprisingly additive. 

So when you find yourself heading out of the mission and that craving hits you don't think twice about heading over to El Matate, they won't steer you wrong. Keep on keeping on! We appreciate it!
author: Josh H.

description:
Nice interior and exterior
Extremely delicious food
Cheap
Big portion
Great service (though they often mess up your order here and there, but they will fix it right away)
Unlimited salsa (6 types!)


Deserves 5 stars!!
author: Vi N.

description: Another great spot! Man, you can't go wrong here. My favorite go to is the carne asada quesadilla! The food here is always fresh, you can taste the quality. Tacos, and burritos are a must here.
author: J M.

description: The people are amazing, but the food is to die for. Their chicken flautas and carnitas plate are incredible! Always made fresh, reliably good every time. This is my favorite place to eat in the Mission, and I will definitely be coming back!
author: Karolina P.

description: Small burritos for $8. The Carne asada burrito had very little meat --just a lot of rice filler. I seriously had 7 little pieces of meat in the entire burrito. As seen in the pic the veggie burrito had carrots and broccoli-very unconventional and not good. The chips were very oily and didn't taste fresh. If you want top burrito there are way better places on Mission St.
author: Derek I.

description:
Great food, salsas & service!  We offer order the burritos, but I had the special that day of red mole enchiladas for lunch which was awesome.

A few regulars were eating tortas with a side of soup that looked really good for those cold SF days.  Wasn't into the salsa with pineapple, but the one with cucumber was really good.  All others were basic and fresh.  Something for everybody!

I didn't notice this last time, but there is a skinny hall that leads to the adjacent dinning room.
author: simple g.

description:
Had dinner with my my mom and brother today. I ordered a fried fish taco and small tortilla soup. The fish taco was ok. I thought it was different that the taco had rice in it, not for me. THE TORTILLA SOUP! Yaaasss!! It was a homerun! The soup was brothy, flavorful and full of shredded chicken. What a wonderfully pleasant welcome to a very cold evening. 

My brother ordered the fried fish torta. It was ok, not bad just ok, but only because I was comparing it to the torta milanese my mother ordered which was hella good! The chicken was crispy and all the components just married perfectly together! I will definitely be back.
author: Ingrid J.

description:
As a burrito fan and native San Franciscan, I am often ashamed to say how stumped I am when people ask what my favorite taqueria is. Well, this might be it. I ate here 10 years ago, forgot where it was, then spent the next ten years wondering if it had all been just a dream.

Well, it's real. The burritos are delicious. The quesadillas are well-stuffed with lots of fat goodies. The mole is tasty and not too sweet. The meat is tender. The portions are generous and inexpensive.

Great stuff.
author: Abe D.

description:
Best. Damn. Burrito.

I need it rolled tight, with an even distribution of delicious ingredients, and that's what I get here. Carne asada super burrito, I'd eat it every day if I could. YUM. Also, their tacos and nachos are extremely satisfactory. LOVE the aguas frescas, I always get a large because I drink it in one sip.
author: Kerry S.

description: Been coming here for years now and it's grown on me. Upgrading!
author: Kazu O.

description: Unfortunately I have to write a bad review for this place while their food is decent. Their service lacks abundantly, I have frequent this place for about seven years and have always received decent and or passible service. But tonight as I went in for my super burrito I was sent away because I wanted to use two forms of payment. After this unfortunate encounter I will no longer be frequenting this establishment and will be taking my dollar to El farolito where the burritos are even better and inexpensive.
author: Jordan T.

description:
The perfect way to recover from a long flight and a wintery Midwestern Christmas?

Going to El Metate with your fellow burrito lover and enjoying your Pollo Con Chile Rojo burritos in the California sunshine.

There's no place like home!
author: Amy C.

description:
Choose. Fish. Burrito. 

The burrito, fried marinated fish, lightly breaded does the trick in flavors and perfect seasoning. I opted out the beans; preferred whole wheat tortilla. Great for lunch and enjoyed with hello,  chips and guacamole. 

Try it, it's prepared right in front of you as you wait. Located from a couple of blocks from ZSFG Hospital. No complaints here, El Metate SF.
author: Edgar M.

description: It's already too mobbed at lunch and dinner so stay away. Just kidding. my favorite Mexican in San Francisco.  Pretty much everything is great there.
author: Allan D.

description: Getting to meet the owner and learning a little about his rise to here and where the taste of his food comes from its really cool. Thanks again for the great meal can't wait to get the chicken enchiladas again!
author: Hunter I.

description:
This place is heaven. I have to check it out every time I visit San Francisco. Reasonably priced and delicious. Awesome variety of sauces. 
My favorite is their steak quesadilla. Strongly recommended.
author: Soroush R.

description: I don't know what to say here other than this place will RUIN Mexican food for you....and by that I mean after eating here you will compare every other Mexican food experience to this place. It is the best I've ever had. The burritos are rolled so tight I can barely unwrap them, taco plates are 2 feet wide, food is fresh and consistently amazing. I've been eating here for 7 years and it lives up to AND exceeds all the hype.
author: James A.

description:
My sister, who lives in the Mission, can't get enough of this place. 

I should probably give 4 stars for her since I didn't eat the food. I only really tried their salsas, which were fantastic and authentically hot. Chips are dismal though. Supermarket variety. 

For us, it didn't really work. We thought they were a bit more expensive than the average taqueria in the Mission. We ordered burritos and a torta here for my sister, husband, and mother-in-law. Then ended up going somewhere else for more veggie friendly eats. They do have fish and shrimp items at El Metate but they were quite pricey and the fish was fried. The torta was also pricey at $9.50, but then we realized when we came home with our booty that it also came with a side of soup. So not too bad. 

Apparently, they do have a pretty yummy veggie burrito so maybe we did miss out on a good thing. I still think they may be over-hyped. I did try a bite of my sister's torta, but it wasn't as good as the one I ordered for myself from Tortas los Picudos.
author: Nora S.

description:
Much smaller portions and rather more pricey than the Taquerias closer to Mission. My carnitas burrito was about 1/3 the size of one from El Farolito. Taste is nothing special, although food is presented nicely on fiestaware. I guess you're paying for a colorfully designed ambiance in a somewhat more upscale/convenient location? 

Go if you're in the neighborhood, not too hungry, too tired to head up the street to the Mission, and are feeling gray and need a color boost. 

Side note: Salsa bar was filthy and unkempt even while a Señora was prepping salsas 7 feet away!
author: Anthony B.

description:
What a refreshingly clean, spacious, authentic taqueria! We ordered a grilled steak burrito ($6), steak nachos ($6.50), and a strawberry agua fresca ($1.50). The grilled steak burrito wasn't gushing with oil or grease which is always a plus. I was a little sad that they didn't throw some tortilla chips on the plate with my burrito. The salsa bar is to die for. There are about 8 different bins and my favorite was the fruit salsa not spicy. It had chopped up tomatoes, cantelope, onions, and cilantro. 

The agua fresca was SO good. Not too sweet and you can taste the strawberry pulp. There was also horchata and watermelon agua fresca. Order your food and sit down "next door" or outside under the tiki hut seating.
author: Lauren K.

description:
When friends from back home in the South visit, I bring them here to ruin any future Mexican restaurant experience they may have back East!  

I heard about this little establishment on "Check Please Bay Area" and have not been disappointed so far.  It's in the Mission, so it has that street-cred...but it's a little out of the way, so it doesn't have all the extra foot traffic.  When it's busy, its because patrons specifically came in not because they wandered in randomly.  The food comes out quickly, and it's always on point.

Favorites are the carnitas, and the chicken mole (burrito, platter, enchiladas...any of them).  The last visit we went with the chicken mole platter, the pork tamales platter, and tacos al pastor.  Nothing was less than superb, and the only reason we had leftovers was because we were super stuffed.

My advice:  just go.
author: Josh M.

description: This place is great! I ordered catering for 15 people and they delivered a full taco bar with heating pans, utensils, and enough chips and guac for an army. They were so prompt and made the whole process super easy. The food is incredible, would strongly recommend
author: Kate F.

description: Great Mexican food, recommended by several of my friends. It's not a hole in the wall, so there is plenty of space to sit. Lots of options on the menu -- I recommend the al pastor tacos, chicken mole, tamales.
author: Sherry L.

description: This place has the best everything!  I love the veggie quesadilla because it actually has real vegetables in it like carrots and squash and the vegetables are always fresh and seasonal. The burritos and salsa bar are awesome as well and offer a lot of selection. The service is great. You just walk in and order, you can sit either in their reasonably large dining room or you can take a seat outside in one of their brightly painted table sets. The prices are spot on and they serve a pretty good selection of Mexican beers. I love coming to this restaurant because I always know I'm going to get something awesome, I could not recommend this place more.
author: Amanda G.

description: Having lived in the Mission for a little over 4 months now, I've had the opportunity to check out many of the renowned taquerias and other Mexican restaurants, and this has undoubtedly become one of my go-to spots.  Looking at the food, they offer a wide range of options, ranging from typical burritos and quesadillas to more niche offerings like platters, enchilladas, and tortas.  I'm particularly a fan of their pollo rojo (chicken in red sauce) burritos, but have also enjoyed their fish burritos (they use tilapia) and shrimp quesadillas.  The meals come with chips, which are okay - not the best among the mexican restaurants in mission, but they are boosted by the fact that Metate has a fresh salsa bar, from which you can take up to 3 types of salsa.  Outside of the food, the restaurant venue is quite nice if you are hoping to stay rather than ordering to go - colorful decorations, sometimes live music, and a decent amount of seating room.  Another nice benefit is that sets them apart from the taquerias is that they do take credit card, so you won't have to worry about not having enough cash.  Overall, quite a great place that I would recommend to anyone interested in authentic Mexican food from the Mission!
author: Curren I.

description:
Pretty good- but while there there aren't a ton of ways you can screw up a burrito, El Metate kinda did. My carnitas burrito with guac was super light on the guac and the meat was pretty low quality- I really wanted to like it here! 

They do have a great salsa selection though and give free chips with your meal. So, for $10 I was really full. May be worth a try, just don't go for the carnitas, though.
author: Melissah L.

description: Excellent, tasty food that doesn't feel that bad for you! I received a recommendation for this place from a local who pronounced it, "the best Mexican food in the city." I ordered the shrimp taco plate; the dish was a great value for the amount of food that you get. I really, really wish we had a place like this in New Mexico (New Mexican food just isn't Mexican!). Definitely make your way to El Metate next time you're in SF
author: Danielle D.

description:
This is my favorite place! Quite the staple of mine, their food always hits the spot. 
Every thing I have tried here is good. I think as long as I live in SF I will come to el Metate!
author: Mon B.

description:
In a city with mediocre Mexican, El Metate is a showcase. Their prices are rising, quality is going down, and now they have begun blatantly robbing people. My chicken burrito last night was charged as a "super" (guac, cheese, sour cream) plus extra "guac" (another order of guacamole on top of the super guacamole.) I protested at the register but the helpless chap said there was "nothing he could do about it" and to be "more careful ordering next time."  Well no tip for this guy. As this was a to-go order, you can imagine my dismay when I not only realized there was no "super" added, Ie: no cheese no sour cream, etc, but that my double order of guac was also very lacking and hardly noticeable, it was more like a dilute bit of green salsa instead of anything remotely resembling honest guacamole.  To add insult to the injury I asked for black beans but go pinto, no big deal. Lastly instead of a burrito with "light rice" I was given a monstrosity of mostly tortilla, lots of salty, dried rice, chewy chicken and beans. Thanks God for some decent spicy salsa so I could drown my crap food in heated spice. I was so pissed. 
El Metate: You are fired! I am never coming back. Sad to say after 10 years of patronage.
author: Brian J.

description: I don't understand the other reviews. I saw this restaurant on that show where 3 different people pick a restaurant to go to and they all review it after eating there. I had written it down in my phone and we made a trip into the city to eat here. I could not have been more disappointed if I tried. The chips were tired and tasteless to start. Myself and my daughter ordered the flautas since my daughter has celiacs and needed to avoid any gluten and my husband ordered a carnitas burrito. My son wasn't hungry and didn't order. The flautas were rock hard and burnt, the first bite my daughter and I both looked at each other and said "are you kidding me"? We love Mexican food so it's pretty difficult to make something we just won't eat. The beans and rice were as if they were microwaved. I couldn't see paying for two full plates we just were walking away from hungry so I went to find someone- anyone. I was ignored by the first two people I came in contact with and then I saw the man who had taken our order. I explained and he just kinda stared at me like "what would you like me to do?" I said perhaps I could order a burrito and then he walked away and never came back. After sitting a while and we were all wondering what was going on, I walked over with my family to the kitchen, register area, right then the man came around the corner with a burrito. I thought he would have let me choose what kind of a burrito? He had intended on charging for my daughters plate that she couldn't eat and giving me a burrito that I didn't choose so he could charge me for my plate I could not eat. Now I was mad. I said here's what I want since they clearly had no customer service! I do not want to pay for the two Burnt plates and I did not order the burrito he brought and I am not paying for that either. We had sodas and my husband had a burrito ( that wasn't very good) and that's what I paid for ($25.00) . We will not be back!!
author: Kristin H.

description:
Oh man that Mole is a nice combination of sweet and savory. I would get the plate instead of the Enchiladas though, more meat and straight on the boat instead of my slightly overcooked set. Everything on the side was solid.

The special chips (I think they require a minimum amount to spend, since only the couples at our table got them) are the best though. They're not your regular salsa chips but have wonton taste and texture to them. If you like Wonton's you'll love those multi-colored chips. 

The cake pop is meh. I'm not sure what I expected.
author: Rohan D.

description:
Had dinner here recently with my parents and it was a fantastic experience!

The restaurant is located in a nice quiet neighborhood which really gives it such a nice feel. The bright yellow exterior stands out and you know you are walking into something special and authentic!

The inside continues with the same allure as the outside, everything looks like you are in Mexico and the decorations are so homey it really sets the mood. The plates in front of everyone looked so delicious that we were struggling to decide what to get(its a pretty extensive menu!)

I settled on the Shrimp taco plate, my dad had the chicken enchilada plate, and my mom had the chicken tacos plate. We were all really satisfied and the shrimp were SO SO SO succulent and hugeeeeeee!!! It really was such a good shrimp plate and totally worth the money! The prices are so reasonable for the amount of food you get and everything was so tasty! We loved the salsa bar, some of them were to die for! So delicious!

Overall we had a very nice dinner and my dad commented before leaving..."We will be back soon." I definitely have no doubt!

Thanks El Metate!
author: Sadaf M.

description:
The salsa here is absolutely delicious. One with cucumber, one with cantaloupe (yeah, you heard me!). All with tomato. I might return just for that. In other news, the chips are a nice touch. Not too salty, not too oily.

Also of note, the burrito is a bit tortilla heavy. Like there's a line of folded tortilla running up the middle of the burrito plus a lot crammed in at the ends. Kinda gross when you first get it, but as leftovers it softens up. The carnitas are so so, tasty but not tender or particularly juicy. The rice is also kind of dry. A decent burrito overall, but let's be honest, this is the Mission, and we don't settle for decent burritos.
author: Andrew R.

description: Place was really popular. Several different types of salsas. It was an order then go sit down type of place but still very good. The shrimp quesadilla was so cheesy and amazing. Felt like I was actually in Mexico
author: Jack A.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised at this neighborhood Mexican restaurant in the Mission. You order first at the counter (the line was pretty long on a Friday night and many people order to go) and then they bring you your food next door at a relatively large eating area with many communal tables.  The ambiance is nicely decorated, perfect for groups. 

The prices were really good (SF standard not LA standard) and the quality of the food was also pretty good. I would not order the nachos again as I didn't like the mixture of chips (the home made ones were awesome but they also mixed in some crappy store bought ones too that seemed a bit stale) but the tacos were good (the shrimp one is pricey but yummy)

I could see myself coming back if I had a craving for tacos for sure.
author: Betty C.

description:
Simple, fast, delicious and appropriately priced. A little bit dirty but I like this restaurant because it is not trying to be anything it is not. 

PLUSSES:
There are plenty of options on the menu, plenty of seats indoors and out, a set of chips with every order, and a large spread of all you can eat salsas. 

I got my order in less than 5 minutes. 

MINUSES:
 Softshell chicken tacos. The flavor was not infused with the chicken and some it tasted like it was boiled and then flavored with watery sauce. Not good. 

I recommend this restaurant.
author: Drago F.

description:
what i ordered... super burrito with carnitas

...it had been over a decade since i last came here and there is no change whatsoever(except for that ipad look alike to process your payment), good food and nothing else. 

super burrito was of good size with good rice filling and good well seasoned carnitas.

ambiance... so-so (order area is cramped though with an ok size indoor dining area with dirty tables and a few tables outside)
service... bad (order taker was stoic)
cost... $ (fair)
author: Gors P.

description:
I'm a chips and salsa connoisseur. The chips and salsa are an A++. I gauge the grade on how satisfied I'd be without eating any entree and just eating chips and salsa.

I love getting the veggie burrito with Carne Asada and no beans. Only because their veggies are SO GOOD (broccoli, cabbage, carrots, and cucumber) in their burritos and their meat is excellent. Paired with salsa on every bite makes this place my favorite Mexican spot!
author: Jillian D.

description:
I took my partner here one evening and we got the same table in the far corner that I had before.  We placed our order and they brought everything to us.
We had the complimentary chips and sala and added guacamole.
I started with the chicken tortilla soup and it was great.  I ordered a cup but the bowl was much larger than I expected and I could not finish it.
For a main course, I had a simple cheese quesadilla which was perfect.  I was pretty full on the soup so I took half of the quesadilla home for lunch.
My partner had the platillo de mar which was filled with shrimp, clams, mussels, calamari and fried fish.  There was a lot of food but he managed to eat it all.
We had a watermelon and a pineapple agua fresca.  I liked mine but my partner thought his was too diluted.
I would return again. My partner is undecided.
author: Philip C.

description: Very good, fast, nice peeps, outside table! Ideal for sunny day brunch!
author: Sylvain K.

description: Love this place! It is not super crowded or congested like other taquerias on mission and it is still really good. The atmosphere is great and the people are super nice. One of my favs in the city and a great place if your craving Mexican food and wanting to avoid the hectic of the mission
author: Justin W.

description:
DELICIOUS MEXICAN FOOD IN A COZY, COLORFUL ROOM

Open the door and you enter what could be a cantina in Mexico with bright yellow walls, painted tables, fresh flowers, and whimsical crescent moons adorning the ceiling.

"Is this your first time here?" The charismatic owner asked as we entered El Matate. Before I could answer, he said, "Why don't you try our mole; it's homemade." He did not need to go any further, I was sold. 

We ordered the following:

Chicken Mole Enchiladas--The homemade mole had a deep, complex earthiness with just a hint of chocolate. The gigantic plate was decked out with guacamole, salsa, crema, rice, and refried beans. A very satisfying dish; I was ready for a siesta after finishing the generous portion.

Everybody seems to feel comfortable here. (Some feel a little too comfortable; a couple who seemed to have recently met sat intertwined on the same chair, another woman was practicing  yoga poses in her selvedge jeans, while a table of young tech tycoons freely disclosed their company's questionable customer tracking software.)

"Did you enjoy your food?" asked the proprietor as we left. "Yes, and I can't wait to return to try your fish tacos and nachos!"

Food:  A
Service:  A
Décor:  A
author: Rob L.

description:
Meh. 2.5 stars.

Overpriced, overrated.  Had the steak quesadilla, nothing to write home about. The other people dining seemed to be regulars and enjoying themselves.  Quality and service is just average.  With so many options nearby, I'd say pass.
author: c e.

description: Yesterday I was back at El Metate for the first time in over 6 months. Unluckily, my experience left a lot to be desired.
