My meal wasn't fresh and I found a small piece of plastic that hurt my gums. I was lucky I did not end with a chipped tooth. Quite disappointing for a place I used to love.
author: Joe M.

description: My favorite burrito in the City, possible ever... Chile Verde, with guacamole, no rice...
author: David F.

description: Fish tacos, tortas, and chicken tortilla soup are my usuals.  The torta is a pretty good deal (even after they raised the price).  For $7, you get a torta on dutch crunch bread with lettuce, avocado and your choice of fillings (fish, chicken, pork) AND a small chicken tortilla soup. I think it's one of the  best meal bargains in this area!
author: Drew R.

description: Dude, this is the closest to good mexican food that you're going to get in the Bay Area. It's so much more authentic, the salsa is so good, deserts are awesome, customer service is great. I see the same dudes after like months of not going by sometimes and they still greet me like I saw then yesterday. So cool
author: Francois D.

description:
Good , authentic Mexican food.
Got food here for a friend and my GF. Everything we had was yummy and fresh.

The concept is you go and order at the register, get your food and the next room has seating area where you can eat.
Pico de gallo is great and they also have several different chilies sauce. (and salsas)

Cheap and yummy.
author: Carolina M.

description:
I've been eating at El Metate for around a year and a half at this point, and it has never disappointed me! As a vegetarian, I find it difficult to get a satisfying meal when I go to a lot of Mexican restaurants (yes, quesadillas are delicious but I can only eat so many of them a month before I become a cheese woman); however, El Metate fills the void by offering amazing veggie tacos and a delicioso veggie burrito. 

Veggies included in El Metate's sauteed mix include carrots, broccoli (YES!), zucchini, onions, squash. Dishes also come with lettuce, fresh herb garnishes, and some spicy pickled veggies. What more, El Metate also serves up the main dish with rice and beans on the side. 

To top it off, this place has pretty tasty chips, a comprehensive salsa bar, and beer. Although Metate is a little pricier than some other joints in the Mission (veggie taco plate goes for around $10 - $10.50), you won't find better quality elsewhere.

For you meat eaters, my boyfriend likes the fish burrito and steak burrito. But he LOVES the chicken mole burrito, which is a special. Enjoy!
author: Zoe H.

description: My name is Gustavo I'm 7 years old.this place is awesome, the burritos are my favorite. I add rice, beans and guacamole to all of them!  The watermelon juice is the best to wash down the burrito with.  Make sure to say, Hi to victor for me :)
author: Gigi G.

description:
Delicious but definitely in the $$ price range. They've recently raised all prices so you're looking to spend along the lines of $10 - 15 for a meal of moderate portions. Parking in the area is really difficult but you might be able to snag a temporary spot to grab a meal to go.

Fish tacos here really are delicious! Light, fresh, and not overly oily. Add horchata and you're good to go. :)
author: Christina J.

description: disgusting horrible nasty cold ass burrito. nasty ass salsa just ugh throw the whole place away
author: Alexandria J.

description:
mediocre at best. Bayshore Taqueria by my house is the best Ive had in a while. i will say my al pastor burrito was bland at best. the most flavorful part of my meal was the salsa verde that comes with chips. sooo sad if u ask me. that part was the only positive thing I remember.

also service needs attention. I noticed the older gentlemen at the cashier went without a problem to grab a Jarritos drink for the customer in front of me who said hed take one along with his order, then when I ordered and said Id also take a bottle sangria and cupcake, hes like ' ok, can you grab your stuff' Im like  ' wow.. ok' i see how it is. 

el servicio del señor gordito moreno que tiene lentes/gafas necesita mucho trabajo!!! ay Dios mio! atendio al muchacho en frente mia porque era Huero y yo no? en serio? que lastima porque yo si queria venir aqui para comer para probrar todas la delicias que me habian contado de este lugar. que pena
author: Christina M.

description:
I love me some good gringo Mexican food and this place hits the spot. Especially notable are the chips ... mixed in with the tasty corn tortilla chips are some red, white and green flour tortilla chips.
Kid-friendly too :-)
author: Lisa T.

description: Ah one of my favorite burrito places in SF. Chile verde burrito with guac, cheese, and sour cream is my favorite and for only $8.50!! Be sure to try their green salsa with your free chips too
author: Kristie M.

description: Always yummy. I get shrimp burrito with veggies. They have black beans and a salsa bar.
author: Lauren S.

description:
To be honest, my last review of El Metate was biased. I really framed my experience with who I was at the time, which was a snob! I didn't have an appreciation for the simple things in life, especially ones for my taste buds. With that said, El Metate delivers on normal (in a great way of course). Their dishes have an elegance for what we should expect from Mexican food and the satisfaction of a good home-cooked meal.

So, if you're in the mood for something tasty, unpretentious, and just damn good, stop at El Metate. I recommend the fish burrito with extra fish. Sure, it's $11, but at least it isn't overpriced coffee and scones.
author: Frank Y.

description:
Parking situation is horrible but once you r here it's great! 
Be ready to decide and order as soon as arrive as order first and sit second.
Horchata is amazing and quite possibly the best we've ever had! Mole is also delicious and true to its "award winning"'description.
author: Rosanna M.

description:
I've only been here once and I wasn't super hungry, but that being said, I split a chicken quesadilla with a friend and it was 110% worth it. The price is great for the quality of food you're getting.

The people behind the counter were so friendly as well, I highly recommend this restaurant if you're craving some good Mexican food. I will definitely be back here again the next time I'm in SF.
author: Tiffany T.

description: This restaurant confuses me. The portions are huge, but I left feeling like I would have much rather gone to farolito/la taqueria. The food felt greasier than I was expecting. Carnitas taco had some good flavor though.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Enchiladas are delicious. Tacos are great. High quality ingredients. 

Most of the people that work here are super friendly... there's just this one guy, very big build, middle-aged, with glasses. He argues with everything you say, he's super unfriendly... I'm not sure if he owns the place or what, but he really shouldn't be working in the service industry....
author: Jake H.

description: This is my go-to taqueria.  The guys who work here are incredibly friendly and food is consistently good quality (solid menu with all the classics) and inexpensive.  Been going here for over 5 years.  I eat here at least once per week.
author: Gabe M.

description:
OMG FRUIT SALSA, FISH TACO, CARNITAS TACO!!!!! To die for. 

Of course, I came here at the recommendation of my buddy, Gloria C, and got everything she recommended.  It was a Mexican lover's dream come true.  Fish taco was crispy, carnitas taco was flavorful, and fruit salsa was uniquely sweet and salty.  I loved everything I got there... and I'm actually craving it all as I write this review.  The portions are big, so it's going to leave you stuffed way past your normal dinner time.  For example, I had my tacos at 12PM, and I was still stuffed at 8PM.  

This place is conveniently located near SFGH -- so for those of you that are seeing a doctor or visiting family at SFGH, go there!  They also accept credit cards, and there's plenty of seating.  Best to go there before 12PM when the lunchtime crowd usually eat.  I would suggest ~11:30AM!

I'm not always in the SFGH area, but when I am, for sure I WILL GO to El Metate.  Viva la comida mexicana!!!  Arriba!!!
author: Matthew L.

description:
If you're on the hunt for good vegetarian tacos in SF, this place is fairly solid. The tacos have a mix of vegetables (I spotted zucchini, broccolini and cabbage), along with the expected rice and refried beans. They're topped with chopped cilantro, radish, and a smoky red salsa. If you order a taco plate, you get 2 tacos along with more rice and beans and a "salad," which is guacamole, crema, and tomato slices spooned over chopped iceberg.

The torta also packs a lot of unexpected vegetables, neatly packaged in bread closer to a dutch crunch than the typical bolillo. It's good, but not what you might imagine when you hear 'torta.'

The salsas are surprisingly tasty -- the verde is vinegary and bold. I would steer clear of the guacamole, which is almost too creamy and pureed and lacking in avocado flavor. The horchata is tasty (not too heavy on the vanilla, as so many in SF are) and served without ice. Beware that the food is very salty. It'll dry your lips out for several hours post-meal.

It's an order-at-the-counter kind of place, and the food is delivered to your table. There is a good amount of indoor and outdoor seating, plus a self serve salsa bar and water station. At the end of the meal, bus your own table. Very affordable food, with friendly service on top.
author: Megan S.

description:
El Metate is alright with me.  The outside decor is pretty cool and inviting, knowing that all of the "damage" done to the building is just a facade.  The inside is a bit confusing with three doors and not very well written out directions on where to go.  I figured it out though and I'm so glad I did.  The menu items although rather extensive seem simple enough.  The grilled chicken burrito was super flavorful and the regular size was plenty enough for me.  Free chips and salsa?  I'm in!  The chips were probably some of the crispiest, non-bagged tortillas I've ever experienced and made for great dipping instruments in one of their several flavors of salsa.  Who else do you know that serves cucumber pico de gallo?

I'll be back Metate - just you wait.
author: Kevin J.

description: Whoa. Downhill alert. What a disappointment after so many good memories. My torta was loaded with mayo oozing out of every bite, the carnitas was bland, and the roll quality wasn't good. The tables were dirty and the place was filled with Tekkie Doogans trying to show their out of town parents an "authentic" Mission experience.
author: Moe B.

description: There's no mistaking this is a real Mexican restaurant.  The tacos are only okay though.  Their tacos come with hard shells.  Enchilada is okay too.
author: Byron L.

description: It's essentially Mexican fast food, but it's really good quality. There's ample seating room despite the crowded location in the mission. Great place to hang out for a bite or grab something really quick!
author: Anant R.

description:
Excellent taqueria. The meat quality is good, but not excellent (not organic, etc.). I'd give 5 stars if it was.

Mole is excellent. Burritos and enchiladas are great too.
author: Joseph W.

description:
I love this place. 
First, the food. Always done in a timely manner and fresh. Tortas are my favorite- for a price of one you get a tortilla soup extra. Great move.

Interior is neat and you can tell that the owner has put a lot of love into his business. Who doesn't like to dine in a place culturally themed according to the menu? A fairly small sized restaurant with a lot of soul. So many colorful details, most of them handmade.

Prices are great too..explains the long line of visitors daily. They're open till 10pm on a regular day so it's great to know you can eat a bowl or have a warm soup instead of getting a pizza delivery when your belly gets cranky in the late evenings.

El Metate is my spot!
author: Petra M.

description:
This place's ways of executing their menu is an insult to authentic Mexican taquerias. They simply reheat their food in the microwave! Their food is of the lowest quality. This place is overrated by Yelpers only because it is very cheap and because it is the only nice-looking taqueria in the immediate area. Disgusting!

Level of cleanliness: 6/10
Menu versus execution: 1/10
Customer service: 8/10
Pricing: 5/10
Other yelpers rate accuracy: 1/10
Chances of me coming back: 2 out of 10
author: Raymond F.

description: Okay if you're feeling like Mexican in the area.  With  more choices just a few more block out makes it just okay. Horchata too sweet for my tooth and salsas not spicy or hot enough for me.  Charging for zanahorias not okay with me.  Tortilla soup cold and burritos just okay.  Decent and nothing to write home about.
author: Naty D.

description: Fish Tacos. Get em'.
author: Alex G.

description: Solid burrito and beer, I think the quality of these burritos is on the high end for mission burrito world, and the atmosphere is nice gathering place. Great options meats/veggie I and sauces. friendly staff!
author: J K.

description:
THE CUSTOMER COMES LAST AT EL METATE

Here's a recent (and final) experience I had al El Metate yesterday.

I ordered two tacos with guacamole.
They handed me my ten chips. 
I asked for more.
"That's .75 cents."
"No, thanks"

Order arrives, no guacamole.
I approach the cashier.
"Excuse me. I ordered these with guacamole."
"Oh, hold on."

He comes to the table; "Do you have your ticket?"
I produce it.
"I didn't charge you for guacamole."'
"Okay, but that's what I ordered---and repeated twice."
He wanders off and comes back with a ramekin.
"Is that what you want?"
"Yes. That is what I ordered. That is what I want."
Another staffer comes back 5 minutes later.
"You ordered guacamole?"
"Yes."
"That's extra."
"But he didn't take the order properly."
"Guacamole is extra"
Silence. "Forget it."

El Metate is NOT there to serve the customer in its plastic, faux-Mexican decor.
It exists for profit and profit only.
Either the staff is incompetent or they have been browbeaten to nickel and dime every customer to death by their jolly owner.

There are plenty of much better Mexican restaurants in the immediate area.
Go to Mission and 22nd.
Go to 16th and Valencia.

OWNERS OF EL METATE: YOU JUST LOST (AT LEAST) FIVE REGULAR CUSTOMERS
ADIOS!
author: Matthew T.

description: I especially love the quesadillas. However, just about everything here is quality ingredients and great portion size for the cost. I think the salsa selection is also very impressive. I can't quite find a better salsa verde! There can be a bit of a wait time for the food. Overall, I think this is the most underrated taqueria in the Mission. I kind of hope it stays this way ;D
author: Chris G.

description: Great find in the San Francisco Mission District.  So many great taquerias in San Francisco, but this one deserves a return trip!
author: James S.

description:
You will get a mind blowing burrito from here, make no mistake!

My local burrito joint in the UK takes it's name from the Mission District and is decorated with photos from all around the area so during my 10 hour layover at SFO I made it my mission to sample a burrito from The Mission.

El Metate is where I ended up after reading good things about it and I was not disappointed! Fast and friendly service, tasty ingredients and big chunks of meat which had not been ground up into oblivion greeted me as I tucked into the burrito goodness.

We were given free tortilla chips while we queued up and then we took advantage of the al fresco seating area on the sidewalk once we had our food.

Good food, good value. I loved it, what are you waiting for? Go now.
author: Michael L.

description:
I like their decord. It feel like I am elsewhere. Very Latin looking. It is not a restaurant. It is a quick Mexican fast food place. You order and they bring it to you. Try their tostada. Delicious. 
I do not if the neighborhood had changed; I did not see Latinos in the restaurant. Odd since the restaurant is in the mission district.
author: Maybel A.

description: Excellent!!! Will be a regular stop when in the area. We weren't sure when we pulled up but, judging by previous reviews we had to stop and we were not disappointed!
author: Holly C.

description:
Food was amazingly good. I came for a birthday dinner with 7 other people. we ordered a various number of dishes and after trying it all. i can say the flavor is kicking you straight to cloud nine.

In terms of value i would recommend the burritos (roughly $9). they are large and i think fit the value. me and 4 others ordered plates which is about $2 more. However i feel like you end up losing more food in the end. 

I also would say the amount of meat provided is small compared to say other mexican restaurants in the area. However i would contribute that to the fact its a larger venue and has seating.
author: Nathan A.

description:
Absolutely the worst Mexican food I've ever had.

Chips were overcooked, greasy, flour tortilla monstrosities.

Fish taco was gross. The fish was soggy, over battered, and over fried. Completely devoid of flavor. Tasted like it was cooked hours ago and left to sit under a heat lamp.

First and last time here.
author: Terry S.

description: Ordered the veggie burrito for pick up and clearly specified what I wanted and didn't want in my order but when it came time to pick up, they still got my order wrong so when I came back to let them know, the big grouchy lady at the register was not happy and was actually rude and not apologetic at all. So much for good customer service! Not coming back here again, and the burrito wasn't even that good.
author: Erika R.

description: Meat in enchilada & nachos over cooked. Green sauce on enchiladas is sour. Rice & bean portion not enough. Love the authentic atmosphere deep in the mission though gentrification surrounds the place.
author: Susan S.

description:
Hands-down best place to get tacos in San Francisco. The meat is phenomenal and absolutely worth the walk from 24th st Mission bart - I promise.

I pretty much exclusively get the carnitas because it is the best I have ever had (flavorful, no chunks of gristle/fat, yet moist and delicious as hell), but I also have tried everything else and it's all really, really good.

10/10
author: Kristen D.

description: Was nearby and stopped in for supper on Tuesday. Asked about their Metate special, guy at the counter didn't even know what it was (and it was written on the board right in front of him). So I had one fish taco and chicken quesadillas. Sick all the next day; I won't be going back.
author: Sunset G.

description:
FIRST IMPRESSION

I've tried the Mexican in this area (The Mission) and this place is the best. Authentic dishes served quickly and at a great price.

FOOD

Each full plate comes with rice, your choice of beans, a small green salad, and fresh guacamole. That's a whole helluva lot. On this occasion I had the taco plate with carnitas and chicken and I'm already looking forward to trying the other menu items. 

AMBIANCE

You order at a counter then seat yourself, either inside the large clean dining room, or try sitting outside at one if the many tables outside. If you're into people watching find a table on the sidewalk for some of the best The Mission has to offer. Note-- many of the other mex restaurants in the area are small, crowded, and serve their food in baskets on trays. This place brings you food that looks like it should be served in an goddamn upscale restaurant. 

SERVICE

The wait staff are nice and fast with my order. The boy who dropped off my food was like "anything else I can get you sir" and I was like "nothing boy! this feast you have brought forth to me looks goddamn tasty!" 

THE LOWDOWN

As an out-of-towner I'm always trying to find the best food in the area and this goddamn place did the trick. Looking forward to my next trip.
author: Brian B.

description: Best Mexican food in SF! Nachos and taco plate are my regular go to. Delivery is worth the charge!
author: Sergio M.

description:
I LOVE this place.  Delish food and great service.  They have been going through some permitting issues with their out side seating. THEY ARE OPEN!

I talk to the owner the other day and he filled me in on the outdoor seating problem. It will hopefully be back soon, but in the mean time, they got a beer and wine license!
author: Robyn G.

description: I've been on the hunt for some good enchiladas since I've moved to the city and this place is a definite winner! I can't wait to come back and try everything else they have. Their cheese enchilada with green salsa was so freaking good. How do you mess up cheese enchilada? I'm not sure but some places just don't do it that well.  In case you haven't been before, you get in line, order, find a seat, and wait for your food to come while you enjoy your chips with some self-serve salsa (in a really small container).
author: Irene C.

description:
I love the salsa bar. I have endless jalapeños and that is all I need. 
The shrimp is humongous and delicious so the platter is enough to feed 2 of us. 
So we had to order carne platter  to go. 
The set up is simple and cozy for a quick bite. 
We will be back to explore the rest of the menu
author: Nelle L.

description: Mediocre burrito, dry carnitas, lazily chopped salsa, tiny salsa dishes, stale chips, will not be returning. There are a ton of other good Mexican places around the mission area.
author: Wanda W.

description:
1/29/14:
Steak quesadilla 6.50, huge, simple and delicious. It came with salsa, sour cream and guacamole. I got melon and pineapple salsa to go with it from the salsa bar. 
And I found a place to park! 
PS.  They raised their prices, but not by much. Still an incredibly good deal, and the people working here are not haters...


Previous review:
Just got a huge chicken burrito to go for 5.50. I wanted lettuce and tomato, they said fine, no extra charge. Only extra (1.00) if I wanted cheese, sour cream and guacamole(I didn't)
Pretty darn good basic burrito. Came with chips and salsa too!
Take that Taqueria Zapata with your .40 cents extra for freaking lettuce!!!
author: El B.

description: First question I asked the cashier was: "So with your steak quesadilla, instead of side of Guac can you substitute avocado and put it inside the quesadilla? He says of course no problem. I ask if he can put the sour cream inside too, he says sure. So after 15 minutes has passed I check my receipt and notice there's no sour cream on the receipt, and no instruction to put the avocado inside. I come out and talk to the cashier about how he literally only made my plate worse AND charged me 1.50 for avocado even though he said it'd be fine to sub for the Guac. Last time I was there and got a burrito I wasn't charged. At this point some extremely rude guy (probably the manager) comes out and starts getting frustrated with me and the cashiers conversation even though he has NO IDEA what we're talking about. I explained the situation and he turns his head sideways and says: "no no every time stuff goes on side." I told him I understand, but I spent 2 minutes talking to your cashier about what I wanted, and absolutely none of it translated. The people taking orders need to not promise things the kitchen will complain about. Especially when the kitchen is that rude.
author: Naem N.

description: Definitely above average mexican with excellent and spicy salsa bar. I had the cheese enchilada and as you can see its a huge plate
author: Scott D.

description: When it comes to Mexican food, my standards are high. I have a Mom and Grandma who's cooking cannot be beat. Especially when it comes to Spanish rice. I was very surprised with the quality of food they pump out this kitchen! Go with the Platillo Del Mar, it's crazy! If that doesn't impress you then try their Mole! I also tried to fish tacos. Those bad boys are pretty good as well!
author: Leonel B.

description: The best burrito in the Mission. Sometimes they have delicious homemade agua fresca and horchata. The owner and employees are very friendly too.
author: Meghan G.

description: Average. Was surprised because it looked delicious, but tasted somewhat bland. Got super chicken burrito. Finished thinking to myself, I have no comment. Not good, but not bad.
author: Rebecca H.

description: I really enjoyed the ambiance of the place. It was very authentic, the employees were friendly, and service was fast. The food, I personally thought was not so great. It isn't bad Mexican food, but it isn't great Mexican food either. It wasn't the "ewh wth is this" kind of bad, but more "this needs something else," type of thing (if you know what I mean). Their food to me lacked flavor. Their portions are big for their prices though, so that can be a plus if you are on some kind of budget and starving.
author: Abril V.

description: I live in the mission and this is the most amazing burrito joint in town. Im a vegetarian and seriously the black and bean burrito is the greatest. A must go to place to eat
author: Jackie F.

description:
First, I ordered two fish tacos with guacamole and paid. Then, they walked around and called my number. While I waited, I checked out their salsa bar and helped myself to some water. Suddenly my food came out.

I found the rice in my tacos to be a little dry, so I add some their salsa. Overall, it's good. 

If I'm nearby and want something quick to eat, I'll eat here again.
author: Ange G.

description: I love this place, but I want them to clean up the Salsa Bar. It is always a big mess, but Food is very good. and everything else.
author: l c.

description:
Parking near this place can be a pain, but that is my only real complaint.

You walk up to the counter and order here.  Then they bring the food to your table.  The menu is exactly what you expect to see at a Mexican restaurant.

The chips and salsa are good.  The chips are thicker and the salsa has a lot of flavor.

The tacos are great.  They pack a lot of flavor and you get a lot for your money.
author: Brandon S.

description:
Stale, disgusting food.  Used to be good years ago. Went last nite with family and got enchiladas, chicken salad, fish tacos, quesedilla. The chicken was so bland and tasteless, canned corn, beans, salad -ewww  the breaded fish had been kept for hours and was rubbery and disgusting.

so sad to see this place go down the drain.

Oh and the chips stunk of stale oil - they were soggy- Soggy chips ??  WTF ?
author: Rooibos T.

description: Hidden gem!  My favorite thing here is the Fish or Chicken Milanese Torta...it even comes with a small chicken tortilla soup!
author: Ames L.

description: I got the carne asada tacos and I thought they were a bit dry. The horchata was powdery. The chips and guacamole were good.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
This place is all hype, over rated, and doesn't belong in the Mission. 

I like the $2.75 fish taco price but please, give me something other than half a burnt fish stick in where all I taste is the char!  The good fish tacos usually have a house slaw with a citrus/mayo sauce. These only had pico de gallo and lettuce - boring. Plus, what's with the rice in the taco?!? I've never had rice in any taco - these are fake!  
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=n95BwEPTAZfLZ7bAMmd96A)

Their burritos are a fraud as well. My friends carne asada ($9) was long and skinny like a baguette, double the price of an authentic mission style burrito, and had about 5 pieces of meat. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=xPGnuyrEqLCsV9Mo70mc-Q)

You pay for the ambiance, definitely not for the food. This place is better suited for the Marina. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=-T2ckdUUMM91nDkJ4qeY8w)

If you like this place, you'd probably also like Chevy's and Chipotle.
author: Earl G.

description: Update  Super Carnitas burrito  lip smacking good! One of the two best  Carnitas  burritos  I've  had in SF.  A must try.
author: Ron P.

description:
Very tasty tacos! I came here on a late weekday night and there was still a bit of a line. I ordered the carnitas tacos, which were doused in a flavorful, somewhat sweet sauce. I definitely prefer El Farolito but this place has a different take on the taco. Also, they have a great selection of salsas/pico de gallo. a few have cucumbers and melon/fruit which was a pleasant surprise. I'll definitely be coming back!

There is additional seating in the unit next to where you order the taco which gives the place a nice feel if you are looking to sit down and enjoy your taco.
author: Lillian C.

description: When there's 7 people ahead of you on the wait list at the Spice Jar, give this place a shot! They have a huge selection!
author: Joshua F.

description:
Great burritos!  Was expecting this place to be a sit down and be waited on but it wasn't... So I was a little unsure but the place had so many great reviews. Cool building and you order and then can sit.  

It was cheaply priced, great menu, very quick, pleasant staff, and fresh.  I had the grilled chicken burrito with no beans and with sour cream , guacamole, and cheese.  It was amazing.  Perfect size, fresh, great consistency of all the fillings.

My husband had the steak burrito with refried beans and loaded up.  He loved it too and ate the whole thing.  

So good!  Will return.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
The agua frescas here are BOMB! Try to come here on a day that has mango or strawberry because they are the two best. My coworker and I trek blocks from our office to come here solely for the agua frescas. They have just the right amount of sweetness and you can tell the fruit is literally fresh.

We also have had lunch here and it is so affordable. I got the carne asada super burrito and it was super filling but the perfect size! Expect a wait here during lunch hour because there is a line out the door! But, it's understandable because the food and ambiance are perfect for a quick bite!
author: Britney L.

description:
This place is my favorite burrito in San Francisco. It's cheap, comes with chips and tasty green salsa, and the service is quick and efficient. Plenty of seating in the adjoining dining room and the bathroom is one of the cleanest in the city. 

For under $10, I'm here frequently. 

Notice the walls and ceiling. They've really taken some time and put a lot of thought into it. It's a cute place.
author: pretty w.

description:
This is a pretty good Mexican place.  I've had the burritos, tacos and other dishes here.

You can't go wrong with anything you order here.
author: Will C.

description:
Ok ok ok ok, I know I live, like, 1 block away from this place so I really SHOULD loooooove it BUT the burritos are not that fantastic. Taqueria Cancun is my jam for burritos and Casa Guadalupe is my ish for quesadillas. 

If you're looking for great fish tacos, this is your place! 
There are way too many white, young people congregating around this area all the time, day and night. What do they do? Do people have jobs in SF? How do you afford the rent?
author: Katey W.

description:
After feeling peer-pressured for the better part of year to try El Metate, I finally made it in on a weekday afternoon for some fish tacos. They handed me a copious amount of chips and considering the amount of food I ordered, the prices were pretty darn reasonable. 

Their fish tacos were quite tasty (what they're known for, apparently), and weren't drenched in sauce like most other taquerias. Salsa selections were good, though I was hoping for some verde or less liquid-y pico de gallo, but I'm knitpicking because overall, I was a happy camper. 

Word is the horchata is to die for too. That, and not having to deal with the mayhem on Mission Blvd makes this place a solid candidate for a return trip. Make a detour and try this place!
author: Kevin B.

description:
I've been on a 6 month search for the best fish burrito in San Francisco.

This one wins, not just in taste, but in price. $7 is a great price for the city, and so they've won my business forever.

DELICIOUS! 

The staff is also very friendly.
author: Arthur W.

description:
El Metate is a good place if you want affordable sit down Mexican.  Their burritos are priced at $5.50 (regular, super is extra) so it is similar in price to El Farolito and Cancun and not much smaller.  

For some reason their menu lists al pastor as a burrito option but not a quesadilla option, but when I asked they said they could make an al pastor quesedilla ($6).  The al pastor wasn't marinated and juicy but was more like smoked pork instead.  Not what I was expecting, but actually pretty good and decent meat quality.  The only problem was that over time the bottom of the quesadilla became more and more drenched in grease.  Too bad, since the top half was really nice and crisp!

They also give you free chips with every order and then you can choose from 5-6 different salsas at the salsa bar.  I tried the tomatillo green salsa which was watery and kind of bland, but they also have this fruit salsa that is a refreshing balance of fruity and savory!  

And lastly, you bus yourself when you're finished.
author: Beatrice W.

description:
Might just be my favorite burrito in SF! It is certainly up there with La Taqueria. I've been meaning to pay a review of El Metate for a while because this place is every bit deserving of a 5-star rating.

First, I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. I've had the carnitas, pastor, carne asada, chile verde, grilled fish and milanesa and they are all FANTABULOUS! My go-to is the pastor burrito but the chile verde is something you won't find too often at SF Taquerias. It is always perfectly seasoned, tender yet not falling apart like so many stewed pork dishes I've had elsewhere. The tacos are a "lighter" alternative to the burritos and two of them will satisfy most appetites.

Metate also features some great salsas, particularly their tomatillo (green) spicy salsa. It's definitely for the spice hounds but I love to drizzle a little on every bite (a practice I learned from my lovely wife) to give it that extra kick! I think there are two different tomatillo salsas, so be careful to choose the right one. The hot one has tons of chile seeds in it.

The place is always busy (the curse of being so good) and since I live close by, it's usually easier to just pick up than eat in but I've done both. The service is always quick, accurate and friendly. Sometimes you have to wait 10 mins if there are lots of people in front of you or just some big orders but I don't mind so much. If you eat in, there is a huge dining section and a few outdoor tables so you are never cramped or rushed.

Last but certainly not least, Metate might just edge out every other great taqueria on price. I usually gets burrito with guac, light black beans and rice, and no cheese or sour cream. I think it's $7.25 which is a steal considering every other place is like $9-10 with just the guac. A refreshing break among the increasingly unaffordable Mission dining choices.

So if you haven't already, definitely check this place out. I've got a feeling it will become your go-to burrito joint too!
author: Paul S.

description: I've been coming here for years now. One of the best taquerias in the mission, IMO. Delicious food, great prices, friendly staff, awesome salsa bar, great atmosphere. What more could you ask for??
author: Karen S.

description:
It's been awhile El Metate, but you are still a bright beacon on Bryant street.

I love that feeling of returning to a place that holds a special place in your heart and being relieved to see that nothing has really changed. It's still full of warmth. The food's still on point. Their menu looks the same. And it just feels right.

I popped in here to grab some food for some others before an event and for six tacos (a mixture of chicken and steak) and a big serving of guacamole the total came out to about sixteen dollars. Not bad, not bad at all.

El Metate  - keeping it real in the Mission.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description: Good food but very very poor service from what appears to be management heavy set women told us that we needed to buy another order of tacos just because they messed up and brought us the wrong tacos what type of costumer service is this? I would avoid no matter how good the food is because the management sucks . If I could leave 0 stars I would
author: Jonathan E.

description: Every item on the menu is delicious. After many years of coming in, we also decided to have an event here. Francisco the owner arranged everything and it was superb.
author: Tom P.

description:
DAT BURRITO. 

I don't know whether it's the soft flour tortilla, the way they wrap it super duper tightly in foil, or the perfect balance of ingredients (the opposite of this: https://d262ilb51hltx0.cloudfront.net/max/700/0*gz3fGZEe7H4wdbrH.png), but I will be dreaming about this burrito for a long, long time.
author: Izzy D.

description:
This is a pretty popular place for my coworkers and I to go for lunch, and I really enjoy it. I usually get a carnitas burrito with Sour Cream, Guac, and Cheese inside. It's one of the better burritos I've had, and it's filling! They also give you some tasty chips to snack on as you wait.

The one thing I didn't understand at first is that they call out numbers for your order. The numbers they call out are the last two digits of a much longer order number on the receipt. So be attentive to the receipt after you pay!
author: Cole G.

description: I had previously visited this place and gave it a review. I decided to give it another chance. I really wanted to like it, but I did not. The service was good--they were busy, but in the midst of handling a line and taking phone orders, they were very efficient. Yes they did bring out my food quickly. I had enchiladas, but they had no cheese on them and they were very small. They were served with a rather small spoonful of rice and beans. It was just expensive for what they gave me and sadly I will not be returning.
author: alexandria s.

description:
Thanks to ScoutMob, we got a free chicken burrito.  Although my husband said the burrito was good, I wasn't too crazy about the fish taco as it lacked flavor.  The chips also had a weird taste, as if they reused the frying oil too long.

Not my favorite Mexican restaurant...sorry.
author: Rose A.

description: Officially 100 check ins here! That's only about 20% of the times I've been here over the last 6 years and it's still as good as day 1. Maybe better, and the staff always give a warm welcome. Al Pastor and Prawn burritos are my go to but nothing has ever disappointed.
author: Gordon A.

description: My goodness. The tacos and burritos were amazing, the staff is friendly as can be, and the vibe was incredible. Couldn't ask for a better experience at such a decent price. People back east would love for a places like this to open up in their neighborhood.
author: Jonathan D.

description: I love El Metate.  They have awesome chips and salsa to go with my favorite local pollo asada burrito!
author: Alyssa L.

description: Portions were huge and food was really tasty.  Only thing that was somewhat disappointing was the guacamole.
author: Joel V.

description: Can easily have a tasty meal here for under $10. I recommend a few of the $3 tacos. My favorites were the carnitas and the pollo. The veggie one is pretty spicy but the other two were mild. You also get chips with your meal and there is a salsa bar in the back. The five star rating is relative to the spend - this is not a fancy place, the food is basic, but it's delicious!
author: Andrew S.

description:
Words cannot even begin to describe how orgasmically delicious the food is here. Props to my fellow yelpers that guided me to this little neighborhood Mexican joint. Let me start of by saying I'm Mexican and have had all types of Mexican food since I was in the womb of my mama. This place has got to be the BEST Mexican food I have ever had in my entire life.
It was impossible to decide what I even wanted to order, so my roomie and I agreed to get a bunch of things to share. She initially got the carne asada burrito, which was tasty, but I must say I definitely enjoyed my items much more. I got the carne asada nachos and a side order of a chicken enchilada. I literally devoured my choices with the quickness, because they were so 'effin incredible. I love how this spot doesn't rely on soaking their food in salt, because everything tasted super fresh and seasoned just right. Overall, if you are looking for authentic Mexican awesomeness in your mouth this place is a must!
author: Cristal C.

description: I've been going to Metate for almost 10 years now and the food has always been fresh and delicious- my favorite things to eat are the veggie tacos & veggie quesadilla, (grilled veg including broccoli, cabbage, and carrots!) and the chicken flautas.
author: Andy S.

description: My tacos were awesome. The service is sweet and friendly. The atmosphere outclasses most other tacquerias and the bathroom is clean. What else do you want? Longer hours maybe.
author: Liz D.

description:
Good basic mexican fare but with stepped up fresher ingredients.  A big bonus is the salsa bar with some interesting creative combinations (melon and jalapeno for example).
At $6 for a great burrito, chips and the salsa bar this is an amazing deal.
Vegetarian burrito was very good.
author: Ric S.

description:
All right, so it took 20 check-ins and a year of living across the street for me to finally write a review on this place. Here's what you need to know:

First and foremost, the chips are BAD. Just plain old, don't eat them unless you can't wait for the burrito bad. I eat them anyway, but mostly because I just can't get over the hilarity of their awfulness. That's really the only reason for four stars instead of five. Heck, if you soak them in enough of that amazing salsa, it doesn't even matter.

But otherwise, this place is ace. Everything from the simple super burrito (with the delicious spicy salsa) to the chicken mole special is divine. As a bonus, they wrap those burritos in an impressively suffocating swaddle of foil, so there's no mess like at some, ahem, OTHER Mexican places in town (I'm lookin' at you, Papalote).

Best paired with Mexican coke at a table near the salsa bar.
author: Emelie B.

description:
Came here for lunch today with some coworkers.  It was busy and I was a little hesitant since the line was long, and it looked like there was no indoor seating.  (SF spring weather = foggy and cold, am I right?)  

As the long moved forward, I wondered where the people were going.  I found out that after people order there was actually a "hidden" entrance to the seated area of the restaurant.  Way to go, El Metate, for surprising me!  So cool.  Anyway, I ordered the Flauta plate and, holy crap, it was delicious.  Not only that BUT the chips were even much more delicious.  I could have had a meal of chips as a meal on its own, but alas, I am watching my figure so I decided to succumb to ordering a full meal.  

The flautas were perfect - juicy chicken!  The flautas were not soggy from the condiments placed in it.  

The decor of the place is beautiful.  I would suggest you look up at the lighting and take note of el Sol y la luna above you.  Oh, and the place is CLEAN!  CLEAN!  Thank GOD CLEAN!

The salsa bar is also fun!  there are many choices from the green chili to the fruit salsa (I will have to try that next time.)

Thanks, El Metate, for being a great place to eat lunch!
author: John Michael R.

description: Awesome Mexican food in the neighborhood. The veggie burrito plate was great - the sauteed vegetables were perfect! Extra guac is only 75 cents and really good. Also loved the Watermelon agua fresca. Will definitely come back.
author: Madhumitha V.

description:
My favorite mexican place in the Mission, which is saying something. 

Everyone already has mentioned that the food is good, and the prices are good. They're right. What I'll add is that what makes El Metate special is that their burritos are not too wet. Too many burritos in the Mission will fall apart on you before you finish them, and need a sponge to mop up. Not this burrito. It stays intact until the last bite. 

Additionally, the horchata is delicious, not too watery. I like the location because its not on such a busy strip, like Mission or 24th Street, and they have plenty of seating. Writing this review makes me want to go back ahora!
author: Marcel M.

description: I was told by a friend that this place is a "mission secret", and that it has far better burritos than any of the other mission places most people know (like el farlito, la taqueria and cancun, to name a few). While I think that the steak burrito I got was pretty good, I definitely have to stand by my favorite, el farlito. There wasn't enough meat in my burrito, and I think that it could've had better flavor as well. Not to say I wont be returning to try other items, but I wasn't completely blown away. Their red salsa though, was beyond delicious. Also, they don't make you pay extra for chips and the place is much cleaner than other local taquerias. Which is why I bumped this place up to a four, as its probably more like a 3.5
author: Samantha C.

description:
(See pic)

Super sunny facing with outside seating and very colorful tables and a few umbrellas, you'd think you were somewhere south.

Super long line starts around 12:30pm when nearby SFGH people start coming by for lunch but the line does move okay. Definitely go earlier if you want to grab one of the nice outside tables.

Fish tacos were fairly delicious and my friend had the tostada that looked excellent. Definitely to try it next time. This place has lots of choices, something to look forward next time!
author: T L.

description:
El Metate is a bit more upscale than most of the places on 24th street - cleaner, things seem a bit fresher at times, less grease, more fresh veggies.  But at the same time it seems a bit more inauthentic - more hipsters and people who drove in from Noe - almost no customers are speaking Spanish.

The burritos are nice in that they are not the super jumbo size you find elsewhere in the Mission.  Rather than stuffing them with a pound of beans and rice, El Metate makes burritos with actual ingredients.  I've tried the quesadillas - veggie and shrimp - both yum but veggie is better and less greasy.  Shrimp tacos beat the fish tacos.  They're more likely than anywhere else in the mission to have 8 flavors of agua fresca and to not run out of tomatoes, onions, or avocados before 9 PM.

Avoid the super freaking creepy toilet paper dispenser in the washroom.
author: Ivan L.

description:
El Metate, I'd like to publicly declare my love for you.

I've been in love with you for years and am surprised it took me this long to verbalize it. 

I love your cripsy fish tacos, carnitas, chips and mango spicy salsa. I am bewitched by your amazingly refreshing horchata.  My heart beats fast when I walk down Potrero and you never fail to leave me with a warm fuzzy feeling of happiness. 

Since I'm so generous, I can share you with others, hence this review.

If you are reading this, you'd be a fool not to try this place if you're ever in the Mission area!  It's a great place, The very nicely decorated and there is seating aplenty. Perfect place for lunch on a sunny afternoon!
author: Gloria C.

description:
Upon entering this establishment you are transported to Mexico, except you will not get kidnapped and you can not watch a Cock fight. 

The food is as authentic as it gets and that doesn't make it better or worse than lets say Chipotle, but it is darn good and yummy.

I got myself some fish tacos and they were made quickly and they tasted delightful. The menu is ginormous so there are a ton of items to try out.
author: Luis D.

description: This place is great!!! The salsas are fresh and delicious!!! The chile verde burrito is to die for!!! Very friendly staff as well!
author: Walter C. R.

description:
I declare this burrito The Best Inner Mission Burrito.

YA HEAR THAT, EL FAROLITO? I said it's the best.
author: Liz C.

description:
Yum!

+ 4 Fish Tacos + 2 people= $12
+ Affordable, filling, and tasty
+ Don't be fooled by all the white people eating there (which in my opinion means: overpriced, flavorless, and small portions)
+ This location is quite authentic. Im so happy its 1 block away from my work!

Conclusion: Careful when you walk by in the morning before it opens.... the smell draws you back and could possibly make you late for work!
author: Julia D.

description: This is a pretty authentic Mexican spot. You order up front and they bring your food to your table. We got a quesadilla, red enchiladas, and a shrimp burrito. Everything was good, not spectacular. The place is clean and nicely decorated!
author: Brigette A.

description:
El Metate is Mexican eatery located on Bryant Street and 22nd.  It's only a couple blocks away from SFGH and has plenty of space to sit and eat.  The staff is friendly and efficient and they take credit card too!  There is seating outside as well as a bunch of table seating located in the room next door.  It's a great place for lunch or a quick sit-down bite to eat.

I came here with co-workers and enjoyed a lovely Carne Asada burrito.  They seemed to give me the right amount of food, not too much were I felt stuffed out of my pants, but not too little where I was left hungry.  I paid extra to add Guacamole, but there seemed to be a sparing amount given to me compared to other burrito places I've gone to in the Mission.  Each meal comes with free chips and there is a mini bar with an assortment of salsa ranging from all different spice levels.  My coworkers also enjoyed their burritos and fish tacos (which I hear are the highlight of this place).

Not sure I would come back given other, more convenient choices located in the Mission, but if you're nearby its worth a shot.
author: Robert T.

description:
I have to go back to this place- mostly because I was underwhelmed despite the fact it came highly recommended. 

I had steak nachos- they were just boring. There was also very little steak. The chicken quesadilla was good.

Most importantly:: No margaritas!? Its hard for me to be a fan of anywhere that doesn't serve alcohol.. but a taqueria with no cervesas? That's a tough one.
author: Sydney S.

description: Best Mexican food in the city! Just watch out for the horchata, too sweet! But seriously, best Mexican food in the city!
author: Christina T.

description:
A friend told that El Metate was his favorite Mexican restaurant and I'd love it too.  So I was expecting really good food, but came away thinking I'd never go back.  One thing that El Metate does have going for it is inexpensive prices.  

Things started out fine.  Yes, there was a long line, but it moves fast.  I ordered the enchilada plate, two beef enchiladas with no beans, all rice which was noted on my ticket.  The tickets have numbers by which they call to deliver your food, but unlike some places, the number is not in bold or even in the center, making it easy to find.  

My buddy gets his dish first, fish tacos, and they look good.  I'm waiting a few more minutes when I'm hearing "Number 64!".  I look at my ticket, can't see the number which now under full light and my glasses on, I can.  A woman walks over and asks "Number 64?"  I say I have two beef enchiladas, so she puts the plate down with rice and beans, but says it's beef.  OK, this isn't quite what I ordered, but I figure I'll skip the beans as I'm really hungry.  I start to cut one of the enchiladas, and they discover they've given me the wrong dish.  Yes, it's two beef enchilada's but someone else's who doesn't want my all rice dish.  They fix the other customer, but don't offer to fix mine.  As I cut into the "beef" enchilada, the first bite looks suspiciously like chicken.  The next one seems more like beef, then chicken.

By this point, I'm thinking I'm not coming back again, so I eat my mixed enchiladas and leave the beans behind.

Parking is really, really challenging in the neighborhood, so unless you're simply going on price, skip El Matate.
author: Scott S.

description: It was convenient for the area we were in. Food was typical Latin/Mexican. I ordered fish tacos, I thought they would be grilled but they were breaded, lesson learned. Everyone else in our party seemed fine with their food; chicken nachos, steak quesadilla, carnitas torta, chile verde, but steak burrito was bland per the eater.
author: Monica M.

description:
The food has a California-twist to it, you can order the vegetable burrito or taco which is grilled zucchini, carrots, broccoli, etc instead of meat, or you can add this on to a meat-based option. The guacamole is fresh and they have a salsa bar, with homemade salsas. I like to order the pollo con chile rojo burrito, the veggie tacos and the
fish tacos. the food can be a bit salty for those on special diets. The owner, Francisco, is a total sweetheart and his staff are quick, professional and nice.
author: Michelle R.

description: This restaurant has the best salsa I have ever tried. They have a homemade pico de gallo which includes melon. By far the best I found in the city.
author: Fede F.

description: I love El Metate! They have great burritos, quesadillas and tacos. We regularly visit (because we're in the neighborhood), and they have great service and great food. Depending on the time of day you'll see a line out the door, but it moves pretty quickly. You should definitely check them out - I've heard their mole is awesome too!
author: Laura B.

description:
Came here for lunch.  When I got there, there was plenty of seating inside and outside, although it filled up really quickly right when I got my food.  Phew, beat the lunch rush! :)

I had the carne asada quesadilla.  It was delicious, perfectly crispy on the outside and the right ratio of cheese and meat..aka a lot of meat and just enough cheese so it wasn't too greasy.  I was a fan, for sure.  The meat was really tender and flavorful, too.  And you could tell it was at least decent quality because there weren't any fatty pieces that are awkward to chew. :P

I definitely should have tried the salsas.  I don't know what I was thinking when I skipped over that!  After reading my fellow yelpers' reviews, I feel like I missed out!

As everyone has mentioned, the guy taking orders is so friendly.  I felt very welcomed as a first-time customer, and I'm sure he'd be the kind of person to remember you after you'd been there a few times.

The only negative was their guac.  It was kinda watery, not nice and thick the way I like it.  And too many big tomato chunks.  I could barely taste the delicious avocado! :(

I will be back to try other things on the menu, and definitely the salsa bar!
author: Caroline K.

description: Didn't love the burrito - long and thin, not so much flavor. But the tacos and salad were good, and friendly cashiers.
author: Izzy A.

description: Very delicious food! The staff there is awesome and friendly. The tamales are not the typical tamales but they are DELICIOUS. We also had tacos and enchiladas. All the food was amazing and it didnt take long for our food to be ready. If you are in San Francisco and you are craving something that is and tastes home made, definately go there.
author: Reynaldo N.

description: Love the chicken tamales. My friend got the mole and it was super good also. Will go back for sure!
author: Jodi L.

description:
We recently moved out of the city but I drive in once a week for work. In order to keep up our burrito habit, I bring burritos back out to the sticks on the night I drive in and have decided to visit a different taqueria every week. A coworker of mine recommended this place so I gave it a shot. Never again. 
The. Worst. Burrito. 
I didn't even finish my leftovers, that's how bad it was. How can I describe what the exact problem was when it was pretty much everything? From the tasteless ingredients to the way the burrito was assembled. Just bad.  
Last time I listen to someone from New Jersey about where to get a burrito.
author: Lisa Marie G.

description: Went here for the first time this week and had checked out the Yelp reviews prior to visiting. Very cute restaurant where you place your order at the counter and they bring it out to you. They only serve beer which is OK with me but don't expect any margaritas. I got the shrimp taco plate and it was a lot of food! It was delicious and a generous amount. They give you complimentary chips (flour and corn) and there is a salsa bar for you to choose your salsas from. My friend got the nachos and they were amazing also. I saw the burritos and they looked huge. I will definitely be back!!
author: Ava M.

description:
"El Metate" makes me happy to be alive!
Hard day at work, or feeling under the weather: order a torta de milanesa with its accompanying sopa de taco.
Starving: super fish burrito with everything on it.
Need a boost: burrito al pastor.
I have it on good authority their fish tacos are awesome, although I haven't tried them yet. And, El Metate finally scored a liquor license!
author: Antonia R.

description:
I've been frequenting this place recently, and I'm finding that I'm craving the food from El Metate more each time.

Drinks: their agua frescas and horchata is one of the best I've tried. Unlike the one's I've had from other Mexican restaurants in the neighborhood, it's not overly sweet yet quite flavorful.

Food: I've tried the chicken chili rojo tacos and chicken mole. both are quite delicious and not too oily. Also, every order comes with the chips - make sure to get the salsa in the sauce cups!

-1 star for not having the sauce cup near the salsa area (have to ask for them) and the restaurant space being so ridiculous tiny that it can't fit more than 3 people when waiting in line.
author: Karen K.

description: Quite best Mexican restaurant I've been to in San Francisco's Mission District (which is saying a mouthful). I had pork tamales, the coating of which were melt in your mouth soft, the filling complexly flavored and delicious. Great food at a good price in a very pleasant setting. Doesn't get much better than that.
author: Bruce T.

description: Great Scoutmob deal :) The chicken burrito was fresh, and the chicken was moist and tender. Good flavors. I added, cheese, sour cream and guac for an extra $1.00. Totally worth it. I have to agree with everyone else that the salsa bar sucked, thus the three star instead of four.
author: Vanessa K.

description:
EXCELLENT BURRITO, perhaps my favorite!!!
(4.25 stars)

Came here to receive my free chicken burrito. You've been SCOUTMOB'd -- 100% deal to this place!!!! And was very glad I did not pass up the opportunity.

- Food, delicious
- Prices, affordable
- Service, great and fast
- Ambiance, as if i was in mexico

Upon my arrival, I was expecting a long line and nowhere to sit. Arrived with a very small line and seating available outside and inside. Assuming majority of the crowd was here for the scoutmob deal but many customers before me seem to not be and were ordering as if it just a regular day. On top of that, great first impressions. Saw the zagat and yelp stickers on the door window and on the wall - always a good sign when judging the place at first glance. Staff, mexican/mexican american, check!!! Food, legit, check!!! Decor definately made me feel like I had walked into a small mexican restaurant IN MEXICO. The bright colors and the decor, especially the mexican sculls in the window had me expecting a good feeling about the food I was about to eat.

HEFFER-STYLE STATUS.

CHICKEN BURRITO - watched how they were making the burritos. simple, legit, and fast. My burrito was perfectly wrapped in it's foil and was literally the length of my forearm (i measured it). used my scoutmob deal and received the burrito for free and in addition came with chips and dip. the burrito itself was excellent. refried beans, lots of delicious tender chicken, rice, cheese, and pico de galla -- how awesome, no lettuce. i was glad it wasn't stuffed with lettuce; makes it a 'legit' burrito for me. the size of the burrito was big enough to be split between two people. i only ate half and saved the other half for a later time. the chips was good, different then other places. may have used a different tortilla to fry and loved how it was kind of over-fried because it gave it a tastier after tasted which went well with the pico de galla dip. 

They place had it ready for the few thousand who copped themself a scoutmob deal. Very organized and prepared - fast service and great staff. 

Will I be back? HELL YAH!!!!

JABA APPROVED... Until the next review....
author: Jane A.

description: Love the food ! And the decor is so cute and authentic. Defiantly my go to Mexican restaurant
author: Bianca A.

description:
Everyone who lives in the Mission has a favorite taqueria. This is mine. They do a slightly unusual style of burrito -- it's longer and thinner than most and rolled super tightly. For me, it's the perfect form factor. The more common, fatter burritos offered at most taquerias are just more difficult to eat. These are super flavorful and they never fall apart on you.

I usually stick to burritos, but their quesadillas are great, too. I saw someone eating one and didn't even realize what it was -- It's about 3 times as fat as a normal quesadilla, and they cut it vertically rather than into triangle-shaped slices, so it doesn't look like a typical quesadilla. I finally tried one and it is the bomb. Lots of everything inside. Very flavorful, but there's LOTS of cheese, which can make it a bit greasy, so beware.
author: Adam N.

description: I get my weekly mexican fix here. I can't say enough good things about this place.
author: Kri S.

description: Love the food here! The decor is lovely, the staff are friendly, service is fast and it is so clean and neat. Love the cleanliness!
author: Lily C.

description:
There are several taquerias in SF that I love with a fiery passion, and El Metate is definitely one of them. The burritos are long, perfectly balanced specimens of delicious meat, beans, guacamole, and more. Unlike El Farolito, they still give you free chips with a decent salsa bar. The only other items I've tried are the quesadillas, but the menu is pretty large with more options than most taquerias offer. One day I'll try the enchiladas! 

Besides the food, El Metate also has a great little setup. Bryant street may be off the main drag, but it has a cute, pseudo-atmospheric seating area attached, making it a good place for a sit-down meal. I highly recommend a trip out to Bryant to experience this awesome taqueria. A burrito a day keeps the doctor away, right?!
author: Talia G.

description:
I love authentic Mexican food and that's what I got here. I ordered 2 carne asada tacos. They came out very quickly and were awesome! Great flavor. 

They have a nice salsa bar where you can get all types of salsa to put on your food. 

Really inexpensive too.
author: Cindy B.

description:
Finally found a gem on the menu:  TORTA DEL MAR - fried fish sandwich

Comes with a small bowl of chicken soup. The sandwich is perfectly constructed, perfectly battered and fried fish, on some good quality toasted bread.. With some of their habanero salsa, really really tasty.
author: Derrick V.

description:
Maybe it was an off-day for them (?) Whatever it was, El Metate failed to impress. Seriouslyyy. 

My friend and I had a sourdough bread making class. We had munched on freshly baked flatbread, but we were still hungry at 3 PM. El Metate had some of the most spectacular reviews. We couldn't pass it up. (I am a taco connoisseur!)

We walked down Bryant St. and spied a colorful little shop. Bright tables, with scattered chairs, lined the front of the restaurant. It was a nice thing to see. The aromas made us salivate as we ordered.

Based on the reviews, I got the carnitas, al pastor, and fish soft taco. I believe each taco was ~$3. The order came with a little bag of warm chips. 

The salsa bar was pretty much EMPTY. I salvaged a few pieces of pico from the endless abyss of liquid. Ugh. You can tell that it had been empty for a while.. -__- It would have been super, or even, REALLY NICE, if they had bothered to refill it. Yes, it was well-after lunch. But people were still lining up for food!! D:

The soft tacos were a SORE disappointment. Although the meat portion was nice, the size of the taco was exceedingly small, considering the price. The carnitas was overly dry and salty. The al pastor, again, was super dry. It barely yielded any flavor. I choked a few times because the meat was just.. DRY. To help compensate, I ate the lime pieces. At least they were sour -__- The fish taco was just okay. It wasn't anything impressive. A mere slice of battered fish, fried, mixed with cabbage.

Note: I had slow-cooked my own batch of carnitas earlier in the week. They were soooo much better than what was dished out on my plate. Thus, the validity to the following statement: El Metate, I can make better carnitas than you.

Based on the 700+ rave reviews about El Metate, I left angry and disappointed. The food was not worth the price and it was NOT worth being consumed. 

SEVERELY overrated. I won't be returning.
author: Anna B.

description:
Worst burrito and salsa from the mission that I have had yet. 

I grabbed 5 burritos to go and they gave me 5 small plastic cups for salsa. Really... have people been abusing their salsa privileges that much? Then I taste my al pastor burrito with guacamole and there is hardly any meat and even less guacamole which I paid an extra $0.75 for. What little meat I do have, just isn't that meat good either.  I also tried my husband's fish burrito and it was similarly lackluster. On top of that, their salsa, which they already are so cheap with tastes so watered down. 

El Metate - you pretty much suck.
author: Karen C.

description:
I've lived in the Mission for 4 years and finally came out to try this place. If you don't like spicy food, this is your place. But I'm more inclined to agree with another review that pointed out the lack of Mexican clientele: 

1) Salsas were not spicy whatsoever. Even the salsa fresca was flavorless.
2) Only given two salsa containers, i.e. treated like a freeloader.
3) Staff did little to help with an order change I requested, didn't even offer to put requested items on the side.
4) Steak quesadilla was pretty gross compared to El Castillito on Church St. Thought about trying the burritos but they looked small and the rice didn't look very good.

Nonetheless a lot of folks seem to enjoy this place, but in you're looking for more authentic the Mission has plenty of other places to offer.
author: Karl N.

description:
Veggie burrito with veggies for five bucks?! What a concept.

Most burrito joints give you beans and chesse in your veggie burrito.
Not El Metate.

They pack their veggie burritos with all the standard stuff plus zuchs, broccs, carrots, cabbz and beyond! For those wild at heart, get their super veggie with whatever meat you need. My carnivore friends agree. Hella homemade salsas and super kind staff.

Keep it up Metate!

Your prices are solid and your food is consistently satisfying.
author: Dusty M.

description:
Late last night we found our way to El Metate for some Mexican food. My brother ordered a couple of tacos ($2.50 each), while I had a watermelon aguas frescas and the Milanesa (breaded chicken) plate ($6.75), that comes with rice and beans (choose: pinto, refried, or black beans). My food really hit the spot, the chicken was hot and delicious. Based on that item alone I would give them 4 stars. But I'll reserve that extra star until I try other menu items.

I tasted a bite of the fish taco, it's alright but not as good as my chicken Milanesa, they both used the same fried batter. Note that they put rice on their tacos (most taquerias don't do that), just a comment, not a criticism. I saw a handwritten sign indicating that Menudo (tripe stew) was available, but other than that the menu is basic and won't scare off most Americans (I have a preference for more authentic Mexican menus that include internal organs, etc.).

I think that they use a ready made guacamole mix (more watery, uniform olive green color), which is not as good as freshly made guacamole. I love avocados, so I notice this type of little details. But flavor was still good. And the side container of "salsa" for the tortilla chips, was a liquid instead of the typical fresh chopped coarse salsa.

They made a minor error (more items than what I had ordered) when they charged my credit card, but fixed it quickly afterwards by just giving me the difference in cash back.

On the plus side, they have a very clean bathroom, and a large dining room (enter by right side of cashier) as well as several outdoor umbrella covered tables. The service was pleasant.

SF Weekly - Best of San Francisco article:
http://www.sfweekly.com/bestof/2008/award/best-fish-taco-1032593/

Regarding SF Weekly's "Best of SF" claim of best fish tacos: No way! Don't get me wrong, the tacos are good, but definitely not the best. In my opinion, both Nick's Crispy Tacos and Underdogs Taco Shop (see my review about long wait times) make better fried fish (baja-style) tacos. So what makes them better at those 2 places? The quality of the fresh flaky and flavorful fried fish fillet (x2 size). And the option to add really good guacamole ("Nick's way"). I've yet to try Tacubaya's version over in Berkeley.

Other places that also sell fried fish (baja-style) tacos: Pacific Catch, Rubio's, Baja Fresh, Del Taco, etc. - decide on your own which ones u like or dislike.

For traditional tacos (no fried fish) my favorite is Taqueria Cancun ($2.30 each - 3 store locations).

Pics of the food:

1 beef + 2 fish tacos:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=Qb9kFXUKOEfnbcHuTfn4mw

chicken Milanesa plate:
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=fCE_pQ08xjoFL5gMRWsV4Q
author: Luis C.

description:
So, I'm walking down Bryant St. to get to El Metate when out of nowhere (well, from kids playing in the street) a soccer ball come spiraling towards me & *thumps* me in my left shoulder. I was pretty rattled. I should have taken it as an omen of crappy food to come.

We ate at El Metate years ago (I remember it being much smaller then) & must have put it on our "visit again" list, although after the last meal here, I have no idea why. 

I don't remember what the bf ordered, but I had two tacos: one shrimp (in a light tomato broth, not much flavor) & a steak colorado taco (ugh, the meat had that irony, unpleasant flavor that makes me gag & swear off beef for weeks. Hard to explain, but I know I'm never getting that again.) Our meal's only saving grace were the agua frescas; both the cantaloupe & pineapple were very sweet & not watered down.

On our way out, I noticed their huge, mouthwatering alfajors. The caramel was thick & shiny between the two powdered cookies but I was too impatient to wait in line to purchase one freakin' cookie. After the disappointing meal we just had, I wasn't sure I wanted to spend one more dollar or one more moment in there. 

And BTW, my shoulder was sore for two days after the horrendous soccer ball incident...I'm allowed to have a "woe is me" moment, especially when my taco craving hasn't been satisfied.
author: Fancypants X.

description:
When SF Weekly recently named El Metate's Fish Taco as the best in San Francisco for 2008, I just had to try it.  

Look up!  There you will find a large menu full of inexpensive selections painted high on the wall.  The fish tacos were only $2.50 each.  I originally asked to take my food to go, but after noticing the huge and brightly painted dining room I decided to eat in.  In my photo you'll notice that my food was served on a paper plate (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=H-OGCyBKNMHnhoZ2tmSx4Q). 

The tacos were overflowing with ingredients - seasoned rice, fresh tomato and cilantro salsa, shredded lettuce and a piece of breaded and fried white fish on a doubled up soft corn tortilla.  Chips and a dipping sauce for the chips were included.  The tacos were just a bit busy for me as I couldn't taste the fish among all of the other ingredients.  By itself the fish was quite flavorful, but in the taco I could only taste the rice and the salsa.  The sauce that came with the chips was very runny and quite diluted.  I would have preferred some fresh salsa to go with the chips.  There are assorted bottled hot sauces available on two racks in the dining room.  Overall though and considering the prices I'm sure I'll make my way back to El Metate one day to try some of their other selections.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description:
I feel kinda awkward not LOVING this place.

They have Mexican food, yes.
Chips and a salsa bar? Check, and check.
A clean bathroom? Yep.

The problem: the burrito wasn't as amazing as everyone's describing. I got the steak burrito expecting greatness (maybe it was the expectations that got me?) and didn't get anything even close to good. The meat was oddly game-y and super chewy. (I'm now wondering if it was, in fact, beef.) 

Annoying: Both salsa bars were running dangerously low on salsa.

Redemption: the chips were awesome!

Yeeeah, not enough to bring me back.
author: Adena B.

description: Love this place. Good food--especially their enchiladas! Decent prices and a happy vibe to it all. One of my go-to Burrito places in the neighborhood!
author: Uda W.

description:
This is the tastiest burrito (and also the most kindly-priced) that I've had in San Francisco. I love the carnitas. The cucumber salsa is also tasty. The burritos are long and slender and easier to eat that the fluffier ones which are nearly impossible to handle. They serve them with a few super crispy and good chips. And the dining area is beautiful.

On my last visit there, I got the Chile Verde burrito. It was the best and most flavorful chile verde I've ever had. I wish I had been getting this all along.
author: Sharon G.

description: Not the best tacos or burritos in the Mission... Also kind of expensive in comparison. You have to pay for chips and it's $1.50 for something like 15 chips. Some of the people working there were really nice. The food tastes fresh and not greasy, but it also lacks flavor. My boyfriend's order was wrong in several ways too, even though the receipt was correct. The atmosphere is cheery.
author: Mila K.

description:
The food here is amazing. I love the vibe.

The lines were crazy long though and I think there is room to make the experience more efficient. 

Mango salsa is out of this world!
author: Dawn H.

description:
Our host had recommended El Metate has having the best Mission burrito, so on our first night in SF, the bf and I went to find out if it was true. I was surprised when we arrived at the corner of 22nd and Bryant; I had been expecting more of a hole-in-the wall dive. There is an adjacent building called La Tiendita which is apparently a space you can rent out for private parties, so do not walk in there, otherwise a lot of people will look at you awkwardly. After finding the right place to order, I got a carnitas super burrito and the bf ordered an al pastor burrito. 

They were both amazing; I have to say that my stomach is growling as I'm writing this review. The carnitas tasted like a cross between bacon and pork belly. Deep fried pork is the best. The al pastor meat was super flavorful and wonderfully marinated. I was pretty full at about the halfway mark. You could definitely make 2 meals out of one burrito. At $5.50 each, it's cheaper and tastier than Chipotle. If I ever had the good fortune to make my way back to SF again, I will be back here to try their tacos.
author: Rebecca L.

description: Best and freshest Mexican I've had in the city recently! Go for the chicken tortilla soup, you won't be dissapointed :)
author: Eliza D.

description:
One of the better veggie burritos out there.  It's not just a lack of meat, like most mission-style burritos.  They sauté many seasonal veggies (broccoli, cauliflower, cabbage, carrots) and mix them with your regular burrito fare.

Also, try the chili relleno burrito. It's not on the menu, but they'll make it.  It's two heavy things combined, so be prepared for ultimate food coma afterwards, but enjoy the delicious ride on the way.

One last thing: Salsa verde - their's is some of the best I've had.
author: Josh B.

description: I LOVE El Metate, it just makes me so happy. Their shrimp burrito is SO good but also try their dinner plates. This is one of my must-have mexican restaurants for cheap eats whenever I return to San Francisco.
author: Eli Z.

description:
To be clear, this is about service, not the food. Although, if getting what you ordered is important to you, I suppose it is about the food. If getting food to-go DOUBLE CHECK BEFORE YOU LEAVE! 

I will be the first to admit that I ordered nachos with kind of odd specifications. Nothing crazy, I just wanted rice on them, and I didn't want a few other things they normally come with. I repeated my order twice, knowing that it might get confusing. The guy nods, I get my food, I leave. 

I get all the way home (I had driven there), and open my nachos to find a pile of beans and meat, with a tiny bit of cheese sprinkled on it. WTF. I briefly consider eating before I decide that there's no way I'm eating that, and go all the way back down there. 

All of this is fine to this point, as far as I'm concerned, shit happens. BUT, then I call as I'm on my way, and the guy hassles me! Rushes through my order, tries to demand that I show a receipt (even though I had the nachos with me), and rather than apologizing, asks me "what do you want me to do about it?" I say "I want what I ordered!" I go through the order again, and ask him to repeat it back to me because I want to make sure he has it, to which he responds, "No! I don't have time! I'll make sure you get it."

....And who is surprised that they messed it up again? I'm fairly convinced they did this on purpose because they were angry with me, but I suppose I can't prove this. But at that point I was hungry and pissed and I just took it and went home. 

Bottom line: Messed up my order twice, wasting about an hour of my time, and NEVER APOLOGIZED. In fact, when they gave me my second order, they said "well, we did it this time without a receipt, but we don't usually." Like I"m supposed to be grateful. There will be no next time.
author: Colleen B.

description: We had no idea that El Metate ever existed before driving by it the other night and seeing a line out the door.  Then our next meal we decided to check it out.  Unfortunately the parking around here is very difficult so it probably took us longer to find a spot than it did for us to eat our meal.  After we did get a spot, we ordered enchilada plates and they were really good.  If you're not aware, order at the counter before you sit down and they will serve your meal after you place your order.
author: Blake B.
