description: Crowded restaurant on a Thursday night about 9pm. The taco plate was good and portions were very large. The salsa bar is also a nice touch. They don't sell any alcohol but it is BYOB, so a lot of people were taking advantage of that.
author: Lauren G.

description: Some say it's the best Mexican in the neighborhood, but it's not as good as La Palma. Fortunately for El Matate, they are open later and also have a dining room. Major advantages.
author: Kokoe J.

description:
Authentic, cheap, open late, horchata, really good chips + salsa, quiet block, comfortable seating inside, lots of sunlight.

No matter what I get here I'm pounding my fist on the table in aggressive approval while food is falling out of my mouth.

In the king of the mountain wars of Mission taquerias, on my mountain El Metate is currently fending off all competitors, and it's love.
author: Benjamin K.

description:
Hm, I went for fish tacos and they did not hit the spot. The fish had a bread crumb coating, kinda weird. The taco had rice, salsa, and lettuce. Perhaps I am too set on my fish tacos being fried in a light batter on a bed of cabbage, salsa, and crema. 
The agua frescas are really good. The chips and salsas were good too. 
I might go back for an aguag fresca or an horchata, but not for a fish taco. 
I was expecting a lot, and it was a mediocre experience.
author: K R.

description: Okay, this place is out there. I suppose I should disclose that I'm very impatient by nature and somewhat directionally challenged, so it felt (to me) like we'd gone all the hell the way to Sacramento or something. But I've been assured it's technically still in the Mission. Anyway, you order on one cramped side that makes it look take-away only, but get the option to dine in. A narrow pass-through reveals a really large, pleasant restaurant dining room. I went old-school: Al pastor burrito with the works ... and once I'd paired it with their amazing house-made flour tortilla chips and spicy salsa that made me weep tears of joy, I knew we'd hit the nom-nom jackpot. The ONLY negative thing I can say is they don't have a liquor license, but the food more than makes up for it. You can get your drink on in a bar. This is all about your belly. Estaré de vuelta!
author: Gregor G.

description:
I like how the main dining area is separated from where to-go orders are made.  Saves one from hungry eyes staring at your dishes while they wait for theirs.

I always go for tacos and orchata for drinks.  Tacos were good and comes in a plate even if you order to go.  I was pretty much munching on it in my car as I drive...now that's real talent and must I say messy :)
author: Pam S.

description:
Let's be serious. When you eat here at least once a week knowing fully there's a ton of other options, you know you're hooked!

The shrimp burrito here is hands down the best best best of its kind in SF. El Metate uses giant prawns for their shrimp burritos (not the stupid cocktail size ones), marinating the shrimp in three kinds of salsa before putting it all together in a burrito. This, my friends, is absolutely jaw-droppingly delicious and I probably will get one right after I finish this review. Dear El Metate: can you please start a burrito frequent buyer card program?

Also, their mango salsa and cucumber salsa respectively is super fresh and very tasty as well.
author: Jenz y.

description:
The first time I ate here, I thought it was pretty great. The next two times: not so much.

Stale chips in paper wrapper. Practically empty salsa station. Grungy tables and chairs outside. Bland ingredients. The sour cream in my carnitas burrito was maybe a teaspoon's worth and it was all in one spot on one end. Wack.
author: Amy J.

description:
Best Tortas, mole burritos, of course enchiladas etc.  I have never been disappointed with metate.  I love the fact that we can grab a few cervesas next door to wash it all down.

Keep in mind I pass 5 other Mexican restaurants before I get to metate.

Super must have is the shrimp quesadilla to split with a friend as an appetizer.
author: Peace And Love C.

description: DAT FISH TACO DOE. Love love love and keeps me comin' back :)
author: Mia F.

description:
Not the best burrito in the mission, but that's a tall order.  A very good mission burrito.  I used to have them once a week, and I was happy.  I'll miss them now that I'm no longer in the neighborhood.  I think that describes a four star place.  It's also a step up in classiness from many mission burrito joints, that counts for something.  I'd happily take my folks there, or a date, though it isn't romantic, it's a nice place you can sit down and not feel seedy.  Or you can get the standard to-go burrito.  

What can I tell you that might be helpful?

Shrimp burrito isn't great, shrimp is a bit undercooked, I felt. 

Veggie burrito is good, tasty veggies, cooked right. 

The quesadillas are good, but not great.   

There is a chile relleno burrito that isn't on the menu, and it's pretty damn tasty.  

The normal salsa isn't that great, but at the bar the chipotle salsa is very tasty and the habanero (the green one w/onions, not the green one w/o onions) is great and very spicy.  

All in all a solid mission burrito joint, worth a try once or twice, and totally worth it if it is nearby.
author: Travis B.

description: First time had fish tacos.  Second time (tonite) had chicken quesadilla.  The burritos look really good and they will be for third visit.  Nice to have outdoor seating available so dog can also enjoy.
author: Ernest F.

description:
El Metate is, to quote Larry David, prreeeettttyyy pretty good. Mind you, it's not mindblowingly amazing. Nor does it suck.

I imagine if I weren't vegan, I'd probably think better of this place. But I ordered here what I always order - a burrito with refried beans, lettuce, guacamole, spicy sauce. Which turned out A-OK. But nothing to write home about.

It was, however, too large for me to finish. That says something, I suppose.
author: Natalye R.

description:
This place is a steal for what you get in return. Had shrimp and veggie tacos with guacamole--portions are huge and was pleasantly surprised with chips too (though chips were a bit stale)!

Deal maker?

HOMEMADE SALSAAAAAA OMGGGG + MEXICAN COKE

I'm pretty sure I'll be a regular and soon to join the El Metate cult following. Must try burritos next.
author: Annie L.

description:
My love for El Metate grows stronger by each meal. The larger space and new salsa bar with the magical pickled jicama and cucumber salsa is amazing! 

The veggie nachos get me every time which are lathered in carrots, broccoli, cheese, guacamole. mmmm...

Step 1: Walk the hot nachos 20 ft to the salsa bar and fill it up. 
Step 2: Share, eat
Step 3: Get more pickled Jicama

This is a solid eatery; clean, fairly priced, vegetarians & meat eaters alike can enjoy the food, quick & local. Parking is impossible so ride a bike or walk.
author: Shannon Z.

description:
We stumbled upon this this place truly by accident. We were  supposed to have lunch at El Farolito, but I figured what the hell, new places are always good to explore. First things first. I'm a snob when it comes to new neighborhood spots. I wanted to know if this was an authentic place or if it was catering to the new hipster masses that live in the area. I was in line and I was pretty doubtful of its' authenticity (hint hint). Well the menu was basically good looking; I was in the mood for two tacos, one fish and the other carnitas. Carnitas . That would be my judgement if they were catering to staying real or to the hipsters. If they leave the fat trimmings on, then authentic, if they took it off to cater to the "low fat, non fat" people, I would cringe. 

One thing that they had going on was the decorativeness of the place. It was very pretty and cute. Think handpainted flower designs in blue and yellow, and pottery. I felt like I was in a cute little restaurant in Mexico, and yes, I have been there. The restaurant definitely had ambience.

Alas, our food arrives and I am smitten with my first bite because my carnitas taco was close to perfect. The bite I took included a piece of fat in it. Whoo hoo. Authentic. But the meat was a little too tough for my taste but delicious regardless. My fish taco was okay. It didn't really have flavor but I added the chipotle salsa on it so I made it work. My coworkers and I shared a chicken quesadilla (it was huge), I was full, but for Yelp purposes, I tried it. It was very yum yum in my tum tum, ode to Yo Gabba Gabba (I have a 1 year old son, sorry). The guacamole was an excellent addition to it and found it very fresh.

Before I end this review, would you be interested to know they have a full salsa bar?? And a cabinet full of different hot sauces? Right up my alley. 

Definitely coming back with the hubby. And I think screaming babies are ok. The atmosphere supports it. :-)
author: Sharon B.

description: I love el metate they are my go to Mexican food place always nice staff and quick service! :)
author: Ellie-Eleanor H.

description:
There is no shortage of authentic burrito places in this neighborhood but I liked this one the best by far in a week's stay in the city, maybe because of how much they reminded me of my favorite burrito I've had previously, Burrito Brothers in Gainesville, Fla.

Anyway, I had a steak burrito and the size was perfect, (yes--size with burritos matters--not too huge to be messy and not too small is ideal!) The entire thing seemed really good quality ingredients down to the tortilla, and I didn't feel bogged down with fried rice filler like with some other places. The atmosphere both inside and outside seemed nicer than similar places I'd visited while stil being an efficient, in and out sort of place.

This would be my first stop for a great and cheap dinner next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Lauren C.

description:
PROS: Very good tamales, which had a tasty chile verde sauce
              Agua frescas
              All tacos have been winners, especially the carne asada and carnitas

CONS: Sometimes the lines can get long and the tables in the restaurant are crowded and plates not cleared up quickly enough
author: Alfonso L.

description:
Anyone who knows me knows I am a fan of carnitas, plain and simple. They make that at El Metate, and they do it well! Almost anything ordered here tasted vivid and refreshing -- even their horchatas and various fruit beverages (i.e. watermelon!) are all exquisitely delish. Many different styles and textures of chips, too.

Make sure you don't order too much on a single tab, though. As it's a small kitchen staff, 3 people's dinners on one tab the other night caused a wait of more than 30 minutes. Still was very good, but too long... Perhaps nobody should have ordered shrimp!
author: Garett T.

description: We ate here on Easter Sunday because we heard good things about this Mexican restaurant.  Well we were very disappointed.  My chicken enchiladas had dried up pieces of meat and it was terrible.  Stacks of dirty dishes were lined up in plastic buckets and the service was not very good.  I'll never go back to this place when there are many other Mexican restaurants that are way better.  Our meals were not good.
author: Jerry H.

description: El Metate rules.  The food is delicious and reasonably priced.  The staff is friendly and serves food quickly.  There is plenty of seating both inside and out and the decor is pleasant if a little cheesy.  While the ingredients are usually fresh and tasty, El Metate is not a top choice if you are seeking the most authentic Mexican food or the best tacos in the neighborhood.
author: John H.

description: Good solid mexican food.  I have been coming here off and on over the past about 5 years.  They are fast, cheap and the food is always very fresh.  There are lots of options on the menus,  so it is not just about burritos.  The staff is always friendly too.
author: Jax B.

description:
El Metate is the bomb! Their menu is massive, so it's really hard to NOT find something you like here. I would make love to their fish tacos if that were a physical possibility. And they make seriously bitchin' burritos. 

They also have tables/chairs outside so you can sit in the sun & people watch while you annihilate your food.

Definitely in my top 2 when I'm craving Mexican!
author: Celeste R.

description: I got the chicken nachos. Not impressed with the guacamole or the nachos. But I liked the ambiance, the staff was friendly, and the salsa buffet was a great touch. Would go there again and try the tacos.
author: Sarah H.

description: Admitted came here for the scoutmob deal -- free chicken burrito! Long line but went quick, and we left with big hot juicy chicken burritos in hand.. so big neither my friend nor I finished. Wasn't exactly a flavor bomb though. Super cute place.
author: Vivian H.

description:
Came here with a co-worker for an early dinner around 4pm on a weeknight. The place was not too crowded, but we still had to wait in line for about 3 minutes. 

We got a carne asada burrito. It was actually thinner than your typical burrito, but we split it between the two of us, and with the chips and salsa, were very full. The pineapple salsa is the best!!! We probably went back to the salsa bar ten times to refill. There are other salsas too, all of which are unlimited, but they're not as good as the pineapple salsa. I even saw a woman pack some extra into her big tupperware containers.

For dessert, we got  dulce de leche cupcake. It's located in the fridge and is $2.50. I would highly recommend trying this!! It's little bit richer than your typical dulce de leche cake that you can get at typical Mexican bakeries.
author: Lisa L.

description: Hands down my favorite Mexican in SF, after living in the Mission for 7 years I've plenty to compare.  Also, it's clean and the staff is friendly.  Chips are homemade yum!
author: Sara Y.

description: Veggie burrito on a daily basis for me, but everything is good. Nice people, great prices and good location. El Metate for life
author: Murphy B.

description: El Metate is the best. Clean, delicious, perfect, perfect, perfect. Everything is good, they are super nice, and it's just the best.
author: Caroline C.

description: As far as burritos in the Mission, this is by far and away my favorite.  Their salsas are incredible, they have a great drink selection, and they're quite speedy.
author: Alex S.

description:
My family and I love this place!  We live nearby and go here several times a week.  The food is consistently delicious and the services is ever-friendly!

Things we love:

The fish tacos are awesome, but I wouldn't recommend the fish burrito (which is not on the menu, but I asked for one time) as the crunchy crust gets soggy when wrapped up.

The vegetarian burrito with yummy grilled veggies is delish too.

I've also had the cheese and chicken enchiladas, veggie tacos, shrimp burrito (which my son loves), carnitos burrito and quesadilla, pork verde tacos, carne asada burrito and quesadilla.  

We can order what we're in the mood for because we know everything is going to be fantastic!

A great neighborhood taqueria!
author: R A.

description: I live less than a block from this place so I go often. Burritos are good, quesadilllas are superb, but the chicken soup is AMAZING. The fish tacos are crap. The chile rellenos are so-so. The carnitas nachos are good, and how can you go wrong with $6.50 nachos?? The one thing you should avoid at all costs is their grilled chicken. They put it on tortas and in burritos, and it is disgusting-- chewy and full of gristle. The other meats are all great though. They have good salsa selections, but often they will run out and just won't refill them because it's late in the day and they don't want to be bothered with it.
author: P U.

description: I came here on a Sunday during Carnival. There are so many better options in the mission, and closer to the mission street that the long journey wouldn't be worth it, even if I had built up an appetite from the walk. The inside is tight and small, which makes it uncomfortable to place my order, and the menu so high up on the wall, that it made it hard to read it without straining my neck. I sat outside, but the slowness of the busboy had every table full of leftover food and plates. However, the quick delivery of the food and drink is a plus. I got really full off of my burrito that I couldn't finish the whole thing (first for me). I think the layout needs some tweaking. The sauces (salsas) need to be placed somewhere more convenient and easier to access. Prices are cheap though.
author: Phan H.

description: This place is disgusting! The food is stale and the portions are small.  I got a burrito for $11.00 and it was a rip off. I should've went to Chipotle. This was my second trip. The first time I got food poisoning but I didn't attribute to this place. I ordered the fish tacos then. I got sick again and it was definitely El Metate's spoiled food. The worst Mexican food in SF! Stay away save your money and your stomach lining.
author: Trinity B.

description:
Love the location but the burritos are awful. Overcooked and over salted and lacking any kind of distinct flavor. Of the three that I've eaten, only one was edible but also overcooked and lifeless-- a kind zombie burrito.  Eating it was more of a chore than a pleasure.  The chip were also (you guessed it) dull and a bit old tasting. The only bright light is the salsa selection, which has some flavor and variety but (again!) overly salted. 

Perhaps there are some dishes on the menu that are more palatable but I doubt it. In any case, I won't be going back. Three strikes and you're out.
author: Pan K.

description:
I chose the steak quesadilla and I'm more impressed about the chips lolol. THE CHIPS WERE TOO GOOD!!! They said they had no more fish :( so no fish tacos and I know seafood is their specialty so next time, I hope I get hungry enough to get a shrimp burrito AND some fish tacos.

The place and prices are totes amazing too! We'll see each other again soon, El Metate!
author: K T.

description:
I got the chicken burrito here as part of their Scoutmob freebie weekend. As much as I've heard about them, El Matate turned out to be very average for San Francisco. The chicken wasn't spiced or stewed in any particularly flavorful way and the rice, beans, and tortilla are par for the course.  I'm told that I should go back and order something porky for a better experience.

For now, they get 3 stars for the chicken.
author: Andrew C.

description: Don't come here from 12:30PM to 1:00PM so that you can stay out of my way. I'm 6'1 and 145lbs, but if you get between me and a shrimp super burrito between those times, prepare for a lanky Indian guy to suddenly ... well nothing will happen. This place is awesome.
author: A. J.

description:
El Metate, home of the mango salsa. Sweet, tangy and completes their fish tacos.

If you go and are unsure of what to order try their:
fish tacos (must eat with their sweet mango salsa)
quesadillas (just a no frills, well made quesadilla)
burritos (a tall & lean burrito that is also a no frills & well made)
& try all their different salsas in their salsa bar. You may find some meh, but you'll surely find some that are delicious!

Dine in. It's a sweet and unique place. The staff is wicked kind and it's a real pleasant place to be.

If only El Metate was more conveniently located, I'd visit more often. I enjoyed it more than El Farolito though I understand the argument that El Farolito is a better value.
author: Rosa L.

description:
What a find! Great Mexican place in the mission... the veggie tacos and fish tacos my favorites.  They also have a good selection of tortas that I can't wait to try.  
There is a pretty big sitting area in the back...and the service is great.
author: Laura P.

description: Shrimp Burrito Is A Must Have! And their chicken quesadilla! Is bomb! Love it! I come here almost every other two weeks! Haha
author: Zoila P.

description:
This place is awesome. It's in the mission, but it's not on any sort of main stretch, so it does have a slight off-the-beaten-path/neighborhood vibe. Staff were friendly, and the burrito was crazy delicious. Not as big as the super-sized burritos at chipotle, but trust me it's a good thing. Pretty affordable, with a veritable variety of meat options. 

$1.50 for agua frescos is ridiculous considering how good they are. I came back later that day for a second agua fresca. I think it's even cheaper than getting a Jarritos, and they taste way better.
author: Julian V.

description: First time here. LOVE the fish tacos and the flan! Very colorful  surroundings and nice people taking your orders and serving  your food. Very affordable!
author: Geoff B.

description: El Metate is a different breed from most of the Mexican destinations in the Mission. Located a bit further from the center of hipster activity, eating here feels like discovering an old neighborhood gem. The people and space are welcoming and the food (and prices) match or beat anything in the area. Certainly one of the most pleasant experiences I've had at a restaurant in the Mission, and a spot to know about if you are interested in exploring the more authentic and charming side of the Mission.
author: Oliver M.

description:
Cheap, fast, simple, and delicious. Everything I've gotten from El Metate has been superb. Fish tacos, chicken burritos, mole burritos, quesadillas: the list goes on.  I normally order my meal to go, but if you decide to eat-in, I've never had issues with getting seating.  

I probably go here once a week, and don't see that habit changing anytime soon.
author: Andy J.

description:
For years, this has been continually a great spot for anything yum! I trust my tummy here more than I trust those burrito joints on 24th that keep getting shut down by the health department. This place is clean and always delicious - typical Mission flavors, but they serve Black beans as well, and that is always a plus.

It's a bit more expensive than those other places down on 24th... but it's well worth the extra buck to know that you're getting quality food.

I love how SF burritos feed me for 3 meals...because when it comes to El Matate, that means I get the taste of The Mission without having to leave my Richmond hood to brave the commute over.

Quick Tip from my best pal: she asks for half the rice... which means you get more of the other yummies thrown in. Just sayin' - she knows where it's AT.
author: Katy A.

description: We moved 4 blocks away when we moved to SF eight months ago & eat at Metate pretty much every week. We've sampled plenty of other Mexican spots in the Mission but prefer Metate to them all. The food is relatively cheap & great: I've had nearly all their burritos w/ carnitas, al pastor, & pork chile verde my favorites. The gf loves the steak quesadilla. What makes Metate the best in my mind are the horchata, which is the perfect amount of sweet, & the excellent salsas. They don't have a big variety but the primary green & red are both great. Plus the ambiance is wonderful, the chewy chips are delicious, & it never takes long. Good stuff.
author: David O.

description: If it's busy it can be hard to find a seat. And honestly I've tried to find a cup for water or some salt without luck. Food is delicious and worth the other little problems.
author: A P.

description:
My boss took me here one day and I just keep coming back. Their food is so fresh and bomb! Prices are so affordable. I've tried almost everything on their menu and I love everything. I have not had a bad plate of food. 

I'm glad this place is so close to my job that if I forget to bring lunch, I could just come here for lunch!
author: Serena F.

description: THE BEST VEGETARIAN BURRITO I have ever had! This is the only restaurant/taquería I have found that puts fresh, steamed vegetables into their vegetarian burritos, and I will hence not get them from anywhere else. Beans, rice and guacamole are not enough! El Metate makes the best vegetarian burrito by far!
author: Laura C.

description:
Today was my first time here.  I grabbed a chicken burrito (free with scoutmob coupon) for lunch.  Wow!  I was pleasantly surprised how good the food was!  Definitely cannot wait to come back for the fish tacos.  

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because I wasn't a big fan of the salsa that came with the chips.
author: Emmy G.

description: Yummy lunch - had the chile verde plate, instead of beans, substitute veggies! Nice they were accommodating.  Meat perfectly cooked, gently spiced.  Fun bright restaurant setting.  Large menu...will be back to try more!
author: Carla C.

description:
We were going to eat at Taqueria Vallarta with Living Social coupon but closed Monday. Not to fear daughter recommends El Metate and the three of us ventured a few blocks away to 22nd and Bryant. El Metate has a cute interior - brightly colored Mexican tiles and curios line the wall. Normally would be suspicious of a Mexican restaurant filled with gringos -)

. But the food here was really tasty. Had the Taco Plate for $7.95 and two tacos of carnitas and carne asada, with avocado, pinto beans, queso, salad, and chips. Great presentation with large ceramic plates. The food was good but warm interior design was great. Also had flan and it was tasty and reasonable at only $2.50. Only drawback - no cervezas. But who can complain with a meal for three for a little over $20. Will return
author: Dan L.

description: Really wasn't that great. Heard it can be hit or miss. Enchiladas were not very hot, not very good. Salsa was OK. No liquor licence.
author: Melville M.

description: Great Fish tacos, awesome burritos and their fresca's are very tasty !
author: Vish E.

description:
For our last meal before getting on the redeye back to the Sunshine State, we knew we had to have some more delicious Mexican.  Lucky for us, El Metate was within walking distance from our friend's house!

I'm slightly obsessed with fish tacos, so that was a no-brainer for me.  I think my obsession might have run off on my friends, because out of the 6 tacos ordered amongst the 3 of us, 5 were fish, with a carnitas thrown in for good measure.

The taco plates come with rice and beans and 2 tacos of your choosing for about $8 - not the cheapest, but definitely do-able.  Add in a huge agua fresca in the fruit of your choice, and you have a super-filling meal for about $10.  Not too shabby.

The tacos were tasty, the rice and beans were plentiful, and the agua fresca was delish!  I'll definitely be hitting up El Metate on future visits to SF.
author: Eve C.

description:
Most reviews below discuss the merits of the fish tacos, or the burritos, or the quesadillas...where are the reviews of the tortas, I ask! The fish torta from El Metate is what I fantasize about when I'm hauling my not-inconsiderable butt up a wall at Mission Cliffs - it's a wonderful blend of fresh chewy bread, their house sauce, generous portions of their breaded, flaky fish, salad and perfectly ripe avocado. Oh, and did I mention that you also get a side serving of soup with it? 

Bonus points for the cuteness and cleanliness of the restaurant and for being delightfully family-friendly.
author: Korrena B.

description:
OMG, OMG...I love this place.  Yes it makes me squeal OMGs.  That is intense.  Metate is off the hook.  Whether it's fish tacos (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=-8RNuG4FFd80n0-eRYVqpQ) or a quesadilla (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=OSSJsRcn7acKm7tyMoBlwg) I say more, more, more!  

Everything is cooked fresh and made to order.  The restaurant is clean and you have the option of sitting inside or out.  I personally love the vast selection of hot sauce.  And overall, no more expensive than taquerias, you pay for what you get and that is pure satisfaction and a full, content belly.  I always leave in fish taco heaven.  I will miss this place when I move.
author: Justine D.

description: Counter service. One time I went here for lunch and thought "this is the best Mexican food I have ever had." It was so fresh and delicious. High quality ingredients and perfect flavor. It's also very affordable and in a fun area for exploring bookstores and bars. If you want fresh veggies, a huge salsa bar and absolutely mouth-wateringly good fish tacos, go to el Metate. However, I went back at night and it was really busy with a line to the counter out the door. It was not very good the second time. So who knows.
author: Julia R.

description: Horrible!! customer service , Not friendly , I order 4 tacos , 1 burrito ( all i wanted was meat, avocado, sour cream, cheese and juice from the beans) and 1 super nachos , 3 sodas .. $35.00 . money is no problem when it comes to good food , but to get cold food the cheese on the burrito was not even melt the tortilla was COLD. Chips on the nachos had a bad taste , not crunchy , and their SALSA was Super SALTY. and I had to ask if they can clean my table , the place was busy ,but they need to work on the service . Someone should it ask to have their table clean. For now i think Ill stick to My favorite place FAROLITO on 24th alabama .
author: Gigi H.

description: Really bad!! Chips overcooked, salty salsas, quesadillas with flour tortilla, etc.....Look like Mexican Restaurant just for the name but is not Mexican the all!!!
author: Arturo R.

description:
Clean is not the first thought that comes into your mind when you walk into this place. The food is good, the prices are so low that they should be raised since there are so many techies in the hood that can afford it, but it would probably hurt the local population.
You can escape with dinner for two to the point bloatedness (think Kevin Spacey in Se7en) for under $20
Kinda bummed since just really discovering the place and we've living walking distance for 2 years!
Gotta remember to include it in the regular choice of value minded eating establishments
author: G K.

description: Best tortas ever, also everything else is really good but in particular the tortas are amazing if I could give 10 stars I will honestly try the tortas al pastor :-)
author: Gabriel M.

description: Ok. I ordered the vegetable burrito and added guacamole, but I think they left the guac out. Disappointing if they did, because it's extra, and disappointing if they didn't because I couldn't find it or taste it. The ambiance is nice, but it smelled a bit like a dirty nursing home--that weird, sweet smell. They give you chips and have a salsa bar, which is nice. All this for $8.50. Could be cheaper for the quality I got--and I tipped $2--but I'm definitely not hungry. I would like to try some other things on the menu, but until then--upper mediocre for the cost. There are burrito places I like better, and they're much cheaper.
author: Eustacia V.

description:
I am in LOVE with this place. There's something about the food... I usually get the fish tacos, so incredibly good and fresh tasting. My man got a carnitas burrito and the meat was incredible. 

They have this chopped salsa at the salsa bar that has cucumbers and jalapenos in it and I am just OBSESSED!

Did I mention their agua fresca? All I've had is the strawberry but it's so good and fresh and not too sweet with strawberry bits in it. Perfect hangover cure! 

Also the owner is extremely friendly.
author: Claire b.

description:
Wow - what an unexpected surprise - we had parked many blocks from our destinatino and came across this place en route. 

We walked in and thought "we'll give it a try." 

The fresh made chips, the salsa bar, and to top it off, well made with awesome ingedients dinner entrees.  And for a ridiculously low price.  

The folks in the space were most cordial and even though table service isn't a part of the deal, they still stopped by to see that everything was ok. 

We're definitely hitting it again.
author: Richard S.

description:
This is a great find in the Mission. Food is tasty, the portions are large and the prices are very reasonable.

My burrito was 2 thumbs up. Their condiments/salsa bar was also pretty rad, lots of interesting items to choose from there.
author: Rachel R.

description: Really great place. Workers are nice, food is great and good prices. I would eat here everyday if I could lol.
author: Terry G.

description: Cool Mexican restaurant. Food was good. Service was great. I would come back.
author: Will D.

description:
This is fine mexican food in the heart of the real mission district of SF at its best!

For the price point, the flavor, portions, and overall experience you will have at El Metate its an absolute 5 star must try when in the mission.

The owners have been able to carefully blend and infuse authentic mexican food and the authenticity of the restaurant as well , and bring that flavor and spice to the mainstream in this hidden gem of a restaurant in the heart of the Mission District.

Try anything and everything and you won't be disappointed.  My personal favorite, the burrito.  You can't go wrong here.  Honestly what i think defines the food from this restaurant is the salsas they make in house.  Absolutely deliciously satisfying.
author: Ferdinand B.

description:
This place used to be great. 

The salsa was SO bland and the tomatoes had no flavor.

I had the enchiladas just now and they were bland too, the rice had no flavor and it made me literally sick. :( 

I was so surprised, this place used to be in my top 5 for Mexican food in the city. 
Dont think I'll be coming back here again.
author: Tasha A.

description: The steak burrito was disappointing. Sigh. I was hoping for an amazing Mission burrito.  Had a fish taco here the other day which was good but still far from amazing.
author: Joe S.

description: It is sooooo good. I've been to a ton of Mexican places in my life, and this is definitely my favorite. I always get the carne asada super burrito. It has some extra flavor that I can't identify, and it's great.
author: Owen S.

description: Meh, this place was ok, First you walk in through the big welcoming doors to the...dining room where the lady just looked at us, i didn't know if we were supposed to be seated or what. Then I notice a tiny sign that says we have to go next door and order. We ordered and then went out to the really nice tables and sidewalk seating thats the first star. No one told us our food will come to us or if we had to wait for it, Nothing! The burrito i had was good, average, good. Thats the second star. But 2.50$ for a soda!!! Too much. They didn't even offer to open it until we sat down and needed to go back to open with a bottle opening. The staff was not friendly or welcoming or helpful.
author: Shane L.

description:
Come to El Metate for cheap, filling, and delicious burritos! It's totally worth the wait since it's a popular spot. I have yet to try their shrimp quesadillas, fish tacos, nachos, and carnitas enchiladas but rest assured I will be stopping by again soon. They have adequate indoor and outdoor seating or you can just grab your food to-go. 

I went the safe route with a regular chicken burrito for $5 (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=IqiYWBR_rA6YTHHZT9toDQ) and it was simply out-of-this-world! It was a huge burrito, about 7-8" long, and all of the ingredients were bursting with spices making it one of the tastiest burritos I've tried. The black beans were cooked perfectly and the marinated chicken pieces were so tender! It didn't need any additional sauces...the rice, fresh tomato/corn salsa, beans, and meat blended together very nicely. Needless to say, I finished my burrito in record time.

It also came with a complimentary side of home-made tortilla chips (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/2y2lTn53XJCGFh8lkXJ8OA?select=zhGO44l67swBIj3mFCqkxw) and salsa. I loved how the chips were super crunchy and tasted really fresh. Surprisingly, they weren't greasy at all either! The salsa added a nice mild spice to them as well. Yum...I could snack on these all the time!

They actually take credit card too which is super convenient. The wait could take a while around dinner time but for a $5 incredible meal, who can complain?
author: Karen Y.

description:
This is the real deal folks! I have always been a Nick's Crispy kind of guy but this place has changed the way I eat tacos in this town. It was a bit of a task taking the 33 from the Haight so I would say drive or cab it. Plenty of street parking.

Prices are good. $2.75 a taco. Fish tacos are the bomb. Three kinds of pork tacos, (I had two and they were excellent). 

Chicken quesadilla was huge and came with some damn good guacamole. 

The only down side is no alcohol. Nonetheless, I can't wait to be back.
author: Tony N.

description:
Metate gets four stars. The food is delicious and the portions hearty. 

As a Mexi-chick I can vouch for the flavor authenticity. However, they aren't as strong and bold as I'd like. I can't pin down what region of Mexico they're from but they do go light on the sauces. 

The chile verde is delicious and one of my favorite dishes/meats. They have a good salsa bar and the habanero salsa is not too damaging to your tongue but does pack a kick.

I'm reserving the last star for the mole I have yet to try....Mole is the marker of an 5 star Mexi-rating.
author: Jay H.

description: Fish tacos were pretty tasty. Love the salsas and chips. Service is good; gets pretty busy during lunch so it's best to get there early.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
Metate is the kind of place you go if you want something quick, tasty, hearty and inexpensive. (You order at the counter and they give you a number.)

I recommend the aguas frescas (jamaica is my favorite, but their strawberry and tamarind are good too). I usually order something vegetarian; my boyfriend loves their carnitas burrito. He has a huge appetite and usually takes half the thing home.

The single drawback is that I feel their food is not super consistent. I have been here a handful of times (say, five or six) and two were just ok. So maybe if you go and are underwhelmed give it another chance. it's worth a trip back.
author: D Z.

description: Love how people call the food here authentic Mexican food.  For starters burritos are from here, if anything this is California cuisine.  Terms aside.  Its a bid overpriced for what it is.  But then again its clientele is mostly clueless techies and vegan hipsters.
author: J Angel G.

description:
Went here after seeing it on Check Please.  We came here one late night and took our order to go.  My son and I ordered the carnitas which was juicy and crisp in some areas, and added all the extras like sour cream, cheese, and guacamole.  My husband had the al pastor, and my little one had the pollo rojo which was very flavorful.

They all were delicious in flavor.  The only difference is that our burrito lacked the humongous size that other taquerias in the neighborhood are known for (like the super burritos with everything on it).  Granted - it was probably the correct portion that we should eat.  We were all still stuffed.

I am curious to try other things on their menu and will be back.

Their dulce de leche cookies and flan are definitely a sweet treat to finish off your dinner!
author: JJAMZ C.

description: Just a heads up this is a Burrito review only... After a year of not having El Metate, I finally went back to have my favorite Chile Colorado burrito and I was unhappy. If the staff is reading this please, change the recipe back!!! I tried to make the burrito taste better with it's tasty salsa bar but no help. What made the Chile Colorado burrito delicious was the beef simmered with sweet carrot, potatoes and in a fresh tomato sauce.  Now, they went cheap and each bite taste like a can of Las Palmas enchilada sauce which taste gross. This burrito had very little potatoes, carrots and because of the enchilada sauce it made the tortilla soggy. From now on, I will have to order something else on the menu. But in the end I still love this place.
author: John R.

description:
El Metate,
I wish I could give you a separate one-star review for every hour of my life that I spent vomiting from the food poisoning you gave me on my most recent visit.  For the record, that would be eleven one-star reviews.

PS: yes, we're breaking up
author: Adam G.

description: This spot is my JAM. My uzh' was the fish burrito, pinto beans not black, guac, no rice.  Heavenly! Their chips (which come with your order whether or not you sit at a table) are heavenly too - crispy, kinda flaky, and best of all, very, very fresh. I'm wondering if I could buy those chips in bulk for when I have people over?? (serious question)
author: Aditi A.

description: Best Mexican food in SF! Tacos, burritos, and dishes are all superb. You can't go wrong no matter what. Also try the horchata-- so good! The salsa bar is also amazing.
author: Jules M.

description: The food was delicious and inexpensive, but out of the 6 of us who ate here together for lunch, 3 got sick. I had to be hospitalized for stomach pains and nausea. The food tasted very good and the service was excellent but I don't think I can come back after all that.
author: Erin S.

description: Little hole in the wall but absolutely amazing food. Way better than I was expecting!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
This place is awesome!

My favorite is the chicken burrito with black beans and no source cream.
author: Liz T.

description: I can't wait to return to work from maternity leave just so I can have an El Metate enchilada. This place has solid Mexican food at great prices.
author: Christina K.

description:
This is the best burrito in town AT LEAST. Friendly,helpful staff, most of who have been there years and the best interior of any taquerias. They use real, fresh ingredients and a great selection. All for the same or lower prices than the chains of El Farolito and Cancun. Their veggie burritos have broccoli and other fresh veggies.

They also have more than just 2 sauces. Fresh, homemade sauce recipes are changed out regularly some with mango. Their guac is also killer.
author: Anders F.

description: Our favorite Mexican restaurant in the Mission. The food is great, good veggie options (we don't eat meat), and the staff and owner are all super nice! Thanks El Metate for being our awesome local taqueria!
author: Dana H.

description:
Hubby saw El Metate on Check Please, a recent recap of previous shows and it was stuck in his mind.  Truth be told, it looked pretty good on tv so I agreed to give it a try.  

Parking was no problem in the area.  The outdoor seating looked inviting.  We walked in the dining area and through the cleaning area to order.  What we had:

carnitas taco - $2.75 - it's like pork jerky, dry
fish taco - $2.75 - fried w/ rice - no flavor
chicken w/ chile and potato? - $2.75 - best of the three
horchata - very very sweet, we waited for the ice to melt and it was still on the sweet side

The tortillas fell apart on all three.  They gave some free chips that was thick and pretty good.  The so-called salsa bar is not impressive - I don't care for the fruit one w/ pineapple? cantaloupe, mango?; the one with cucumber is ok.  We sat at the table next to the wall hung rack with a good selection of hot sauce.  We tried one called some kind of Insanity and direction calls for one drop at a time - it's definitely spicy but also very salty.  

Each table has plastic utensils and napkins available.  Lots of blue and yellow for decor.
author: Gloria H.

description: We love El Metate's burritos; generously sized & filled with yummy goodness. We especially like the shrimp. It's loaded with big juicy shrimp (not like some places that only stick four overcooked shrimp in their burritos...we won't name names).
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description:
Worst taqueria EVER in the Mission. I'll start by saying that I was able to order really fast but had to wait forever! Meanwhile I checked the receipt and came to find out that they charged $6 for a freakin BEAN burrito. When I asked the guy who took my order why he charged me so much he said "its a burrito". When our food came I quickly chowed down on my veggie burrito while the kids enjoyed their tacos and $6 bean burrito. Five hours later........sick as a dog! I got food poisoning from a veggie burrito. Never again!!!!!

I hope the health inspectors come soon.
author: M S.

description:
This place is still a 4.5 star.......I was just in a better mood that day.
My cousins wanted to have fish taco, so I brought them to a place that was sure to have excellent tacos.  It absolutely did not disappoint.
The fish tacos were excellent. My favorite was still the carnitas taco. The pork tacos are almost exceptional. 
The nacos were awesome as well, so were the flans. I even brought a cooler to bring some flans back.

2 must haves 
1. Pork (the regular one) tacos
2. Flan

2 recommended
1. Pork or steak nacho
2. Fish taco
3. The special pork taco (I forgot the name)

As you can see, I'm a huge fan of the pork.......so, just do it:-D
author: Jeff K.

description:
I had a very delicious carne asada burrito and it definitely satisfied my first cravings for mexican food while back in California for the first time in seven months. Although it seemed like it was really busy, I got my burrito pretty quickly which was awesome cause dang...I was really hungry. 

Why did I never go to El Metate before when I was living here?! Big fail on my part.
author: Lauren S.

description: Heard they had some mean fish tacos here, but I heard wrong.  If I jammed a fishstick in a tortilla and put some hot sauce on top, it would have been better.  Friend got a beans and rice dish that was not bad.
author: Click C.

description:
I had a carne asada burrito with cheese, guacamole and sour cream and it was only $6. 

I'm not sure that anything really stood out about it, but I would definitely come back. 

One thing: the fish burrito only has 1 fillet of fish in it; in San Diego, the size of fish that was in the burrito here would have been in a taco.
author: Amy D.

description:
I got introduced to this amazing Mexican joint lil less than a year ago and ever since then I am hooked! I try to make it here at least couple times a month if not more. Food is amazing, people who work there are just darling (yes, i love them!), and it's not your typical mission wanna be place. It's authentic, delish and real. It's in a nice and quiet neighborhood where parking could be little challenging but totally worth it. It's pretty clean and friendly. Go check it out today!! 

ps. I am vegetarian & they have plenty of options..yum veggie tacos and burrito!
author: Natasha R.

description:
Not impressed at all. It's one of those places I've put up with because it's convenient, but I think this will be my last time here. 
Overall, I'd say Service is a F-, worst I've ever had. Food is a C. 

Got burritos and paid more to make them super, but not only did they not include extras, they included what I didn't ask for and forgot what I did ask for. The cashier was probably the rudest that I have ever experienced. I felt like I was in Seinfeld with the Soup Nazi. He wouldn't give me more than one container for salsa per order and he spent a good 30 secs to a minute telling me to hurry up when I was ordering (and I was not indecisive or slow), yet he didn't take the time to correctly take my order. 

I actually like the salsa bar that they have, but it is never full. I always end up trying to scrape the bottom of the containers. The burritos are ok. They would be much better if they were actually made correctly. Had the tostada...it was bizarre. It had everything but the kitchen sink...and not in a good way. Oily shell, olives, baby corn???
author: Nic V.

description:
I was hoping to be "wow-ed" but left "satisfied."

Ze Cons:
The carnitas were flavorful but still had some big fat chunks, and that's an awkward moment when you want to die because you are eating solid pieces of fat but don't want to spit it out and look like a snob.  
The salsa was kind of poopy.  I had to mix two of them together to get a nice thing goin'. 

On the flip side homies:
They actually use crema.  Not plain sour cream.  And that's how it should be, for all Mexican restaurants, always. 
Cheap!  Cheap ass quesadilla!  And it was huge!  If I was broke as a mofo I would eat here all the time.
author: Rachelle P.

description: There are tables outside that are painted pretty, just like Mexico. One chicken taco (very good, tender chicken chunks) and one carne asada steak taco (also very good) and a bottle of water: $7.00. Comes with chips, choice of salsa, and a bit of pickled salad and lime on your plate. You order at the register. When my food was ready the cashier insisted on carrying my plate to my outdoor table.
author: barbara r.

description: Great option for less greasy Mexican food. La taqueria is amazing but I leave there hating my life.  This place is a lot lighter. The shrimp are huge and delicious, we had in the quesadilla. Aaaamazing. Veggie burrito actually has veggies. I wasn't a huge fan of the fish taco. My hubs loved the carnitas taco. Byo which is always a plus. Definitely will be coming back!
author: Yana K.

description:
I like this place because they actually put some vegetables in the tacos that are not strictly veggie tacos. It's almost like it's a balanced meal. 

Flavorful food, pleasant staff.. Dine in and take out.
author: jen h.

description: Seriously delish Mexican fast food!! Long not so thick burritos with free chips and sauces! Mhh. But no beer?! It's ok the food outweighs the beer craving. There are so many taquerias in the mission area...this is one of them you have to try-advice from an avid Mexican food eater. Enjoy!!
author: Antonina B.

description: As far a tacquerias go, this place is 5 star.  I've lived in the neighborhood for years, and while I have tried many different tacquerias, this has remained our go to place. The carinitas torta, fish tacos, prawn quesadilla and pork chile verde are some nice selections.
author: Missy S.

description:
Came here for a free chicken burrito and that is what I got.  Well, that and steak nachos and a fish taco.  I NEVER order chicken but since that's what I had to get for the scoutmob coupon, I hesitantly got the chicken burrito and it was... MOIST!  I was quite pleasantly surprised.  

I really like the fruit salsa & the crunchity goodness of the chips that they give you.  The steak nachos were probably the star of the night.  This place kind of reminds me of Senor Fish in LA (not really, but it made me nostalgic for it).  The exterior is super cute and I will definitely be coming back here.
author: Christine B.

description: This place is amazing!! Recently moved to SF from San Jose and have been coming to el mutate almost weekly since we discovered it. Everything is really good but we especially love their horchata and carnitas quesadilla.
author: Emma V.

description: Tried it last night and due to its Yelp reviews my expectations were probably unrealistically high. For a Mission joint the place is pretty clean and sketch free, but watch out because it's a small joint with seating for maybe 10 people. I had the chicken burrito and it was solid, the ingredients were fresh and the chicken had a real grilled taste to it. Due to the very out-of-the-way location, I wouldn't mark this as a destination spot, but if you're in the neighborhood it is a decent place to get some cheap eats.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Let's start with price, since post holidays I'm feeling broke as a joke. But $10 for a burrito and taco! That is really quite handsome in my opinion. What I got was a fish taco (thanks previous reviews) and a carnitas burrito. I think the fish taco deserves a 4 star and the burrito a 3 star, but that price jumps them both into a 4 star category. Plus chips and salsa bar to boot, make me a fan. I doubt I will be back anytime soon since there are always new places in the Mission to explore but I would go if you are looking for a new spot to get some chow going. Staff and service are quick and courteous. No complaints! Enjoy!
author: Ezra B.

description: Delicious burritos! I've only ordered take-out but the burritos are always awesome. Chicken super burrito (huac & sour cream) is delicious. Also BIG portions. I always get two meals out of it. Highly recommended!
author: Melissa M.

description: This place has really great burritos. I had the shrimp and suprisingly they gave me more than one!!! The shrimps were large and juicy. The guacamole was creamy and very tasty. I loved the salsa bar and access to all kinds of hot sauces! The chips were fresh and not salty at all! All in all this place is a great bang for your buck!
author: Michelle I.

description:
The quest for the fish taco that provides eternal youth already exists within KJeh's Hoo Hah Taco truck.  The secondary quest for just some god lam good fish tacos is one that never ends.  To this date, I've only found two legit places: Nick's Tacos on Irving and Flying Fish Grill in Half Moon way.  With that said, often times, they are good not on the actual fish, but all the condiments and sauces they use to mask a plain tasting piece of fish.  However, the essence of a fish taco is very simple...fried or grilled fish, 
tortilla and some picca de gallo and lettuce.    

El Metate was purported to have some of the best fish tacos in San Francisco so to celebrate the passing of yet another work week, KDer and I drove here for some dinner after work.  They have an odd set-up.  Initially, we walked into the cashier area, much like every Mexican burrito joint, however, thought this was only for food to go.  So we walked back out, walked into their sit in restaurant and waited patiently to be seated.  A waitress promptly led us back into the vicinity we originally were.  We found out that you order here then just tell the cashier that you want to sit in.  I believe the person who was operating the register that day was the owner and he looked like a kind version of watto. http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Watto  I ordered two fish tacos and one steak taco while Kder ordered the steak nachos.  The dining area was busy and the food on people's plates looked most savory.  They have a salsa bar however, I did not see all the salsas yelpers have been raving about.  Maybe they ran out?  All they had was chile verde and some red salsa; both were pretty good.  My tacos came out first and the presentation made them look so fucken savory.  Peep pic please.  The chips were very crunchy and thick and you could tell that they were fresh.  The first thing you will notice are the tacos are huge.  I added guac on each for .50 and it was overflowing.  You could not fold it and eat it cleanly.  I ate the steak taco first and this clip sums it up: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gX3sEGtG8mQ.  The steak was incredibly dry and just was not good.  The guacamole had a bit of a watery consistency which I wasn't that thrilled about.  I like fresh chunky guacamole.  There was a lot of steak, however, the meat just wasn't great.  The fish tacos were a different story.  They were delicious.  Unlike most other fish tacos I've had in which sauces mask the taste of the fish, you can really taste the flavour here.  It was flaky and moist and had that distinct fish taste.  Nothing more needs to be said.  Kder's nachos were underwhelming.  Again, with ordering steak, it was very dry.    

El Metate is an average 3 star restaurant for everything BUT THE FISH TACOS.  I recommend you come here for nothing else.  For Mexican food, it was bit expensive.  My tacos were $3.00 each with guac.  To justify it tho, these were not street tacos where you could eat 8 and not be full.
author: Brian V.

description:
Well, obviously I ordered the wrong thing because so many people love El Metate.  What can I say?  I don't like the veggie burrito (nasty tasting vinegary vegetables) or their chips or the mango refresco.  Sorry!

However, I'll give it two stars for the Horchata and for the fact that my cousin (who has very good taste) loves it...I'll give it another try.
author: Cassidy P.

description:
This is some of the best most authentic mexican food I've had in San Francisco at absolutely the best price. AND the customer service is great! 

Funny story - I ordered a steak burrito to go on the phone and showed up to find six steak burritos at $ 42.00. I felt so bad rejecting 5 out of the 6 burritos but the guy behind the reg was so nice and didn't complain or say a word about it .

WOOP

I've gone here three times in the past two days - chicken tacos, steak burrito, dankness.
author: Sarah B.

description: The classic mission burrito. It's not crazy big, but it's a solid log of carnitas and the various fixings that make a place like el metate not the best you can get but a good representation nonetheless. My carnitas could have been moister though.
author: Misha T.

description:
Seeing reviews for El Metate containing less than 5 stars actually ignites feelings of fierce loyalty as if they insulted my own family or something. Before I began my review I had to process this to figure out why this would possibly anger me in the way it did. 

My conclusion is this: I cannot help that I was born white, and yes, I will admit, there has been more than one time on my life I wish I was born into a large Proud Mexican family. 
(Sometimes the fantasy has been a large Jewish or Italian family, occasionally, Spanish, and at points in my youth I wondered if I was actually Japanese, but that's not consequential in this review, see Japan Town, Woolgrowers, Saul's) 

We've all had a childhood friend who was lucky enough to be born into this reality, who had so many siblings, that your friend's mother just counted you as another one of her own and called you mija (or mijo) and fed you every time you came over, at any hour, whether or not you were hungry. To feel that love and acceptance in spite of my pastey white exterior conjures up the warm-fuzziest of memories. 

I guess I relive that on each and every visit to El Metate. I think they remember me when I walk in the door, but even if not, they treat me with the warmth and friendliness of a family member. 

I'll admit I order the same thing every visit and this is numbered in the dozens by now, but husband and friends have joined and ordered other meals and have been just as delighted by El Metate. My standard is the veggie burrito with whole pintos, extra salsa (no cheese or sc). Sounds plain, but it is a grilled veggie delight full of marinated broccoli, carrots, some other green stuff and quite possibly an addictive substance because at the mere mention of El Metete, I begin to salivate and crave the burrito, only satiated upon being stuff into my gaping maw. While I eat meat, and I love El Metate, I've never tried anything else, and I know I should. 

Sadly, about 2 months ago, I had to give up glutenous foods, among them being big, floury, burrito tortillas. Last night, I asked if I could order my beloved burrito deconstructed and they kindly obliged. As it was to-go, and I am who I am, I tore into my box of loose burrito immediately in the car, and discovered they threw in a side of corn tortillas and guacamole!!! I hadn't even thought of that! I can eat corn tortillas as long as they don't have flour these did not. See what I mean? They took care of their güera sister. I love them.
author: Devileen C.

description: I probably eat here at least once a week.  Enchiladas rojo is the best!
author: Sarah M.

description:
My go-to Mexican. The burritos are not as big as El Farolito but the ingredients are of higher quality. 
Quality = El Metate
Quantity = El Farolito
(not a direct translation)
author: Brandon W.

description:
El Metate, you are like the coolest kid in school who quickly became my crush...I'd heard so much about you, everyone is always raving about you, but until last week, I had never seen you for myself.  

When I did, it was love at first sight AND taste.  Sight because I was blown away by how inexpensive the food was - $7 for a gigantic platter of fresh, moist, tender enchiladas?!  Taste because the food was incredibly flavorful, fresh, and it did not sit heavy or ride high in my tum tum.  

The décor is simple but aesthetically pleasing - bright colors and great scenery for stuffing my face.  I ordered the chicken enchilada platter - one enchilada with red sauce, the other with green sauce.  They were both equally delicious.  I chose refried beans (choice is between refried, pinto, and black beans) - also amazing.  The topper?  Pepsi hecho en Mexico!  I'm such a sucker for soda in a glass bottle, made with real sugar...until now, I've only ever seen coke in a glass bottle.  So this was a first for me!  

My boyfriend ordered pork tamales with chile verde, served with pinto beans and rice.  Also delicious, although I preferred my enchiladas (and so did my boyfriend).  We got a cheese quesadilla to supplement...definitely not necessary, we were stuffed with just our platters, but I couldn't resist.  This was a HUGE amount of food.  We took home leftovers.  All said and done, including a tip, we were out the door for just under $25.  I mean, that is just obscenely cheap considering the size and quality of the portions.  

I am pleased to announce that I will regularly be frequenting El Metate from here on out.  Despite having to wait in a fairly lengthy line on a Wednesday evening, this meal and experience was well worth it.  One question - where are the cups for the salsa bar?  Maybe you have to ask for those when you order - keep that in mind.
author: Jenna C.

description:
Oh, Mission. How did you manage to shove such a splendid multitude of FREAKING DELICIOUS restaurants into yourself?? 

Fish tacos are perfectly crispy on the outside and tender and flaky fish inside. The carnitas is so TENDER and covered in the most delicious Chili Verde. 

I headed for the salsa bar and pile on ALL the salsa (the pineapple salsa with pineapple and cantaloupe chunks in it goes best with the fish tacos!). 

Find a table to sit down (the one right under the shelf of hot sauces for easy access!) and enjoy nomming tacos in the cheerily lit and wonderfully decorated room.
author: Carolyn K.

description:
I do like the food here....but the restaurant's layout is a bit confusing and the customer service could be a hit or miss. It took a long time to actually receive our food.
The carnitas are nice and crispy and yummy. I also like the flan and the horchata.
The guacamole had no flavor and was just blah.
author: Karen F.

description: Nachos are awesome and the fried fish torta is not to be missed.
author: Eric C.

description: My former company took over this place for a holiday party and I was quite delighted by the food. Not only are the portions generous, but it's super tasty without a bad aftertaste. The salad was delectable and so was my burrito. It was so big I ended up cutting it in half and taking the rest home. The staff were amazing and handled a large group of creative people beautifully. The plates were bigger than your head so just be warned if you get a lunch plate. I will seek this place out again. Yummy, tasty Mexican food without feeling gross and stuffed afterward.
author: Amy J.

description: Have been here a few times. The tacos are good. The burritos are just OK. They are pretty slim for $8. I had steak today and struggled to find the meat. Wont b getting burritos again. Ill stick with the tacos. Its convenient and thats why I will continue to go there. But for better taste and more bang for my buck Ill go to 24th or Pancho Villas which continues to be the best.
author: Graciela C.

description: Hands down my favorite place to have a burrito.  Been going there every Sunday for the last 10 years and still love it!  Great food & people there are awesome.
author: Erich B.

description:
My chile rellano burrito was juicy because it's contents were oily and greasy.
bleck, this is schlock.
author: Bert K.

description: I was really unimpressed with the food and service. There are much better Mexican spots in the city.  The food is not even authentic. Also overpriced!
author: Alex R.

description:
My boyfriend recently discovered this place and we've been here several times since. We've even been going there over Paplote - gasp! Their burritos are damn tasty. The restaurant is nice, clean, and has a great ambiance. It's a burrito place you can bring your mother to. ;-)

The only "complaint" I have, if you can call it that, is that they don't have beer.
author: Andie D.

description: Best horchata in the city, amazing burritos/tacos. Good ambience inside--definitely an upgrade from some of the other grungy mexi places in the mission.
author: Andrea H.

description: ...good food...good prices...efficient set up with friendly staff...what else do you need?...
author: Bob L.

description: I've had the carne asada quesadilla and the al pastor burrito and they're both really delicious. Loved the quesadilla! It came with guacamole, sour cream and pico de gallo. Amazing! Definitely going to try the carnitas next time. There's a dining room to the right of the cash register. Totally didn't realize that the first time I came here and sat in the cold for like 15 minutes. There's also two stations for salsa one in the dining room and where you order. Saves you a trip back and forth out of the dining room.
author: Rochelle I.

description: Burritos are always perfect. ..staff is always friendly and the outside seating is nice on a beautiful simmer night!
author: Charmaine T.

description: Given how far away from the main drags of Mission, Valencia and even Folsom El Metate is, I don't think I would ever go back.  Watery salsas.  Serviceable burritos.
author: Jeremy G.

description: I came here with my boyfriend because I was craving enchiladas. The restaurant is adorable; however, the food wasn't the best. The chips were pretty funky to me, and also the salsa was alright. To eat I had the enchiladas. They were pretty disappointing but then again I'm a big enchilada critic having grown up in a Mexican household and it being my favorite food. Also, rice felt rubbery to me. My boyfriend had a burrito. He didn't seem to complain so I'm guessing it was good.
author: Karen M.

description:
This is one of those restaurants where you think the food will be expensive because it just looks way too nicely decorated inside, but everything ends up being cheap. $2.50 tacos? Not as cheap as Mexico, or even other taquerias nearby, but still cheaper than other places around the city! And they're not sloppy like the usual taquerias that just tosses everything on, which is not always a bad thing, but here I can actually pick the taco up with my hands and eat it without making a mess. The tortilla chips were fresh too.

JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description: Easily my favorite burrito for its price in SF. Wonderful place for lunch.
author: Matthew J.

description: Awesome bistec a la mexicana taco, def worth the extra minutes of cooking! And all the salsas rock.
author: Andreas G.

description:
Every time I come to SF to visit my sister, a lunch at el Metate is a must. Ingredients are always fresh. I've gotten the chile verde, pastor, veg and fish tacos, and they're all great. 

Love the aqua frescas and salsa bar too! Can't wait to come back.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Visiting the area from the East Coast, I was so excited to experience some authentic mexican food. I left here incredibly satisfied. 
I had my first introduction to aqua fresca here. And what a wonderful introduction it was. I had the watermelon flavor and it was so light and refreshing on a warm San Francisco afternoon. Sadly, I don't think there is anywhere in Boston where I can find something like this. 
I had a super steak burrito and it was phenomenal. I was sad when I reached the point where I was too full to completely finish it. The thick tortilla chips served with the burritos are a nice addition especially because of the salsa bar in the dining room which has few different varieties that you can help yourself to. 

I also tried some of the nachos and the enchiladas, which were both great. Portions are HUGE and prices are beyond reasonable. 
My only disappointment with this place is that it is located \way too far from my home because I would love to try more of their menu items. 

Save some room for at least a bite of dessert or get it to-go! flan, cupcakes, alfajores..
author: Karin T.

description: We go here at least once a week and eat all kinds of tacos, burritos, and tortas - they're all so good! The torta is awesome because it comes with a bowl of soup, which is perfect for cold nights. The salsa bar has a wonderful fruit salsa and many other really authentic salsas.  Best taqueria in SF hands-down.
author: Briana M.

description: This place is the best! I always order the torta, they make the best I've had.  Shrimp tacos are also excellent. They are very good with picky eaters, you can custom anything and they actually listen- unlike most other mission taquerias . Everything is super clean and fresh. Must try!!!
author: Mary D.

description: The horchata is to die for. Not watery at all! You can really taste the rice.
author: Erin M.

description:
Unlike other SF taquerias that no doubt have great burritos and tacos for takeout, El Metate clearly has put some effort into making it a welcoming place to dine-in with brightly colored walls and friendly service.

Of course, if you like the takeout option (which I did this time around), there's a separate entrance next door where you can place your order.

Their beef enchiladas are good and served with either red or green chili (or both) - I prefer the green chili) - and also sour cream, pico de gallo and guacamole.

But the highlight for me was the al pastor burrito.  The marinated pork was grilled perfectly to give that a little bit of pleasant charring but was still quite flavorful.  To top it off, the burritos here are rather skinny because they don't overfill with rice and beans (definite plus).   Don't worry though because you will be full by the time you polish off that meal.

Note: it's in a random location on Bryant at 22nd, which is predominantly residential and makes it rather difficult to find parking.
author: F. P.

description:
Not that impressed with this place.

My girlfriend ordered the fish tacos because everyone loves it but it was hard to eat and didn't have that much flavor. Would have preferred thinly cut cabbage and a mayo-based cream sauce and a lime wedge rather than lettuce and pico de gallo (yawn). The fried fish was ok by itself but eating everything together was another thing. It was pretty flat and boring.

So everyone else hypes up the salsas, especially the "pineapple salsa", but the salsa bar was more than 1/2 empty (including the pineapple salsa... which is really a mixed fruit salsa with pineapple being one of the ingredients). I would've gladly wait for this delicious salsa to be made and/or refilled but when I asked one of the workers about the salsa, he simply replied "we're out." That sucks.

I got a carnitas burrito for $6. It was good, not great. I managed to grab some of whatever salsa was left and I was pleased to see they had about 50 different bottles of hot sauce. 

It seems like El Metate is on the wrong side of the border between Mission and Potrero. Their food is more Americanized than authentic (not that I have a problem with that... as long as it tastes good). Maybe this place was a little too hyped but if I strolled in here by accident, the food would still have tasted pedestrian.

I think I'll make the effort to head down to the Mission for some real tacos.
author: Brian L.

description:
Came here with two other friends, and we ordered the Nachos, Enchilada, and the Quesadilla.  All 3 for about $17-18.  Pretty good deal for large portion entrees.  

The quesadilla was my favorite although I could be a bit bias because I love quesadillas!  I still love La Vic's quesadillas back in San Jose though.  

I think it's worth the trip if you want some nicely presented Mexican food in a cozy little decored restaurant.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Its just so good!!!!    So Fresh... So Tasty.... Every time!!!   Jen and I go there, have a sit down dinner, Order 2 big ass nachos - Steak for me and Chicken for her - and 2 frescas, get free chips and awesome salsa (the mango pineapple cucumber salsa is to die for!)  and it comes to ONLY $20 BUCKS!!!   How can you beat that?   We sit, enjoy dinner in the great Mexican atmosphere which is oh so authentic, eat unlimited amounts of free salsa... and its all good... No wonder there is always a line out the door!    In my heart its a 5 stars ... but at the end of the day, its just an awesome burrito join in the mission... as so many are... so 4 is the best that this culinary category warrants.   No matter how many times Ive been here, its just as good in not better time and time again.
author: Vlad C.

description: Was pumped to try their fish tacos. Ordered one to-go and ate it 2 minutes later in my car. They wrap the plate in plastic wrap so I can't fault the fish for not being as crisp as I'm sure it would have been if I dined in. Even so, the breaded fish was under seasoned, the rice didn't seem to have a place in the taco and the corn tortillas had no blister marks or evidence of love. Overall a mediocre taco de pescado that definitely missed the mark. Ho hum.
author: Anthony R.

description:
It's official.  This place rocks.

Since I'm totally winning these days, I treat myself to a burrito once a week. I mean, I fantasize about the burrito so I have to have it.  My new favorite spot within walking distance from my office.  

My $5 I get a perfectly wrapped bean/cheese/rice/lettuce/sourcream/salsa delicioso goodness.  

I load up on the pinneapple salsa, then I sit and soak up the sunny Mission sun while I savor my burrito.
author: Michele O.

description: This place always has the best burritos. Get it with some guac and black beans, and take plenty of their salsa with you because it's just that good. I literally have had weeks where I've eaten here 2 out of 7 days of the week. They make desserts sometimes like tres leches cupcakes or dulce de leche cookies (I know there's a name for these, but I don't remember). Anyway, this place has too many hipsters that crowd up the takeout line (let's face it, it's in the Mission), but aside from that, it's a winner. They give you chips to go with your food, so you've got a little crunch for after too. It's 5 stars to me.
author: Brianna S.

description: Got the fried fish quesodilla which was awesome. This place is super affordable (set me back $7), AND they give you free guac, sour cream, and salsa. Will I be coming back in the future? YES!
author: Isaac R.

description:
This place is seriously awesome Mexican food at a very reasonably price.  I've had their fish tacos a couple times here now (yes!), and just tried the shrimp tacos yesterday.  Yes, the shrimp taco is slightly pricier, and it takes a few additional minutes for your food to come out, but it was full of large, juicy prawns.  The tacos contain rice and are pretty substantial.  Mmm.  

Chips + salsa come with your food, which means you have to pay more for extra, but also you won't accidentally fill up on these less-worthy calories.

Sit at an outside table so you can watch the local pigeons scavenge off of lunch plates after patrons leave.  If birds scare you, then don't.
author: Elaine S.

description:
A quick walk from SFGH. All of us ordered burritos. I got Carnitas mmmm puerco. What I liked about the burrito was that it wasn't dripping all over the place. I'm not a big fan of wet burritos. However, the carnitas was a little dry.The chips were not really crunchy... so I didn't up finishing them :( . The Horchata was very dilute and not as yummy as what I get in socal. The interior and exterior decor of the restaurant looks very appealing and I really liked how colorful their menu board was. Maybe I will try getting tacos or a quesadilla next time? Along w/ a fruit fresca!

FYI I heard they recently raised their prices!
author: Yumi H.

description:
Oh wow. You walk in and see the brightly painted walls, and suddenly your heart starts pumping, because this hope in you begin to swell that, hey, you're about to eat really good Mexican food.

So you order, grab some chips, and sit down. Then the food comes, and in front of you is this huge burrito, and you slowly open it up, savoring every moment. The aroma overtakes you. You pick up your napkin and clean off the drool that's now traveled down your chin, and you take a bite.

Amazing.

You're shocked. So you get up and walk to the salsa bar and realize there are at least four different salsas and sauces you have to try. So you get all of them. And you dip your burrito in the first sauce and take a bite. Amazing. You do it for the second sauce. Amazing. And on and on, and then you run out of sauce and have to get up to get more, but this time you're practically running.

Economists like to talk about diminishing returns. This doesn't apply here.
author: Elben S.

description:
The most beautiful burrito known to man.  El Metate became our unofficial recording food for a weekend of track-laying and mixing.

It was so good.
author: gerald p.

description: Been going here for years! Always take friends here. Order the chicken torta--it comes with free soup.
author: Leo P.

description: Best Mexican in East Mission. Great tacos and burritos and wonderful service.
author: L S.

description: Went there based on a Check Please recommendation.    After ordering the Chile Relleno  and Fish Tacos plate from the counter,  we were provided a nice full basket of chips.  The chips were freshly made and consisted of a variety of corn and flour chips-nice touch here.    We then located a table near the salsa bar where we loaded up on the four varieties of salsas.   Within a few minutes, two huge plates containing our orders were brought.  Each huge plate contained a small guacamole salad,  rice, and whole pinto beans, which I thought were as good as i have had.   My bud enjoyed the Chile Relleno which was swimming in a sauce which she thought was irresistible.   The relleno was fine.  My fish taco consisted of a fairly large piece of fresh fish deep fried in a thicker batter which was a bit thicker than i thought it needed to be and a generous veggie/slaw mixture - giving it a very healthy topping - not the best fish taco I have had,  but still a very satisfying one.    Overall, we gave the meal a plus 4.   The service was good,  the room emits a good vibe,  it was clean,  and we both thoroughly enjoyed the dining experience.
author: Wilfred L.

description:
Have had several burritos and the have all been solid.

I had the chicken enchilada plate this week, and it rocked....  This is my go to place now that marta's kitchen is closed...

Simply awesome for the price, but call ahead, the door line makes it confusing
author: Ken p.

description:
31 check-ins?  whatever.  you would have 31 check-ins too if you lived a block away.  STOP JUDGING ME.

burritos and tortas are what's up.  oh, & the chicken tortilla soup that comes with the tortas is spot on.
author: Lauren P.
