description: Still my favorite Mexican Joint in SF after all these years...Best veggie quesadilla and chicken burrito! The person who runs the place is super nice..One guy forgot his wallet and instead of being turned away they let him order on good faith....
author: Mimi T.

description:
El Metate is great! Their food is delicious and reasonably priced, they have tons of free salsa options and they also offer plenty of seating.
I went here the other night with my best friend and boyfriend -- boyfriend and I both had the fish taco plate, which was great (fish is fried, but not greasy, and it included plenty of pico de gallo, beans, rice, etc). My best friend was in from Hong Kong and craving a real SF burrito, and she really enjoyed the one she got here.
author: Rachel M.

description:
Horrrrrrchatas are a must here, (don't forget to roll the "r"), the fish tacos are also a must.  The lines can get long, but it moves pretty quickly.  The interior is colorful and very mexican cozy, which I like.  I love their salsa bar and always load up on the different types.

The tortas are really good and the taco salad I once had was freaking enormous.  I couldn't finish it so I asked for a to-go container, and the container would not close.  Ha!  It was actually pretty funny.  

But seriously, try the Horchata, it's really good, and the prices here are really reasonable.

Mmmm Horrrrchata....
author: Sarah C.

description:
This was a damn good lunch. I walked 15min and stood in a moderately long line. And that didn't bother me at all.

Chicken super burrito, chips & guac, Mexican Coke. Mmm. 

And it didn't even come close to breaking the bank - $10 and change. 

Vibe is great - bright colors, good music, friendly people.

Take a stroll on over next time you're in the neighborhood or at BAVC for a class (as I was). You'll be happy you did.
author: Liz K.

description: I really like this place. We can sit with Charlie at the tables in front on the sidewalk. The decor and furnishing are very mexican! you order at the front counter, then they bring your food to the table. Love the fish tacos, and the mole special is also very good. they give you enough tortillas, steamed and HOT! Prices are very reasonable and the line moves quickly. Efficient service. good food!!!
author: Janette R.

description:
This place is very bizarre to me.  I literally grew up a block away from here, so it's very strange to see how much my old neighborhood has gentrified.

Before the hipster Mission movement,  i think this place was a corner grocery store where I may have partaken in some underage liquor buying...but I digress, we are here to discuss the current residtent, El Metate.  

I had a carnitas burrito, and it was a great value.  You know you have to appreciate the taquerias in the mission, especially when they are good quality and inexpensive.  I also liked the selection of salsa available.  I would like to return and try some of the other stuff on the menu, but let's be honest, I will probably just get the carnitas burrito when I make it back there.
author: Lu E.

description:
Usually, when I am in the mood for Mexican food, I go for the carne asada. However,  when I'm in the mood for fish tacos, El Metate is where I go. They don't do your standard deep-fry with the fish, but rather a tempura-like batter. I love it because it's not your typical fish taco, yet it's got its own bragging right!

      In a tortilla, it's served over rice, topped with lettuce and tomato, with  your choice of their homemade salsa. I am simple and I do not like spicy foods or sauces, and I usually like to savor food in it's native element.  This fish taco can be eaten as is. No need to add anything. It  has exceptional flavor, and is always very fresh.  I can always count on them for a simple and fulfilling meal.

     This place is not on the Mission/Valencia strip, but it is a sure contender for good food and worth the extra blocks to travel.  Local, fresh, good, and affordable. Support your local  hidden gems !!!!!!!
author: Granolia G.

description: Best chili verde burrito I've had in the city. The tortillas are really great. Yummy salsa too.
author: Joseph S.

description:
I was brought here by two hard-core fans: one a vegetarian and one a meat-eater. Both of them are regulars here over all the other burrito places in SF. It takes them between 30 to 40 minutes to get there and they probably visit El Metate about 3 or 4 times a month (each). 

I had the vegetarian burrito and I think it was about the size of my head. Longer rather than thicker (get your minds out of the gutter), but still way more than I could eat in one sitting. I had about half and they guy at the register was kind enough to wrap the other half up for me to take home. The flavor of the burrito was spicy and awesome. There were plenty of veggies, which made me feel better, and surprisingly included carrots as part of that mix. And like other burrito places that win me over, there was a variety of different salsas to choose from. I love their thick, crunchy and warm chips that you know they make on the premise. Everything tasted fresh and the place was clean, bright, festive without being overkill, and spacious. Definitely worth a trip back next time I'm in SF.

or more vegetarian reviews, check out: http://www.veggiewala.com
author: Jesal P.

description: I live just down the block from el metate and probably eat here once or more a week. Try the carnitas plate, I get it just about every time. My favorite tacos are steak and fish.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
I think this place ties for my favorite Burrito in SF (the other being Taqueria Cancun at 30th & Mission).  

El Metate's steak burrito is very very good.  The cut is lean, it's succulent and there's enough of a portion that you can either save half for later or totally go big with the burrito coma.  I'd suggest the later as gluttony is HUGE right now.

What you might not order all the time at taqueria's is chicken milanesa - breaded chicken breasts fried in the oils of my people.  Yum!  This stuff is she-mazing, straight up how my Mom used to make.  You can order a torta of chicken milanesa, and it comes with a side of tortilla soup.  Their soup is really good, too!  A tasty alternative to the standard burrito meal.

Noon lunch crowd gets kinda busy because it's within walking distance of SFGH, but you can call your order in ahead of time.  

The owner is really nice, the staff is pretty efficient and the establishment is clean and inviting.
author: james r.

description: I recently discovered this taqueria. Am I ever glad I did.  Good location, delicious food (the shrimp are divine-big, fat, juicy) and they are open later than some places.  They also have indoor and outdoor tables. You can phone in your order, and they support Belly for frequent  buyers.  Get the Belly app and tot up your purchases. I prefer quesadillas, and theirs is the best I've had.  Yum!
author: Kristina H.

description: I went to try the best little fish tacos in San Francisco and guess what?  They were fantastic, great tasting, and a bargain.  Came back and had a burrito and guess what?  As good as Farrolito!!!   Came back and they expanded to a real sit down restaurant and had the fajitas....you guess it....the bomb!!!   Love this place!!!    Great location and watch out for Giants players...they like it too.
author: Kirt V.

description: This place was a surprise find walking through the Mission. We stopped here for lunch, I tried the fish taco platter,  and I have been thinking about it ever since. Honestly the best $8 I think I've ever spent on food :)
author: John D.

description:
This place had a reputation for burritos, but I got the Veggie Torta.  I assume they share ingredients, which is cool because many places don't add enough grilled veggies and overdo rice filler for their gut bomb burritos.  Zucchini and carrots and broccoli in my torta gave it a wonderful texture and crunch, held together with cheesy, flaky bread made of awesome.  I had never had one done this way, and I didn't know what I was missing.  My cantaloupe agua fresca disappeared before the food even came because it was that crazy good.  

One disappointment was the lack of salsa bar.  The house salsa on the table was somewhat weak.  That's a big deal, but the quality of food that I got and the overall bright, clean and inviting atmosphere makes this place very recommended.
author: Pat L.

description:
So, I'm on a mission. A mission in the Mission. To find the best tacos/burritos. El Metate was recommended on San Francisco's KQED's Check, Please! (It was an exceptionally good episode because the Pine-sol lady was a guest). This place is great - awesome food, easy on your wallet, great bottled drink selection (my friend went insane because they had "cola champagne", which tasted like carbonated bubblegum), and really tasty traditional desserts. It's an interesting set-up, you order at the counter and then take a seat in the annexed dining room complete with self-serve salsa bar and hot sauce rack. The staff was super friendly and the food came out fast! 

Here's what I do: 
-Order a shrimp quesadilla. 
-Pair it with Strawberry Jarritos.
-Eat enough chips and salsa to rival last year's Thanksgiving. The chips are the good, thick kind (just sprinkle on the salt). 
-Get bummed out when your friend's al pastor tacos and cola champagne trump your meal. 
-Steal your friend's meal.
author: Chanti B.

description:
this is my favorite taqueria in all of san francisco! fresh food, friendly service, amazing salsas- try the chicken mole burrito or the veggie burrito or the fish tacos.. burritos are tightly wrapped which is nice. and the atmosphere is clean and nice, unlike el farlito & cancun (both of which i enjoy at 2am...).

enjoy!
author: Ivan C.

description:
This is an okay place. It's cute, and there is outside seating in a fine part of the Mission.

The line was out the door, but I think that's only because the person taking orders was taking so damn long. There was a cucumber salsa and a fruit salsa... but no regular salsa?

The burrito was normal sized (not the size of your head) which I personally was happy about because I couldn't even finish it. It also could have used more veggies.

The tacos looked great, though. Lots of guac.

I wouldn't go back over ANY other hole in the wall on mission st.
author: Brie P.

description:
Really well priced and delicious mexican food. The flavors seemed authentic(it's been a while since I've been to mexico). I got a torta del mar on my most recent visit, easily the best value there. It was a giant torta loaded with fried fish, egg, jalepeno, lettuce, tomatoes and came with a side of tortilla soup, all for $8. 

On previous visits I've gotten the carne asada, which is good but I've defnitely had better - it's not fresh grilled which to me is a huge factor in the flavor and consistency of such things. Additionally they have chile colorado with steak and potatoes, which was messy but delicious on a taco. Their beans were black, but very well prepared and the rice was moist and fresh tasting.

 I wouldn't recommend the horchata unless you have a sweet tooth as I found it too be far too sugary and didn't accompany my meal very well. Overall this was a good find and I liked it. It's really well priced and the food is a great value, I feel if you dig a little deeper there might be slightly better places in the area though.
author: Devin A.

description:
Yep, these here are good burritos.  Tender and slightly spicy Pollo con Salsa Roja, fresh guacamole, evenly distributed ingredients and a nice, tight foil wrapping.

The space is extremely small as noted by other yelpers, so mostly you're looking at take out or an off-hours bite with two friends max.  But when those occasions strike, El Metate should be very high on the list.
author: Geoff D.

description:
Great taco selection with interesting fillings - fish taco is a fried fillet, and beef colorado with potatoes and pickled carrots. Servers are very friendly, putting together tables before we even asked for it when they saw we were a group of six.

However, you can't buy alcohol. You'll have to make do with the Mexican cokes or the aqua fresca
author: Vanessa H.

description:
It's good, maybe even very good. But it's not great, and it's not "the best Mexican food in SF". 

I watched the counter dude go into the walk-in fridge and get my chile relleno, which was then reheated and covered in sauce. Come on, guys, how hard is it to make this stuff to order? The beans were nice, but the rice was pretty sad (I didn't take it home, unlike the rest of my leftovers), though the plate was nicely garnished with a bit of crema and guac. Nice home-made chips -- why don't more places do this? 

The decor is attractive and upbeat, the kind of local place you wouldn't mind taking Mom. I think it's a perfectly pleasant place to have a burrito if you're in the area -- and I go by there often enough that I definitely will give them more tries -- but I wouldn't go out of my way for it.
author: anita c.

description:
The fish tacos are particularly sublime. And let me tell you: I know a good fish taco when I taste one! Got it?!  You want some bang for your buck? You'll get it at El Metate! And BYOB friendly? Are you kidding me?! You had me at "El".

Worth the star trek even if you live in a far away galaxy.
author: Scott G.

description:
El Metate is the best taqueria in the city. The home made salsa is incredible -  mango, pineapple and tomatoe "fruit" salsa, cucumber and onion salsa, hot stuff, chile verde - it's all done on site. 

The fish burrito is incredible - generous portions, breaded and tasty.

If you are looking for a veggie burrito, I know of no other place that even comes close. You'll find big sprigs of broccoli, cauliflower, zuchinni, carrots, etc. 

The meats are all lean and fresh and taste great. I am particularly picky when it comes to meat, and this place is quality across the board.

I think the value of el metate is incredible because I would gladly pay a hefty premium to eat here, and yet the prices are well below anywhere ($6 super burrito, including tax).

I eat here at least 3X per week. If you haven't been yet, this is a must.
author: Joe P.

description:
I almost want to give this five stars simply because their burritos are so damned well-priced, but I haven't had anything there yet that have made my tastebuds put on a sombrero and dance around in an orgiastic state.

Five bucks for a burrito with meat in it with fresh ingredients and a tasty tortilla. F*cking sold, man. I will seek this place out the next time I'm in this neighborhood, and if the menu continues to exceed my expectations, I'll go ahead and add that fifth star.

By all means--come here for a cheap, satisfying, well-made burrito. It's what I had. And now I want to go back tomorrow for another one. Oh, you get free chips and salsa, too.

WINNING.
author: Andrew S.

description:
How lucky I am to live so close to such a great Mexican restaurant.

Francisco and the gang are amazing, always nice and kind and ready to ask you how your day was.

What truly sets Metate apart is the breadth of the quality in their food. There are plenty of taquerias that excel in one area... tacos, burritos, quesadillas. Metate does it all so, so well. Burrito, excellent and fresh. Tacos, tons of meat and delicious. Tortilla soup or posole, hidden gems. And nachos, something I never ordered very often, are so good that they've become a mainstay. Everything good.

Great salsa selection, if they haven't run out of the cucumber. The horchata is delicious.

They do it right across the board, so they get 5 stars from me.
author: Nate R.

description:
Best Mexican restaurant I'm aware of in the city. Really. Been coming here for a few years, and figured they'd raise the prices soon enough, and it's still worth it. Freshest ingredients, with diverse menu and awesome staff. Good salsa bar, too. They hit every note above average across the board. My strongest recs:
-Carnitas or Al Pastor super burrito; Prawn's amazing, too, if you're feeling it
-Fish or Al Pastor tacos
-Chicken Milanesa torta, but can't go wrong with any; comes with soup
-Pineapple agua fresca or Coke bottle

Note: I rarely eat carne asada or chicken here, the pork/fish is so good.
author: A C.

description: Very good quesedilla with veggie carrot, cabbage, zucchini, cheese. AMAZING chips!!! Guacamole was very good but was kind of pricy and could use less tomatoes (more avocado please). A bunch of differing salsas that were each wonderful (my favorite was the habanero while wifey liked the chipotle). A&W Rootbeer in the can is a rare and lovely occurrance. Nice decor, traditional Mexican taqueria vibe but not scummy like Cancun (more along the lines of a Pancho Villa). Clean bathroom considering the neighborhood can be iffy depending on what block you're on. Honestly, everything looked awesome on the menu and I'd be happy to go back many times.
author: Seth H.

description: I absolutely love this place. Probably eaten over 100 of their burritos over the last 3 years. So good.
author: Steve C.

description:
This place has really gone down hill. I just went in to try something new. Usually I get a burrito but like I said every time I come back the taste of it is def not what everyone hypes it up to be. So I ordered a tostada salad which in every other taqueria is like an unfolded burrito in a deep fried shell. But today it was the worst. It was a Safeway like salad in the shell. Nothing was chopped and it came with ranch dressing. I know i ordered a salad but the way they make it at all taquerias was not at all how they made it. To top it all off my boyfriend did order his regular burrito but instead of carne asada the meat was either liver or toung. Never coming back.

P.S 
The owner Francisco is kinda of jerk, he's always claiming that the decor was all him truth be told a local artist Arcely paredes was the creative brains. I met her as she was painting the tables and walls on a few occasions.
author: Bessie N.

description: These guys catered my cousins wedding and I thought the tacos were awesome, and the presentation was very nice. A lot of people coming from outside of California (how could you live without good mexican food?!) were really happy with everything too, and thought it was great wedding food.
author: Monica T.

description:
i've had el metate before and didnt really think much of it. i have to say, not much of a fan of their chips--they hurt my jaw =\ but the burrito's really good and there were actual carrots in them! I wouldnt have noticed it if I didnt take a moment to look at what i was biting into.

the best part of el metate has to be their alfajores. i was really excited when i saw them in the store. the owner highly recommended them to me when i asked if they were alfajores. he told me he orders them from a lady that was apart of a program that loan women money to start their own business to generate some income. i thought it was great that the cookies were home made and  they were supporting a local business. Of course, as expected, they were DELICIOUS. the outer cookie crumbles in your mouth, the dolce melts in your mouth and there was some powdered sugar (i've had some without). 

I've been wanting to get another one, but they've been selling out by 1pm! Go early. The owner said he's been selling out ever since he got the new display. I should just ask him to stash a few for me :)
author: Rena Y.

description: Chicken Milanese is amazing for $7.95! Very authentic Mexican food. Loved it.
author: Mitchell H.

description: Tasty. Some interesting and different burritos as well as decent vegetarian options.
author: Stephen W.

description:
My favorite place to get burritos!  Great taste, quick service, great seating area, quick take-out, cheap prices.

They offer great vegetables for their burritos and they also sell hecho in mexico Coke!  That's what I'm talking about!

Why ask for anything less?
author: Phil S.

description: Cheap prices, generous portions, good agua fresca, friendly staff, but yes, "steak" strangely gamey: goat, wildebeest, or as we say in Nigeria, bushmeat?
author: Faith A.

description: I like the vegetarian burrito! It's a great price for a delicious and incredibly filling meal!
author: Jaedra D.

description: I eat here 2-3 times a week, love everything here, great svc and food!!
author: Antonio E.

description:
So yummy (so relatively clean), so bad for you. 
I will definitely come again when I get the chance. Certainly the Mexican food is better in the Mission than it is in Sunnyvale!! ;- D
author: Neha A.

description: Let me start off by saying that three friends and I went to to El Metate looking forward to their mango sauce, thanks to the wonderful reviews on Yelp. We were disappointed by the fact that they were out today. They have three different kinds of chips: corn, wheat flour, and regular flour. The corn chips were good enough, but the flour chips were greasy and nasty. To be fair, every restaurant I've ever been to that did flour chips didn't really pull them off, so I just say stay away from them. The food was okay. Among us we ordered a quesadilla, a veggie burrito, a steak burrito, and and asada and pastor tacos. The meat was tender and tasted good enough. This is not a full service restaurant. They have a cashier and we seat ourselves. But the staff is very attentive and the manager/owner came to our table to make sure we were happy. That's customer service!
author: Arturo G.

description:
4 stars for the food, 5 stars for the service!

LIKES:
1. I can see it from my window.  Convenience WIN.
2. Service is always awesome here.*  (Probably helps that they recognize me, too...)
3. Dining room is spacious and CLEAN.  I love El Farolito, but as far as ambiance goes, I'd much rather eat here.
4. Great variety on the menu!  Burritos, tacos, and even TORTAS (Mexican sammiches).
5. El Pastor - This is FREAKING DELICIOUS.  If you don't eat pork, well, this could change you over to the other side.
6. Hot sauce variety up the wazoo.  Amazing!
7. For those of you like me that never carry cash (it makes it that much harder living in the Mission), they accept credit card!

GRIPES:
1. I got a shrimp taco from here, and it didn't sit too well with me.  It may have been something else, but the el pastor and carne asada are way better anyway.

*Ok, cool story time...Once upon a time, I ran out of change for laundry.  I only had a 5 dollar bill.  So I ran across the street because it was after 9pm, and the Super Lavar down the street was already closed.  Lame.  I ran across the street in a desperate attempt to get some change because, well, underwear doesn't have two sides.  I hand the cashier aforementioned 5 dollar bill, and he gives me change, without questioning me or giving me 'tude.  He feels bad that he couldn't give me MORE change.  Really guy?  You're a saint!  Because of the kindness of the El Metate staff, I was able to do my laundry and have clean clothes for happily ever after!  (Or at least another week and a half...)
author: Alice C.

description: This place is the best. I have lived nearby and gone here at least once a week for years and it's always tip top. The owner Francisco always looks after me and makes sure everything is great. I think of it as an extension of my apartment. An extension with burritos in it.
author: elly j.

description: This Mexican restaurant is very close to SF General Hospital.  This place is yummy.  I was a little under the weather and I was craving soup one day so I ordered the chicken tortilla soup and it was fabulous.  They have an amazing salsa bar.  The only other salsa bar that is as comprehensive as this one is Puerto Allegre by 16th and Mission).  I have ordered the orchata - nothing extra special but delicious.  I ordered a Mexican chocolate chip cookie, which was also good, but nothing special.  Fish tacos are decent, but I have had better.  Their burritos are good.  My friend ordered their steak quesadilla on some kind of green tortilla (I forget what flavor it was), but it was delicious.  Highlights are: salsa bar and chicken tortilla soup.  I still want to try some of their other dishes.
author: Vagabond V.

description:
El Metate makes one of my favorite burritos in the mission: a veggie burrito with black beans.

It's not a super burrito. It's not a meaty feast.

It's just a ridiculously fresh and tasty burrito with lots of chunky lightly grilled veggies -- carrots, zuchinni, cabbage and broccoli -- and rice and beans. Pour on some of the fiery habanero salsa on, and  and it's the tastiest, freshest, and cleanest burrito around. Pour a big glass of water from the cooler next to the salsa and its a $5.00 meal.

I feel wonderful after eating it -- satisfied and healthy. And happy seeing the friendly staff pump out wonderful plates of food, and the happy patrons chow them down.
author: Noah Z.

description: I love Mexican food. But this place did not impress me. My fiance went here after seeing all the reviews and driving by it all the time. We had a chicken burrito and steak burrito. The meat was dry and oversalted. The whole thing lacked flavor other than salt. I definitely have had better. Maybe it was an off day or maybe because we did take-out rather than eating there, but I'm sorry, it just was not good.
author: Caroline L.

description: Best Tacqueria in the Mission Potrero area, with fresh and succulent ingredients and warm and welcoming service. The line loves quickly and the outside tables a great place to soak up the sun and the amazing fish tacos, tortas, and burritos.
author: J D.

description: Great service and food. Ordered the lemon and olive lamb. Fall off the bone delicious.
author: K K.

description: I stick with my standby of a veggie burrito when I come to this place so I can't offer as much of a well-rounded review as I'd like. I do love that they use "seasonal vegetables", making it a veritable box of chocolates wrapped in a whole wheat tortilla. There's just something about biting into a burrito and finding a piece of steamed broccoli or cabbage that makes you think, "Hmm, what's next?". It's both delicious AND intriguing. Service is fast and friendly. PLUS, there's a salsa bar! Happy eating, amigos!
author: Ashley K.

description:
Great Mexican food! The chicken nachos costs less than $6 bucks and many different salsa such as Mango spicy, fruit salsa ...(all FRESH).

I will go back again for lunch to try the burrito, chicken tortilla soup and enchilada. Yummy!
author: Karen L.

description: I had a delicious quesadilla here, honestly one of the best I've ever had. Vegetarian girlfriend was really happy with their variety and loved her quesadilla too.
author: Andrew M.

description: I ate here last year with a friend and couldn't stop thinking about the great enchilada combination plate I had ordered.  I just recently ate there again and I ordered the fish taco & pork taco combination plate and wow!  I loved it.  They have fresh homemade salsas and it's a cute place to have lunch or dinner.  I'll go again and recommend to all my friends!  Prices are good and affordable, too.
author: Arlene Z.

description:
Back in Massachusetts there was a mexican resturant called Mi Terra, and honestly I dont think anything (aside from my moms food) will ever top that.

El Metate come's VERY close. My favorite thing there are the steak tacos, and my boyfriend loves the chicken burritos. both are delicious! The salsa bar is always full, the only downside to this is that they only ever seem to give you a few chips on your plate, but they are more than willing to give us a bagful when we run out. I just recently had the rice, it was perfect. Not overcooked and stuck together... but not undercooked. 

El metate, I wish you were closer to my neighborhood.
author: Cecilly J.

description: My last visit to El Metate was totally disappointing. I ordered a super burrito and to my surprise the dish was brought to my table within seconds. Seriously, it took about 30 seconds to be ready! Come on less than a minute is not enough time to even wrap the burrito! Anyway, once I opened it it was cold and it was to obvious that the burrito was made a long time ago and it was sitting somewhere in the kitchen. I left with the feeling that the burrito they gave me was a dish they made by mistake and then they kept it and waited for the next person they could sell it too. Unluckily, I was the sucker who ended up eating someone's else cold meal. I liked this place a lot and I have been at El Metate at least 30 times; however, because of my last experience I probably won't come back. Whenever I want cold food I'll go somewhere else and I'll order ceviche or something like that but honestly a cold super burrito does not seem appealing at all. Thanks and goodbye El Metate!
author: Pepi R.

description:
When you go climbing at Mission Cliffs on the weekend, it's pretty much a lock-in to get Mexican food afterwards. This place was just a few blocks away, so we decided to check it out.

This is going to sound like a silly thing to focus on, but the burrito I ordered had potatoes in it. Why have I never had a burrito with potatoes in it before? Why don't ALL burritos have potatoes in them? I don't think I can go back; El Metate might have ruined Chipotle for me forever.  Apart from the totally tuberous burrito, this place had a really cool ambiance. Brightly colored decorations all over the place, ample seating, and a friendly staff. Do the Mission Cliffs/El Metate combo, you won't be disappointed. 

To conclude: burrito contained potato, would buy again.
author: Adam D.

description: Yo fix the fucking door please. There is nothing worse then having a door open into you while you're in line and there is one square foot of space. Between getting smashed with Timbuk2 bags and the god damn fire code violating doorway , waiting for food at Metate gives me the urge to hurl myself underneath the 27 MUNI line. Good food otherwise.
author: Devon K.

description: I've driven by this cute taqueria many times and decided to get takeout today. I normally think fried fish tacos are too heavy but since they don't offer them grilled I decided to give a try considering all the rave reviews. Well they were right! These are the best fish tacos I have had outside of Mexico. They are light, crispy, and not greasy at all.  A must try.  The guacamole is nice and chunky and yummy too.  I will recommend.
author: anne m.

description: What can I say I love mexican food iam tryn to go every where I can find and eat there to see how it is...thanks to all you yelper's its easy to find great spots to eat..love this place will come back and hit it up again when Iam in town
author: David C.

description: Great food. Great price. The only downside was they didn't have any beers or margaritas. Wish we could have had a nice beer to go with our meal.
author: Lisa M.

description:
Dios mio! This restaurant rocks! The food is just splendid and their not overly priced. One would think that the best Mexican dishes would be around the area of 24th Street. That may be true but not when you have El Metate. This place has been around for about 5yrs now and their food has been consistent... consistently good. They have now expanded which proves that business is going really well despite being the only Mexican Restaurant off of 24th Street. Their food, from fish tacos to enchiladas, are overall great but I really have an intense craving for their carnitas burrito when I happen to be there.
Congratulations El Metate!
author: Chad B.

description:
We were told about this place by some locals we asked for a good cheap mexican restaurant since we know what it takes to make a taco. We took a short walk to the location and there was a line out the door... Good sign. We ordered our foodand by the time we say down the food was already being delivered, freshly made. The staff was extremely friendly, food was crazy delicious. Probably best mexican in the city in my opinion. The man at the register was kind enough to give us detail about this location and about the customers. 
We ordered two burritos, nachos, two tacos and two sodas, all for less than $25!!!! Fantastic deal!  As we were leaving we thanked the friendly staff for the great food and friendly atmosphere and they said "we hope to see you again. Thanks for coming" next time I'm in the city I know where I'll be going for mexican food. :)  I highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone.
author: Aleks P.

description: I live 3 blocks from El Metate, and love everything about the place. It's a true neighborhood restaurant and I think they have the best Mexican food in the Mission. For under $10 you can get a huge meal (I usually go for the 2 enchilada plate) and a drink. There is a pleasant dining area with outdoor seating for sunny days. The people are friendly and the service is fast. Highly recommended.
author: Esteban M.

description:
Mostly go here out of convenience since I'm in the area a lot.  Usually order for pick up, but once dined there and service wasn't great.  Food took a long time to get to us.  The waiter had our plate in his hand, and he knew it, but he decided to go find the people who the other plates in his hand were for.  He took 2 minutes to look for them, couldn't find them before finally giving us our plate.  2 minutes may not seem like long, but if you're sitting and waiting for your food and you actually time out 2 minutes, you'll be quite annoyed too.

Even at its best, doesn't stand out above any other SF taqueria.  If it's a burrito ye' is after, go to Chipotle to get the same experience with faster service.
author: AJ K.

description: I have to start by saying I could eat 5 alfajores in a minute! The alfajores ( butter cookies with dulce the leche in the middle) are the best in the city.... I also like their real food too :) ... Carne Asada is tasty, so is the chicken for burritos or quesadillas, but the fish tacos are super yummy!! Never had the fish burrito but I'm sure is good too. The staff is friendly, and they are fast, never waited more than 10 min for my food. And cheap too ... Love this place, I always go back for more
author: Karen P.

description: I've lived in the Mission aka a sea of taquerias for five years and this is my favorite one. The food is very reasonably priced, but always fresh and delicious. Most taquerias feel really unhealthy and I usually feel nauseous after eating from them, but El Metate is yummy in my tummy. I'm sure I've eaten a huge pile of burritos from this place over my lifetime. Think I might go there for dinner tonight.
author: Alex A.

description: Tortilla chips are like none I've ever tasted. Hence, nachos were an A+. Also, the salsa bar is great. Fruit salsa! Who would've thunk?
author: Lillian K.

description:
So, at 5:30 last night my partner and I decide we want to go into the city for food. She spent half an hour yelping trying to find someplace good to go. Then I get impatient that she's taking so long, and join in the search process. Then she has to tell me what she's found, and I have to tell her what I've found. Long story short, we didn't get on the road till 7:30. (That's life in our household, folks!) 

But the traffic gods were with us, and we got to El Metate in about half an hour. And man oh man--were we ever glad we went. All of that decision-making time was totally worth it.

 Even at 8pm on a Friday night, we only waited in line for 5 minutes, and the atmosphere was totally chill. The guy behind the cash register was helpful and not at all impatient. My partner ordered a shrimp burrito and I ordered the taco plate (one each of pork with chili verde and chicken with chili rojo). 

The food came in three minutes, and there was plenty of space to sit down. My food was delicious and almost more than I could eat. Her burrito was huge, and pretty good, though I think mine was better. Can't beat the price, either; we each paid under $10. 

I wish they'd had beer there, but that was the only thing that would have made it better. Otherwise, this is one of my new favorite places to go.
author: Em G.

description: Nice casual atmosphere, quick service, awesome food. They have the best salsa bar ever too!
author: Ashley T.

description:
This place is breasts!!!

I met darth vol at pirate cat and we decided to find something to eat.  I refuse to get an iPhone and without the magnificent power of the internet assuring us our decision was the best tat could be made, we opt-in at metate.  

This was a good call mostly because the food was delicious.  I had my standby, carne asada nachos, while darth vol had the chicken tacos.  Both of these were well received options.  The steak nachos were huge with a generous amount of guacamole.   the flavors were delicious and abundant.

the atmosphere was nice for a 'taquerilla' and the service prompt.  

go here, you will like it.
author: international super bert a.

description: the sauce bar is very good.  i bought a quesadilla though and got four slices. . . one of which was. . . completely void of filling and was quite disappointing.
author: Chris T.

description:
Got $2.75 burning a hole in your pocket and in search of something to fill you up? Get a fish taco at El Metate! Good Lord, the tacos are huge. Not only that but they are also lightly breaded and oh so tasty.

While bargain shopping, how about spending $1.50 for a pineapple horchata that will instantly transport you to Maui?

El Metate isn't without hiccups...the chips were pretty bland and chicken quesadilla just 'eh'. Not to worry, those tacos and horchata will definitely keep me coming back for more!
author: phil h.

description:
Big, juicy and you can barely fit it in your mouth. 

Yeah that's right. Rice, juicy pieces of carne asada and meaty carne asada juice, fresh gucamole, tangy salsa, (hold the beans - you don't want to hang out with me after) and just a big ole burrito fiesta in your mouth -- is why I'm seriously considering marrying a Mexican man so we can have burrito lunches and dinners.

The horchata is delicious - whoever invented horchata is a genius.  I'm going to get a dog, and I think I'm going to name it Horchata.
author: Vanessa W.

description:
I decided to try this place out with my softball team. One of the guys has been obsessing with this place forever and he kept trying to convince me that this is the best taqueria place ever and there is no places in the city that are better. I disagree with him but this place is not bad at all. I would give it 3.5 stars if they had half stars. 
The atmosphere is awesome and the owner is really nice. I got to share a quesadilla and a super burrito with my fiance. I also saw what everyone ordered (nachos, tostada salad, tortas, etc.) and they all looked good but not great. The steak Quesadilla we had was a step above Taco Bell while the Burrito was pretty good but not awesome. I still think for Quesadillas you go to El Farolito and for BUrritos yo
author: Nir B.

description:
I haven't yelped in a while, but decided I had to for El Metate.  The food (almost) tastes like it came out of my mom's kitchen, and my mom is the best cook I know.  It's cheap, fresh, low-key, quick, unpretentious, and most importantly it's damn delicious and perfect for lunch or din.  I ordered the chicken quesadilla con guacomole and was happily satisfied. It was so big, I was stuffed with half.  My friend ordered the fish burrito and finished every last bite.  

Make sure you try the variety of salsas. A must try is the horchata, which is this yummy rice milk drink. It's perfect here!  Most places water it down or make it too sweet to compensate for flavor, but it's delicious at Metate and a must to accompany your dish.  

I only wished I lived closer--I'd be a regular.
author: mar m.

description:
Quality food, good portions, and affordable.  I've had their tacos, burritos, and nachos so far without any disappointment.

The place is also very clean and has great ambiance.  Most  places in the Mission are dirty/hole in the wall spots (which is fine), so it's a nice change of pace!

They also use Belly (https://www.bellycard.com/businesses/17765-el-metate) so you can get points for just checking in when you visit.  As you accumulate points, you can get free food (50pts=free burrito).
author: Aalok P.

description:
Francisco is my new hero! He agreed again to donate (tax-deductible) food to our group upon my request the next couple months. Welcoming and dedicated, the huge amount of colorful burritos (sliced in half) are always presented in a bowl, decorated with salsa and chips.
The $5 burritos are filled with veggies, rice, and beans. Some burritos and tacos can be ordered with chicken or other meats of course. Many more tasteful options on their menu!
It can be busy during lunch and dinner hour. There is a nice restaurant inside.
author: Tigre T.

description:
Came here on a whim with my boyfriend while we were waiting for Sunday brunch at a restaurant nearby and we got the fish tacos as a snack... (It was 1 in the afternoon and we hadn't eaten anything all day, hence the snack before brunch.) 

The fish tacos were ok. The fish was good but I wish they had the creamy Baja sauce! I'd like to come back though and try other stuff on the menu like the tortas and chicken flautas :)
author: Jess H.

description: Best shrimp burrito I've ever had. The nachos were really good as well. But the shrimp burritos for me were the best. Super juicy with lots of flavor. The place is also on the outskirts of the mission, which means you avoid the over crowded symptoms of the mission.
author: Bassam D.

description:
Reliable, tasty -- we go here all the time. 
Get burritos, tacos, quesadillas; would not recommend the enchiladas.
author: Bill S.

description:
Oh Metate, what a restaurant.

This is by far my favorite burrito restaurant in San Francisco, nay the world. Whenever I am in the Mission, I make a point to get some amazing Mexican food from Metate.

One time I took my friend to Metate on the way to the airport. After experiencing the glory that is a Metate burrito, he has not been able to stop talking about how that was the best burrito he has ever had.
author: Jacob H.

description: Really peeps? Four stars for this place?  I think not.  Got the carne asada burrito with refried beans, guacamole, sour cream, and salsa. Let's break it down: tortilla was great, the meat? I don't know, couldn't taste it because there was so little of it, I basically had a vegetarian burrito.  Guacamole, what guacamole? Did they put any in or was it that green stuff that's been cheapened by too much sour cream mixed in so that they could save money on not having to put more avocado into their guacamole. Nice variety at the salsa bar without the grilled chiles or marinated onions/carrot/jalepenos traditional to most taquerias.
author: b t.

description: Line is a bit slow but otherwise this place is a total gem. Excellent food and cheap prices. Try the strawberry aqua fresca and a sunny seat outside.
author: M R.

description:
Wow! I love this place, it's just slightly off the beaten path, so it isn't too busy, but still deliver's food on par with the best places on Mission or Valencia, if not better. Their burritos aren't too huge or over filled and have just the right balance of ingredients. everything is fresh and well seasoned, the menu is quite large (plenty of meat, fish and veggie options), the staff is nice and for a whole-in-the-wall its delightfully clean. Top that off with the fact that the prices are reasonable and you can BYOB and you have a winner! 

A+
author: Alex D.

description:
Was I on crack when I wrote my initial review 3.5 years ago?!

Metate has disappointed my last couple trips. As much as I love the boys there, and as much as I love the renovations over the last couple years, their quality has dropped. My last burrito was not hot. I might even go as far to say that it was cold. Clear indicator was the cheese wouldn't melt. The tortilla was also hard and crunchy in spots. These things never happened before so hope this review puts them back in check and back on track!
author: Susan L.

description:
Super super good carnitas and grilled chicken burritos. $6 with guac, cheese and sour cream (not as big as Gordo's "super" though). Also great tacos and horchata. Many friends of mine are big fans of other dishes on the long menu that I have yet to try. Thick crispy chips if you're wondering. 

Feels more authentic than many of the mexican restaurants around town but I'm no authority on this. 

Highly recommend grabbing a small crew to join you here so you can sample El Metate's variety 'family style.'
author: David W.

description: Decided to explore other Taquerias..away from the other popular 16th Valencia corridor burritos joints and found this place to be pretty good. I ordered the pollo rojo super burrito and it had nice chunks of chicken, with mild flavor. The chips were fresh; both corn and flour. The best part was the price...two burritos & two Crystal geysers for ~ 15 bucks!
author: marcus c.

description:
El Metate isn't a real gritty place and its not legit in typical mission fashion. That said the food is great and the price is right. White washed in some respects the torta is one of the best I have ever had. The burrito is great too.I'd eat here everyday if i could. nice selection of salsas and hot sauces as well.

Order or a Super Carnitas Burrito! The carnitas is percect.
The Torta de asada is one of the best I have had.
author: James B.

description:
In terms of value, you can't touch this place.  It's seriously the best deal in town for Mexican food, and arguably all restaurants in general.  Including McDonalds.  Seriously?  Consider this:

20 bucks = a metric yard of burritos.  Seriously.

Unlike most Potretro/Mission Mexican eatery establishments it is unusually clean and spacious.  They actually had to draw fake cracks on the wall to make it look authentic!  I was even a little weirded out by the space age cash register in the front.  You could also show up with 20 people here unannounced and you'll be fine.  It's a giant cave.

The food is above average, as is the service.  I asked for the very best/most popular burrito and the very friendly cashier wove some custom concoction together for me, then it was hand delivered by a man in glistening white clothing, straight out of a detergent commercial, all smiles and mustaches.  These people are angelic.

This is the Cuban "La Carreta" equivalent of Mexican eateries.  Nothing blew my mind yet, but I've only a small taste of the menu.  I shall return and bring my army, for I can afford to splurge here!
author: niero g.

description:
I used to be a devoted patron of El Farolito, but after a while, the quality of their food went downhill. I gravitated towards El Metate as a result, and I really do think that their grub Ive ordered is good. Juicy Al Pastor, good fish, good soup, nice tortas (but seemed to be better when they were at their little annex convenience store next door), nice staff, but be sure to get your food to go, because the clientele are HORRIBLE. So bad, in fact, that the place loses a star, even though it's not really the fault of the restaurant. *That* is how much it compromises the culinary experience.

Imagine all of the patrons from a Whole Foods market and a Rainbow Grocery and cram all of their rude asses into one small space, and that's El Metate. and.. it's gotten worse over the years.

Here are a few quick reasons why El Metate, a place with pretty good food, should be TO GO only.

- The patronage have ZERO concept of salsa bar etiquette i.e. ONE PERSON AT A TIME, especially with a bar as small as E.M.s. What salsa-related emergency warrants you getting up into my personal space so you can have some cucumbers RIGHT NOW?

- They ask insanely stupid, time-sucking questions when they reach the counter "What's your best burrito? How is the soup today?" How do you think the soup is? It's hot and filled with ingredients. Look at the menu while in line, instead of doing stuff to your iPhone, and maybe you will find these non-questions as irrelevant as the rest of us.

- They smack of attitude and self-entitlement, "OMG, I dont even know what line Im in!" (hint: there is only one, and you're not in it)  "Let me just give you some money and you can buy me a soda!" The whiny girly-girl who asked me that proceeded to get quite flustered and upset when, instead of being her personal shopping boy, I offered for her to cut in front of me to buy the soda herself. "No! FINE! WHAT-EVER!" Um ok,, then go back to gringo-land, you nasty person. Last time I do a favor for someone in that place.

This taqueria has become so synonymous with people of this ilk, it's to the point I am actually embarrassed to be seen in there. 

When I go in to order, I keep my head down until I reach the counter, order, and get out as quickly as I can, because the experience can be so irritating and grating that the longer the exposure, the more unhealthy it feels.

It is good their food is decent, (it really is) because most of their customers are absolute shit-heads.

In short: 

Food = four stars
Atmosphere = toxic

To Go Only

I think I need to find a new neighborhood place.
author: Jonny P.

description: Very good burrito. Not super busy on a weekend afternoon so the service was quick, but I know sometimes they can be packed.
author: Greg S.

description:
I recently moved in a block away from El Metate, and everyone told me how lucky I was to live so close. The first time I went, I received one of the most delicious burritos I've ever had.

Unfortunately, every time I've gone since then they've gotten my order very wrong. My preferred meal is a steak burrito (steak, rice, and beans in a tortilla). Instead, they serve me a super burrito (+ sour cream, guac, and cheese, three foods which I do not enjoy, and which they charge extra for), even after I say "not super". When I've pointed out the mistake, they've made me a new burrito... that still contains the ingredients I don't want, leaving me eat a very disappointing meal. I'm sure this problem stems from the fact that the employee who takes the orders will answer the phone while I'm mid sentence with him, and won't let me clarify my order if I think he's gotten it wrong.

The food at El Metate is great... if you can get the food you want. The service is far from great.
author: Michael F.

description: I live in the midwest and highly popular Mexican restaurants out here can't match the quality, taste and value of this place.  The burritos are just plain tasty, especially when you add their fresh guacamole, salsa options and chips.  I wasn't a huge fan of the tacos.  Burritos are the way to go here!  I imagine there are plenty of great Mexican places all over San Francisco, but this one was closest to where I spent most of my time.  I only ate there once and the place is kind of messy.  Otherwise I'd give it 5 stars.  But really if that stops you in the Mission......
author: Mario V.

description:
Officially my favorite burrito place. It's consistently good here and you don't feel like you're heavy and stuffed with food after you eat the whole burrito. Albeit you are full for awhile, but you don't feel guilty for eating the entire thing.

Carnitas is still my absolute favorite. The crispiness, oh dear. I couldn't finish my entire burrito today so I just got a fork and ate all the tasty bits inside (is that a burrito fail?). SO GOOD. Perfect rice, perfect sauce, perfect guacamole, melted cheese, etc.

Two carnitas burritos with everything, one coke and one medium horchata. ALL FOR $16. AWESOME!!!
author: Angela H.

description: I love the set-up of this place. You'll love it like I do and the food isn't bad for the Mission and that is saying a lot!
author: Some D.

description:
El Metate is a money spot, and since I live pretty far away I don't get to go here that often.

I've gone twice and was really pumped on the experience both times.

I really dig this place based on the quality of food, the affordability, and the dine-in experience.

Did you know you can bring your own beer?  Holy shit, son, that's a great feature.

Hot sauce?  Yeah, they have tons to choose from and the restaurant is very much a serve-yourself, laid back spot.  However, they bring the food out to you, which means you should tip.

So go to this place and try the taco plate, all the options damn good.
author: L J.

description:
I come here way too often not to upgrade my rating.  I enjoy their tamales (not as good as my own but they satisfy the craving), burritos, tacos, flautas, etc.

It always hits the spot and your wallet will barely notice it.  Great staff - love that they always play banda in the background - you find so many former classics transformed.  Priceless!
author: Jennie M.

description: El Metate offers up a tasty burrito with a competent salsa bar.  There are no frills or San Francisco-esque twists on the burrito, but the price is decent for a burrito that is satisfactory in size for lunch.  El Metate is a strong option in the neighborhood, but I prefer the Mexican options in the heart of the Mission, and would not go out of my way to dine here.
author: Andrew M.

description: The building is interesting, but the food is really inauthentic Mexican, especially for the Mission District. You can find food that is more fresh and less expensive on almost any corner. To make matters worse, everything is pre-made & you can't change anything from the menu. The staff is also kind of weird, I've stood at the register & had the staff come out of the bathroom visibly stoned, which is OK if your friendly & coherent, but they were not. Top it off with my ex-girlfriend's dad (who is Mexican American) getting sick and you really could do much better.
author: Marlon B.

description: Good food, but not great.  Awkward and small seating area.  We finally found a place to sit, but it felt more like a college cafeteria than a restaurant.  I got the chicken quesadilla and it was only so-so.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Came here for lunch while working at SFGH.  The place is really cute.  The outside chairs and tables will remind you of the decor found in Mexico (which they probably got it from =P ), and makes it look so lively.  The inside seating area is nicer and more spacy... but on a nice SF day, why not take advantage of the outside seating area with the umbrellas! 

I got the Colorado burrito ( i think that's what it was called) that came with colorado chile, steak, and potatoes.  I thought it would be similar to a california burrito found in SoCal, but I was so wrong.  The burrito was good, but like many other mexican restaurants, it comes with too much rice, and too little meat. It was flavorful and not spicy... but where was the meat!!  Seriously.  The salsa was a watery red liquid that lacked flavor.  The chips were really good and fresh, but it would have been nice to have a good salsa to dip it in!   They also have these fresh fruit drinks that are DELICIOUS!!!! I wish I had gotten one, but I tried my friend's strawberry drink, and MAN, it was soooo refreshing!  They had multiple flavors: strawberry, horchata, cantaloupe, watermelon, and some others.  Get one, it's only $1.50 and REALLY GOOD.

The place is pretty popular for lunch and has ample seating for groups, but I think I prefer Taqueria San Francisco (even tho it's less nice).  I might be back to try other things, but so far, I was not impressed other than the cute ambiance complimented by a nice sunny day in SF.
author: Diane L.

description: Really good Mexican food. Spot is a little small but the food is delicious!
author: Jr A.

description: Very nice people. Fast service. Always friendly when I go in. I always call in my order and they have it ready when I come in.  Nice neighborhood restaurant. Super veggie burritos are awesome. Fruit & cucumber salsa is yummy.  Fish tacos are yummy. Prices are starting to go up again is the only drawback.
author: Goddess D.

description:
What happened? 

Used to love these guys, but I just got a burrito from them and it was literally thinner than the little cup of salsa.  (Maybe 2 inches in diameter, tops.)

It tasted good, but when I want a burrito I want a classic SF Mission Burrito™, not an Urban Food Twig™.

I hope this was an anomaly rather than a new trend in hard times.  Either way, it will probably be some time before I head back.
author: A. Tobias T.

description:
Wow! an inexpensive, cool, neighborhood hangout-with really good food.
We'll be back when next in SF.
author: Alan R.

description: Burritos here are so good. They are long and skinny as opposed to short(er) and fat. Great tasting vegetables, rice, beans within. Toasting the burrito after the wrap gives it a nice warm-through, and browned exterior. The meats are excellent as well, having tasted the carnitas and chicken. Tender and super flavorful. Will definitely stop by again.
author: Ray C.

description: These guys work really hard to provide some great food at a great price. The owner puts a lot of effort into running a solid business, and I'm always happy when I go there. Gets busy sometimes, but they have a large dining area with great decorations and character. Getttt at it!
author: erich s.

description:
So I've been here before, a year or two ago, my hubby raves about their veggie burrito, but as a meat eater it's against my beliefs to get anything totally veggie. So I tried the steak super burrito. Meh, not that great.

Then today, we decided to go there again, and I looked up reviews on Yelp for what else to try. Apparently, yelpers had rave reviews about their chicken burrito. Got that. Meh, not that great either.

But, having no shame and also being really hungry from a workout, I also ordered a fish taco. Now FINALLY I found something to go back for! I also tried a bite of his steak taco, definitely going to get that one next time too! 

Taqueria Cancun still has my heart as far as the steak super burrito goes... :) 

TIP: they also opened a sitdown area next door, so I think you can order your food and then go sit down and they'll bring it to you.
author: Radha S.

description:
This review is for non-burrito/taco/quesadilla entrees.

GOOD:
- This place is a few bucks cheaper per entree compared to many other places in the Mission.
- They give you nice serving of beans and rice and chips with your entree (because the main dish sucks).

JUST OK:
- The TAMALES entree was kind of bland and dry. To be fair though, I have been unimpressed with most tamales in the Bay Area.
- The ENCHILIDAS were also very average and tasteless and lacking in fillings.

BAD:
- None.

CONCLUSION:
This place gives BIG portions of AVERAGE food for cheap prices. If you get a burrito and all your friends get an entree, you will feel like you got a crappy deal because your dish doesn't come with jack squat except chips. There are much better Mexican joints in the neighborhood at a similar price point.
author: Alex P.

description: I came here for lunch after a recommendation in my food guidebook. I love Mexican people and Mexican food, so I trusted that El Metate was gonna feed me well.  I thought it was a traditional restaurant - sit, order with the waiter, etc, but you actually have to order at the little room adjacent to the dining room and then you sit down and they bring it to you.  The guy working the register was so friendly - I felt good about this place!  I order 2 tacos - al pastor and pollo con chile rojo. The meat in both of them were perfect - so tasty and flavorful. The salsas they have at the salsa bar were also great! I had the fruit salsa and the red salsa. My only small complaint is that the tacos were a bit wet/soggy. Maybe it was my own fault, I'm not sure, but I am still giving this place 5 stars because everything about this place is phenomenal - the food, the service, the decor, everything! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone in the SF area.
author: Christina T.

description: El Metate has good food, genuine service, and comfortable seating.  The Super Burrito is not the type of "super" that one would normally expect because it is skinnier, however, it is extremely tasty and worthwhile.  The enchiladas were decent but the green sauce I ordered was too salty.  Thus far, I'm more a fan of their carne asada than their pollo.  My favorite part of El Metate is the salsa bar, which has real star power.  There is an array of different heat levels and fruit salsas--which go great with the complimentary chips.
author: Diane N.

description:
I work at SF General Hospital this place is fast and good. The cooks whip up your food right there while your watching. If you go for veggie burritos hey they add real vegs broccoli, zucchini, carrots all fresh. You can also call in ahead of time because around noon this place gets packed. 

My fav is tacos de carnitas w/ whole pinto beans...the bomb!!!!
author: Romana R.

description:
El Metate is my favorite Mexican restaurant - ever. They deliver consistently delicious, authentic fare at an extremely reasonable price. The veggie burrito is particularly delicious because it includes fresh, grilled carrots, broccoli, zucchini, etc. in addition to rice, beans, and the optional dairy. 

I really appreciate the addition of the dining room, as well as the new party facility next door (where La Tiendita used to be). This is also a great place to take kids. My 1-year-old has been accompanying me here since he was 4-weeks-old and now that he can finally eat, he scarfs their black beans. It's one of the very few things he will eat. 

Honestly though, I hate their tortilla chips enough to knock one star off of my review. They are thick and tasteless, like eating crunchy, salted cardboard. Everything else I have tried is so delicious that it makes up for the yucky chips. 

I love you, El Metate.
author: Who Knows N.

description:
Delicious food and friendly service AND a great place to sit and relax after a long day of work and football (soccer) practice.

My buddy ordered three fish tacos and I ordered a regular burrito al pastor.  I tried one of his tacos and he took a good number of bites of the al pastor.

Thumbs up all the way around.

We washed it all down with bottled Coca-cola from Mexico (No High-Fructose Corn Syrup!!!  Just real cane sugar!!!  Yay!!!)

I'll be back for more, El Metate.   American soft drinks suck.  Bottled Mexican Coke is the best! :)
author: Justin C.

description: Quesodilla has an added "special cheese." This place is phenomenal!
author: Michael W.

description:
So many people seem to love this place, but I have yet to figure out why.  The fish tacos so highly recommended by many, were like a fish stick in a tortilla.  I wouldn't eat a fish stick on a regular day, but to purport that your fish tacos are the best and then throw rice in a tortilla and top it w/ a fish stick is OFFENSIVE.  Has anyone had a real fish taco?  Fish, in Sausalito makes a fine fish taco.
I think that most people think of Mexican food as street food and if that is the case this place is failing at that too.  I will never ever ever go back here which is a shame, b/c the seating area is fun and colorful.
author: David S.

description:
I'm from So Cal and the Mexican food out there is to die for! So when I moved out here I was dying to have some really great Mexican food. I was really disappointed, not in just this place, but all the places out here, tortillas. They all taste fake and rubbery, and not hand made at all. I think this place is more Americanized than most other places out here.

The food is OK, but not great. However, it is appetizing for an after work meal. Like I said, the tortillas don't taste that great. Just recently I also noticed that the size of the burritos shrank as well. I can go to 24th St to El Farolito and get a burrito for the same price, that's bigger, and still have money left over. That's one reason why I gave them 3 stars.

However, the service/people there are very friendly, and that's another small reason why I shall return.
author: Ashley S.

description:
This is one of my favorite burrito shops in the mission for multiple reasons:

1) burritos are well priced. 6 bucks plus an extra if you want to add sour cream, cheese and guac.
2) they offer tons of healthy options. I totally crave their grilled veggie burrito. it has everything from carrots to cabbage to broccoli, and it's really lightly sauteed but not greasy at all. they offer black and pinto beans instead of just refried. they have wheat, spinach and chipotle tortillas in addition to the basic flour. wheat and chipotle are bomb! spinach is a little dry and not as tasty in my opinion.
3) they are SO friendly there and despite there nearly always being a line out the door, they are fast. 
4) you can call in orders to pick up or go sit and eat there. they have a much nicer ambiance then most taquerias in this part of town as the sitting area is separate from the ordering counter. they also have some outside tables for sunny mission days.

basically, i love this place. zero complaints except that more people are catching onto it's awesomeness and now i feel like i'm getting trendy for going here. boo for that.
author: theresa v.

description: My go-to place when I don't want to get very far for a decent burrito (which isn't too far given that I live in the Mission) but this place always hits the spot! My favorite, at the moment, is the chile verde pork burrito!! If you haven't tried it, YOU GOTTA TRY IT!!! The horchata is good (but of course, the Salvadorean horchata is waaaay better).  Next on my list to try are the fish tacos and the tostada salad without letting the burrito change my mind! This place is a very good place to go when you want a cheap burrito and don't want to travel far if you live nearby!
author: Jessica H.

description: 5 stars for the being a place in San Francisco where I can find simple 'healthy-ish' cheap food. I had a  veggie taco that had lightly cooked carrot, zucchini and BROCCOLI (yes! exciting!). Shrimp taco was excellent. Fish taco...not for me so much, breaded a bit heavy, cooked a bit too long. Big choice of salsas, I liked the guacamole tho I wanted to add a bit of pepper to it.
author: Karma R.

description: Horrible customer service and tasteless food  the big lady at the cash register is extremely rude I was told by her or he that the tripas burritos are not serve at her or his taqueria
author: Vince J.

description:
My friend and I came up here after an epic bike ride to San Francisco. "Dang," we said, "but we sure are hungry. Best we gets a lot of food." So we got two burritos and nachos, planning to finish them all.


HAHAHHAHAHA YEAH RIGHT. 

The burritos were as big as your head; the nachos were somehow even bigger. We totally gave up on our initial plans, although I report with satisfaction that we were able to finish off the burritos.
author: Grant M.

description:
Dear El Metate,

Your Chile Verde is awesome.  
Your prices are good.  
I love your Flan, except recently there have been funny (bad) tasting spots in it, that taste a bit like pine trees.  ???  
Can you fix that?  I really want to get back to my all flan diet!
Thanks
-Liz
XOXO
author: Liz A.

description:
My girlfriend and I have gone here twice after passing it multiple times. It has such a friendly street view that we just had to try it. We split the grilled chicken burrito for about $6!! Compared to El Farrolito, I could actually distinguish the poultry as coming from a real chicken and compared to Chipolte, I didn't feel like have my meal consisted completely of rice.

We tried the guacamole last night and I LOVED it. They must put a little sour cream in there or something because it's nice and creamy/tangy.

If you want a quick, cheap, satisfying burrito in the Mission (not on 24th St.) this is the place. Go on a sunny day and sit outside under the umbrellas. mmmm now I'm hungry again.
author: Marjorie P.

description:
A VERY SOLID 4 STARS.

I really like this place.  They make everything fresh and you can taste that when you eat here.

I started with the TORTAS here.  All the tortas here are really good, and really big!  Definitely a steal considering the prices are really cheap.

I also really enjoy the TACOS here, really good too.  I haven't had any bad food here and I don't think it is gonna change.
author: Jonathan C.

description: Yeah...a million Mexican places in SF, but go here. It's not greasy, the expanded space is noce & clean, Francisco is the best host...and they have consistenly tasty food. Great for those time when you crave Mexican and don't have much time...
author: S S.

description: Amazing! So flavorful, delicious and the right price.  $7.25 you eat like a king.  The enchiladas are probably my favorite, I get them half & half (half green sauce, half red).  Sooooo good.  I have also tried the pork tamales, amazing.  You cannot loose with this place and the price is so nice.
author: Louis C.

description:
After trying the famed torta at La Tiendita next door, I knew I had to try a burrito at El Metate. I really don't know how it is possible I have lived in SF as long as I have without finding this place! 

Its a typical San Francisco burrito with the usual choice of beans/salsa/meats etc. The quality was tops, the ingredients were fresh and the whole beans in mine had a great smokey flavor.

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/San_francisco_burrito

I picked up two, one for the little lady and one for myself with two sodas. The damage: $11! Really? A quality burrito under $5? Its true as of 2-16-09, a regular burrito is only $4.75 and well worth it. I've paid nearly that much for a single and far inferior burrito elsewhere (Andale...sigh)

The only small irritation is waiting in the cramped line to order, but the dining room is spacious and decorated to make you smile. El Metate is definitely going to supply the next few burritos in my future. Eric F said: "Just like your favorite burrito joint in the mission... Only cleaner!" I couldn't agree more. Updates to come.
author: Zac H.

description:
Pricey for a single, less-than-fist-size chile relleno -- one roasted pepper for $6??  Steep.  I had to order two chile relleno plates to be satisfied.

Undeniably appetizing - the food is great and the atmosphere nice.
author: K G.

description:
I went to El Metate wanting a torta.  I didn't see them on the menu, so I got a burrito.  Did I ever tell you how I don't like burritos in this city.  I don't.  Bite me.  So, when I went to sit down in the dining area what did I see, a bunch of people eating tortas.  WTF!  I now know that to get their tortas one has to visit the shop next door.  I can't even remember what meat i got in my burrito, but i did want a little cup of salsa to dip my chips in.  Anywho, the dining area at El Metate is nice that a lot of other taquerias, seperate from the counter with almost a sit down restaraunt feel.

Anywho, on a whim I got one of the alfajores sitting on the counter, I thought it was a little spendy for a cookie, but I have a sweet tooth that will make me weigh 450 lbs some day, and the friendly employee dude told me how they raised the price because everywhere else they charged twice as much for them and that they were homemade by a little blind lady or something.  Oh, alfajores are shortbread cookies stuffed with dulce de leche, they look like a negative oreo.  You know what, by the end of my burrito I was way too full to completely enjoy the cookie, so I stuck it in my murse and rode around town to do this and that.  A week later after going to the market i unpacked my bag and found my poor forgotten alfajore in the side pocket of my murse.

Did I forget to talk about how i rode up and down Van Ness, Harrison, and Folsom before heading up Bryant and finding El Metate?  I think i did like 10 miles in 20 block radius.  Anyway, that was my stupid fault, not El Metate, I can't really rate a place according to my stupidity.  

So, I think Mr. Alfajore sat on my counter for another day until while making dinner one day I decided to pop open his little plastic tub and take a bite.  

WHOA!  This cookie was awesome.  Really light and flakey shortbread cookie and creamy, caramelly filling.  I couldn't resist eating the whole thing before my dinner was done cooking.  It was amazing!

i'll go back one day to check out a torta, maybe even remember how to get there.  And maybe be fantasizing about my alfajore until i go back for another one (sorry mint CocoJo, I'm totally cheating on you, I know).

OK, so went back for the Torta this weekend and I'd have to say it was pretty good.  I got the Ranchero with chicken milanesa, nicely cooked/breaded/crunchy.  I likes the spiciness of the jalepeno, the creaminess of the avocado and the cheese in it is amazing fresh farm cheese stuff (I was expecting jack).  And the chipolte sauce also added a nice smoky kick.  I decided to get soup over chips and was not disappointed.  Tortilla soup with still slightly crunchy chips, more cheese, lots of chicken and very yummy broth.  I found the chicken a bit dry, but overall the soup was good.  All of this for only a little more than a fiver is pretty fricken bitchen.  I only ate half my sannie and saved the rest for later.  Also, had to have another alfajore, YUM!

Oh yeah it was SUCH a nice day in SF that I sat out on the sidewalk, so nice.
author: Adrian L.

description: One of my favorites.  Love the chile colorado burrito with steak and potatoes!
author: Chris G.

description: Took me forever to try this place out, mostly because I couldn't find parking!  Anyways, this place is worth trying and judging for your self if this type of Mexican food if good.  I like it ALOT!
author: Demanding T.

description:
This is the closest place to where I live for food, so I'm here often enough.  Let me just say, this place is really quite good.  Tacos, yum!  Quesadillas, too big, but yum yum yum!  Haven't had the burritos for some reason, but they look heavenly, and everyone get's them (a sign for me, I'm sure.) They also have homemade Horchata, which may be my favorite guilty pleasure!

I give them only 4 simply because I'm not a fan of their tortas!  Everything else there that I've had was delicious, but the tortas weren't anything special.  Come here for the yummy tacos, burritos and chile relleno, not the torta sandwiches. And the Horchata!
author: Peter T.

description:
El Metate is really good, BUT IT'S SO DAMN SALTY! what's up with that? tried the pastor quesadillas? my god, so greasy and salty. it's too bad, because it's really good. 
my favorite: the chicken soup. the best in town :P
it'd be a 4* if they cut on the salt. A-OK for now.
author: M S.

description:
"Just like your favorite burrito joint in the mission... Only cleaner!"

Hey owner, feel free to use that slogan in your advertising, free of charge.  You don't even need to pay me a royalty, it's just my way of saying thank you for serving me really great burritos and nachos at reasonable prices without the typical gut bomb that I feel from most of my other favorite Mexican spots in the city.

I do have one small request however in exchange for using my slogan.  Please bring back the Cholula hot sauce, you know the one I'm talking about, it's the one with the round wooden cap.  I know you have 15 to 20 other hot sauces on hand and these are tough economic times but please spend the few extra dollars a month and hook me up with some Cholula.

Thanks!
author: eric f.

description:
Can't ever decide which is better: The Vegetarian Quesadilla or the Chicken Milanesa Torta, so...  We always get both. 

Gotta mention the Fish Tacos and Pineapple Salsa.
author: PukaShell s.

description:
The brightly painted yellow wooden chairs caught my eye as we were walking down the street to get sushi, and when the sushi place closed, I insisted we go check this place out.

It turned out to be the best tacos I've had.  Super friendly owner, amazing agua fresca (8 flavors including strawberry, pineapple and mango), and delicious tacos, burritos, and everything mexican made from the freshest ingredients.  

My favorite was the fish taco, but the pork and the chicken were also delicious.

Very recommended as a cheap but amazing place to eat Mexican in the Mission District!
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Was in the mood to try somewhere in a different neighborhood, and figured if El Metate didn't work out, we could always head over to Humphry Slocombe and cut our losses.

We didn't need to though.  The burritos were actually a perfect size.  The super carnitas  was filled but not over filled.  And best of all the carnitas themselves were crispy and flavorful.

The nachos were a heafty plate that took down my son.  I've NEVER seen him give up on food before and there was right before my eyes.  Amazing.
author: Michael M.

description: Stands out as the mexican place in the mission that has the freshest ingredients. Everything is really good and tastes really healthy. Their taco plates are awesome (great carnitas), the salsa, tomatoes, and guacamole are really fresh. Good salsas too.
author: michael q.

description:
Que sabor, que rico, que delicioso......que fantastico!

Needless to say we've been loving El Metate. Another haven of delicious Mexican food in the Mission. 

Wonderful and friendly for eating at the restaurant, and even more special to order the food to go and have it for a party at home.

Thanks to Francisco and his nice staff. Favorite right now is the Chili Verde.
author: Mickey A.

description:
I've eaten so many burritos here it's kind of embarrassing.  

Other amazing dishes:
- Fish tacos
- Quesadillas (are huge)

Fair prices, food comes out quickly and it's tasty as hell.
author: Pete S.

description: Burritos are cheap and fast, but a little on the skinny side. I got a carnitas super burrito and it was good, but I wasn't too impressed. The "super" part was supposed to be guac, sour cream and cheese, but mine just had a pinch of each. They have a ton of other things on their menu, so I wouldn't be opposed to coming back and trying something else, but probably not the burrito again. The people working there seemed really friendly and nice.
author: Kim L.

description:
BYOB  - W #4*

El Metate is not the restaurant I would use my one call from jail on. They are totally unreliable. They put pinto beans on my plate once when I clearly ordered refried and only when I pointed it out did they bother to tell me they ran out of refried so made my second choice for me. They also have been inconsistent in quality and quantity in my several visits.

The added on room where you can enjoy your brought in booze and potentially good or bad food, depending on the day, is decorated to try to make you think you are sitting outside in a little Mexican village - one that has shelves of hot sauce on the walls. It works for somewhere to eat but is not nearly as exciting as jail. 

I actually recommend you actually don't ever get your ass thrown in jail and if you happen to find yourself there do not waste the call on any restaurant, reliable or not. 
_______________________________________

*Bum wine consumed: 
Cisco Green Apple - By far the worst of the Cisco flavors so far. You have to be a pretty damn down and out bum to stomach this flavor. With so many more choices I can't imagine why any bum would choose this particular flavor
