Cisco Blue Raspberry - Only good if consumed after the Green Apple flavor
Cisco Berry - I suspect all of the red flavors of Cisco are the exact same thing but labeled differently. I will have to do more research to be sure. 

Between three of us we split three small bottles, and though mildly buzzed I was not drunk nor did I wake up with a headache. I think Cisco may only be dangerous after you tap into bottle #2.
author: Drue C.

description:
I've seen the way you look at me with your judgmental eyes. I've heard the whispers. "wow, bucky likes to eat a lot of burritos." No one else knows that better than me. And yet... you still couldn't hide El Metate from me. I found it yesterday suckas... 

That place is tiny. I think they only have three or four two-spots inside, but the line was much longer than available seats. Always a good sign. I had the steak burrito and Jen had the fish tacos. There's a dirty joke in there somewhere, but I am going to try and abstain from such low brow humor. Back to the food, it was tasty and cheap, cheap, cheap. No alcohol on premises so I went for the traditional taqueria fall-back, Mandarin  Los Jarritos. My fav.

The best part about El Metate. The name. I've decided that if I ever become hard up for cash I'm going to move to South America and become an exotic dancer and adopt the name El Metate!!!

"Hello ladies. I am El Metate!"
"Would you like to see El Metate's underpants?"
"El Metate would very much love to gyrate his hips for you."
"El Metate's favorite dance is the Lambada. That is the forbidden dance..."

El Metate!
author: Bucky K.

description:
One of my favorite Mexican places in San Francisco.

They have amazing vegie nachos (that come with carrots) and they are famous for their fish tacos.

Those two things are so good that I never want to try anything else, but I'm sure there is something else on their menu that is just as amazing!
author: Xavier G.

description:
Like a Bedouin shepherd drawn to a desert mirage, I'd been feeling the pull of El Metate for a few weeks, after passing it repeatedly on many blissful, slightly-hungover, post-coital, morning stumbles home from my boyfriend's in Potrero Hill. 

Finally, we decided to meet up for dinner there on a Sunday evening...

We're so creative. Like we don't patronize enough taquerias... Living in Potrero and the Mission with the whole 24th Street corridor in between us... I'm really going to be annoyed with myself if I yelp another taqueria... What can I say, alright? We drink a lot of booze, have a lot of morning sex, and eat a lot of burritos. This is the PERFECT MAN FOR ME.

Anyway, El Metate is so pretty on the outside. It really always intrigued me for that reason... Most Mission taquerias are nasty-looking. But not this one. It's a cheerful yellow stucco building on the end of a drab block of Bryant, and they even use, like, Comic Sans font on their signage or something. As if to say, "Eat here! Even though one block over there are a MILLION TAQUERIAS WITH THE SAME FOOD! Because our food is joyful! And comic! Comic Sans! Happy, happy tacos!"

And inside, the happiness theme continues. It's bright and cheerful and -- small. You pretty much should never go here when it's raining, because you're going to end up sitting outside nine times out of ten. 

But, the happiness theme ALSO continued in my stomach. Their fish tacos are really good. Mmm mmm mmm good. The fish were swimming around and flipping in my tummy saying, "We're so happy to make you happy! Eat that entire huge portion in front of you! We taste sooo good just for you and NO stomach acid doesn't burn so don't feel bad! We're smiling down here! EAT MORE!"

How did I know this? Because I was burping little conversation bubbles with their fish-words written there in Comic Sans. Ask my boyfriend.

It's Halloween. We just made rum "witches brew" in my office. I am drunk yelping at work and feeling a little wonky, okay?
author: Lisa T.

description:
Tasty Mexican food!
We bought a Pacifico at the liquor store around the corner and had a good time!
author: bob b.

description: I think this place has some good thing happening. I got great service when we went in, and my party and I had drinks soon after we sat down.  The chips and salsa were great. The plates of food are huge and everything is at a reasonable price.
author: Marty W.

description: Solid three stars.  I was a little surprised by the number of rave reviews - I think El Metate is fine, but not "all that."  Perhaps I didn't order well.  My carnitas taco was tasty but extremely greasy, and the chicken taco was pretty gristly - not the best cuts of chicken in there.  Tasty pickles, decent chips, nice salsa options.  I guess I need to come back and try a few more dishes, especially the burritos, which seem to be the ticket.
author: Katy M.

description:
Came back after what, 4 years!? 

Yeah, this place is sooo stuffwhitepeople like, but fuck it, it's wonderful. So happy to be back in the Mission where a burrito isn't 8 dollars.
author: Maria D.

description: Went to El Metate for the first time last week and had one of the best burritos I've experienced to date in SF.  The quality of the meat really blows away some of the competitors on Mission st.  My only complaint is that they should stay open later!
author: Jori P.

description:
One day, I was staaaa-rrrr-ving.
I mean, I was keeling over from hunger, losing my cognitive abilities, speech, and blood sugar FAST.
 
Now, for most cuisines, Robbie-boy and I are in agreement.  When I want something - he will usually agree 90% of the time, not necessarily to please me but rather because I am craving something he loves too.  

But one cuisine in which we never agree is Mexican.  I am just not a big fan of Mexican food, and he loves it like none other.  In my defense, before all you taco-lovers crucify me in your minds, I like almost all food.  There are only four things to know about me regarding food - -  I do NOT eat chicken feet, I don't much like pizza, I don't like ice cream in general, and Mexican food is my least favorite.  I appreciate a good burrito once in awhile, and I live and die for nachos, but it's rare that I get hungry and start craving Mexican food.
 
But I am not hing if not compromising every once in awhile, and combine that with my incredible hunger on this day -  I was agreeable to most ANYTHING.  So when he meekly asked, "Mexican...?" all I could do was nod and say, "Whatever, just go!" while I was keeled over in the front seat.
 
We pass 236 other restaurants (and I can smell ALL the food) to pull up to a rather bright yellow restaurant called "El Metate".  Even in my near-comatose state, I noticed the place with the outdoor seating and lots of people even at this odd hour of 3 pm.  

*BOING*  This place looks pretty good, I make a note to myself.
 
You walk in and order.
Service is about as non-existent as any Chinese or Vietnamese joint, but they took our order and within 5-10 minutes, served up our food.  I ordered two fish tacos ($2.50 each) and Robbie-Boy ordered the enchilada plate.  Lest you think that two fish tacos is all I can eat - make no mistake, dinner was to be in about 3 hours and I just needed to hold myself over until then.  So, two fish tacos, it would be.
 
Initially, we sat outside.
But due to the cold weather, we moved indoors and walking in, I decided I really liked this place.  Against the walls, and spread out all over every table was the biggest array of hot sauces I have ever seen, consisting of every spicy pepper known to mankind.  Anyone who knows me knows I love me some HOT SAUCE!
 
I woofed down two fish tacos in exactly 14.6 seconds, with perhaps a pint of hot sauce on each.
And it was good.  Crispy fried fish that tasted fresh, with piles of lettuce and other goodies on top, laid out on tortillas.

*GULP*... *GULP*
 
I was full and all was well with the world again.

I woofed down my lunch with the aid of the aguas frescas they had available - which I had in strawberry.  Very sweet, not normally my thing, but for this lunch, it worked.
 
As a sidenote, their tortilla chips are not that great - rather tasteless.  But their salsa was  good, especially after I poured the habanero hot sauce into it.  Delicious.
 
El Metate would be a great place to come to with friends for cold Coronas and lots of food.  It's cheap, it's fast, and it's large enough to hold a group of friends comfortably - - and you can chatter to your heart's content w/ nobody giving you any grief about it.
 
Make no mistake - - Mexican food is still not a favorite of mine, but El Metate is cool nonetheless.
author: Grace K.

description:
The perfect Mission burrito place. Good ingredients, good recipes, good environment to enjoy your 1000+ calorie rice, beans and meat.

Get in line at the front, order up, get a number, sit down, your meal will be served to you in a matter of minutes. Don't forget to hit up the salsa bar at least once.

I recommend the Fish Burritos/Quesadillas, but I'm sure the other dishes would be good too.
author: Mickey R.

description: Almost every hell-hole town from which judgemental a-holes like us  have escaped (maybe I project) has a crap-mexican place like El Metate, replete with feedbag customers and kitsch-covered walls.  I was once dragged there for lunch by a well-intentioned friend.  After suffering its effects the next day, I recalled Hector's dying words to Achilles, "I only wish my fury would compel me to cut away your flesh and eat it raw for what you've done."  Basically, I think they should rename this place El Metate's Revenge.
author: Nom D.

description:
FUCKING - A! 

Dear El Metate, 

Please open a location in Boston so I can shove your effing amazing food in my face and gain 600lbs.   I only got to try the burritos, but i've heard everything is good.  I was actually going to take one with me on my plane ride back but forgot.  So SAD! 

I love you El Metate.  

Love, 
Luke
author: luke b.

description: This place is great! Been coming here twice a week for the past few weeks and I love the vegetarian burrito and quesadilla! The vegetables are so fresh and its definitely unique. Make sure you get the agua fresca with your meal - you can taste the fresh fruit (mango, cantaloupe, and watermelon are my favorites). Cant wait to go back!
author: Soniya T.

description:
Daanng.. the shrimp burrito is awesome. So are the fish tacos. The chips are painfully good too!

This is my go-to mexican restaurant. 5 super yummy stars.
author: David S.

description:
This is currently my favorite taqueria in the city. Absolutely worth the 15 minute walk from BART. 

I always get the same thing: fish burrito with black beans and guacamole. Then I dump the fruit salsa all over it. The fish is cooked perfectly with just the right amount of crunch in the breading. The fruit salsa is always fresh and tasty, and if you only go here occasionally, it takes a long time for the novelty to wear off.

Usually I try fish burritos wherever I can find one, and this one has consistently been the best. Oh, and I've heard they've got lots of other good stuff, too.
author: Kris K.

description:
I hate that my first review is a super negative one, not sure exactly what that says about me. I logged into Yelp for the first time yesterday and was appalled to see that El Metate was one of the most highly ranked restaurants in SF. It prompted me to sign up immediately and dispute these claims. I live exactly 1/4 block from this place. It is the crappiest Mexican food I've ever had. Literally. What's up with the pickled carrots in my veggie burrito? Or the chicken soft tacos that are two piles of shredded chicken in soggy corn tortillas. Let me tell you that I have given this place many, many chances in hopes that it will fill the need on a day after drinking when I can barely make it outside. No such luck. What a pity.

You want a great hole in the wall place that is cheap, fresh and delicous? Try the taco window at the corner of 21st and Treat.
author: Cameo E.

description: This little chica is a cut above the rest. I had a great burrito here for a steal. I keep forgetting to go back. So many places, so little time.
author: Ken L.

description: This place is great. I have eaten there for years and love it. Almost everything on the menu is delicious... plus, the owner treats everyone like they're at a four-star restaurant. Love it!
author: Matt H.

description:
Although it was my friend that used to fantasize about this place when he was traveling,  I too am only going to shake the hands of the positive reviewers for the delicious El Metate. 

They have expanded in the not to distant past and although there is something about a hole in the wall that is inherently bettah, the food here is +++++ and you don't have to eat standing up. 

Great place to go on a cheap date, the prices and portions satisfy all your taste buds.

Five stars, baby.
author: Miel H.

description:
This place is close to my house.  If I lived on the other side of the city, I doubt I would trek all the way over to come here, but I have no complaints.  

It's consistent, tasty tacos.  Last time I went, my BF got the veggie burrito.  It was pretty good.  Unlike many places that stuff a veggie burrito with rice/beans/condiments,  El Metate's veggie burrito is filled with a myriad of vegetables.  Yum.

Also, they have a slew of hot sauces lined up against the wall.  The prices are totally affordable and the portions are sizeable. El Metate makes me full and happy.  Definitely recommended.
author: kate j.

description:
The best burritos in the city! - (this may be debatable)  

A bold statement since I don't really like Mexican food (Gasp)  But this place is damn good.  I usually order the super burrito with pollo rojas, which is marinated perfectly and paired with fresh ingredients.  I also like the location, away from the hustle and bustle of the mean streets of valencia and mission, it is surrounded with housing and my guess, their biggest fans.

So when i'm in the need of a GOOD burrito, I get away from the over-massed (and I dare say over rated) Mission and Valencia streets, and I head to Bryant Street.   As Robert Frost one said, "I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference."
author: Joseph P.

description:
I'm so lucky to live close to this place.  The tacos are amazing, but fish is my favorite.  For the first two months I didn't even try anything but their tacos.  

Seating is minimal (a few tables inside, a few outside), the place is clean, and the people are friendly.  White you're waiting for your food, check out the El Metate grocery store next to it.  You can order a pretty good tortilla soup there too.
author: Akshay S.

description:
thank god el metate got a salsa bar. now they can be my favorite taqueria forever and ever.

for veggie lovers, this place has got it goin' on (for a taqueria anyway)
author: Willa K.

description: This is my favorite Taqueria. Great folks, nice family vibe and supremely yummy food. I just keep going back to the shrimp quesadilla  because the salsa that they put in is just soooo addictive. But everything else tastes very fresh and flavorful.
author: NoName M.

description:
My favorite taqueria in the city!  I haven't been able to bring myself to try el farolito yet since I love this place so much.
Watermelon al fresca is perfect - sweet but not too sweet.
Fish burrito is the best burrito I've had there, but don't order it right before they close (even though your starving from climbing at mission cliffs and you just made it in the door before they locked it )- the 2 times ive done this the fish was cold and it ruined the whole burrito.

Now im obsessed w/ their pork tamales - best tamales ever!
I told my friend to take her boyfriend here when they were craving mexican a couple months ago and apparently someone got stabbed and died right outside.  hasn't deterred me from going!
author: Ali G.

description:
I usually eat here and the food and the service was always great, but this pass Sunday they dropped the ball. 

I went to eat at about 12 noon with some friends and their kids. When we got our order we notice it was wrong, told the owner and he made the change, then when we got the kids order , their was a big cockroach on top of the beans, how did they miss that?? I don't know. 

I confronted the owner and he did not know what to say. Since we had already paid he just replace the order and did not even apologize. I will never go eat their again.
author: Vanessa L.

description:
Eating at El Metate was fate. I had left the gym, hungry, cold, with no plan on where to get eats. I knew I wanted a burrito, but had no idea where to satisfy that craving for something new. I decided I'd get the 27 whichever way it was going. And right about when I stepped out onto Bryant, one came headed towards the heart of the mission. On I went.

Keeping an eye out for anything Mexican - 18th turned into 19th, then 20th, then 21st, and right about 22nd and Bryant, El Metate appeared.

A nice modern exterior covered a warm and inviting interior. Christmas lights were everyone, and the guy behind the counter tells me he loves Christmas, and always wants the place feel festive. Nice.

Burrito didn't blow me away, especially with the lack of wheat tortillas, but there was much to love - no problem getting more black beans instead of rice, and no charge for lettuce.

And did I mention the cost? No? Try $4.75, which was one of the best burrito deals ever. Satisfaction/cost ratio was outstanding.

Sealing the fifth star - the 27 showed up going the opposite way as I headed out, confirming good karma exudes from this little slice of burrito heaven.
author: Jason B.

description:
So... this is my first review. What pushed me over the line and made me want to write? Two words: fish tacos.

I went here for lunch yesterday and was blown away by the fish tacos. This after having a heated discussion with a friend about how Mexican places seem to be the talked about genre when it comes to comparisons. You know what I'm talking about. They always contain these sentences: 

"You have to try the burritos from _______!" 
"I can't believe you haven't had the tacos from _________!"
"What! You're crazy! These are no where near as good as the ones from ________."

You've all been there. 

The gauntlet was thrown, so I agreed to go because I was hoping to wave my finger in his face about how it was the same as everywhere else. 

He won. Whatever. 

When I made my way home after work, I tried to describe the experience to my wife, and it was nearly impossible. I just kept rambling on about the consistency of the bite and how even the cilantro involved made it better. (I actually HATE cilantro) Eventually, she walked away leaving me unsatisfied with my verbal skills. I was babbling like a drunken 5th grader with a seven-word vocabulary. 

There is no way I can do this place justice. Please just stop in, get two fish tacos and enjoy. Maybe shoot me a note on how I can best describe the delicious that happens during your experience. Apparently, I need help.
author: Ian G.

description:
An extra star for adding churros on the menu? I know..that would be too good to be true.

The burritos and tacos and quesadillas and practically everything at El Metate is pretty good. The burritos aren't crazy big, and they're always wrapped up so cleanly, and they taste fantastic. The tacos are cheap and filled with your meat choices (or veggies). The quesadillas are humongous--for quesadillas. Those alone fill me up, and that's with plain cheese. 

Also, try the bebidas. They're pretty good. I prefer the melon flavored ones, but the orchatta is pretty good too.
author: Maureen B.

description:
Well, I tried not to let it affect me, but they screwed up my order and I waited 30 minutes for a to-go burrito.  It was pretty disheartening considering I have been waiting to try El Metate for what seems like an eternity.  I work around the corner but I am always seduced by La Paz, which is closer to my work and so delicious and simple.

I got a fish burrito and it was pretty damn good, but sort of long and skinny.  I like my burritos standard issue and this was a little - like i said- long and skinny for my taste.

It was good, as I said, but I think I'll stick with La Paz.  It sort of made me feel gross after I ate it - like a Denny's meal or something.
author: Reggie G.

description:
Today marked my first El Metate experience and it was definitely worthy of 5 stars!  Since I'm now working in the neighborhood, I'm happy to know that I'll have a fantastic standby when I'm able to break away for a meal.  

I had a seriously fresh, non-soggy veggie burrito that made me quite happy. Also,my attempt at ordering in my advanced beginner Spanish was met with a big smile and good conversation.  

I grabbed a seat at the counter and was able to see two guys assembling deliciously fresh-looking plates of goodness right before my eyes.  Big ol' burritos, tacos, tamales, chile rellenos!  Delicious!  This place makes me wonder what all the Taqueria Cancun hype is about.  El Metate is superior for sure!  Be sure to check out their "tiendita" on the corner.  Super cute little convenient store with lots of Mexican goodies.
author: Abby W.

description:
Dear fish taco,

I am so sorry I have neglected you all these years. I have let Mr. Burrito steal all the attention away with his size and layers. I have underestimated your ability to satisfy my needs but I have been wrong. Thanks to El Metate I now know that you are not only satisfying but you make me forget about the long love affair with Mr. Burrito.   Since our relationship is new I think we should only meet at El Metate just to be safe but I will think of you everyday.

All my love.
author: Nikki L.

description:
I love you El Metate. 

You have the best Veggie Tacos and Veggie Burritos EVER.  The veggies don't sit in a warmer getting mushy.  NO NO.  At El Metate, when you order a veggie anything, they grab a pan and some fresh chopped veggies and fry them up.  And they are crisp and perfectly cooked, every time.   The carrots have a little crunch and sweetness.  The broccoli is slightly salty and perfectly cooked.  And the zucchini (which I usually don't care for) is never EVER bitter!  Top that off with cabbage that is cooked, but still crisp and you have me totally craving their food right this minute!!!  

I even pick up a burrito on my way out of town when I have to drive to LA for work.  LA has no good mexican food.  I have to bring it from SF.  

I found El Metate when I lived in the mission.  When I moved to the Castro, I still came to El Metate.  Then when we moved back to the mission, part of the reason we bought the house we did was because we could walk to El Metate (NO JOKE!).  And we do walk there, quite often.  

p.s.  their dining room keeps getting cuter and cuter.  And they just added a salsa bar with a delicious pineapple salsa.   YAY!

oh! and the flan and horchata are great too!

can you tell I like this place?
author: Freddi R.

description:
the pozole (pork stew with those giant corn kernels) is filling and delicious. They were nice and agreed to substitute rice for nachos.

Don't let the small entrance/ordering area deceive you. There's plenty of seating indoors.
author: Joy X.

description:
I actually used my Blackberry to Yelp El Metate today because I remembered all the great reviews.  I drove out of my way to get a burrito to-go.  When I got back to *work*, I unraveled the foil and to my surprise the sucker was covered in a strange orange oil.  Starving, I tried to muster some of the slippery goods down, but it was so salty I gave up after a couple bites.  The chips and salsa were good--but maybe because it's all I had to eat.

Guess I'll try El Farolito next time.
author: Julie C.

description:
Al Pastor Taco was kick ass.  I threw the burrito away after two bites, though.  It tasted like lemon pledge and peas.  

And FOR THE LOVE OF GOD--people--make up your fucking mind before you get in line.  I swear--two couples were in here today--one chunkified hippie couple and one yuppie couple with kids.  Both of them took what seemed like 45 min. to order.  If you're so damned picky and have to ask 20 questions about every item--get in your Volvo Wagon and GO BACK TO MARIN!
author: Nobody M.

description:
Yum yum and more yum.  I go here at least once a week because I work nearby.  The first time I came here with my bf and I ordered the fish taco plate and I was sold, they were crispy but not oily.  Everything tastes fresh with really good flavors.  The cantaloupe juice is the best!!  It's really fresh and you can taste chunks of cantaloupe too. 

Pros: very yummy tacos and the cantaloupe juice is my favorite.

Cons: none.
author: Amy C.

description:
I only live about two blocks from this place and I just went there for the first time two nights ago...

And I went back again tonight with my boyfriend!!

I was impressed with their menu!  Simple, straight-forward, and REALLY reasonable prices!!!  $5 for a burrito?!  YES!!!  I mean, I don't want to yell it from the mountain TOO loud, the place is already busy enough!

I went with the veggie burrito, with black beans of course.  It has fresh vegetables in it.  Wha-wha-wha-whaaaat?!  Yeah.  Everywhere else in San Francisco, their "veggie" burrito is beans and rice.  Great.  Now I found a place other than Azteca that will put VEGETABLES in it!

My boyfriend went with the Steak and Potato burrito and absolutely loved it.  

We split an order of nachos.

The burritos aren't humongous, but they are perfect.  I didn't feel like my belly was going to explode afterwards, but I still have a nice "full buzz" to me, three hours later.

I really dig this place and look forward to coming here many more times in the future!!!  The staff is really sweet, and incredibly efficient.

Thanks for being the bees knees!
author: Jess R.

description: You would never expect to go to a Mexican place to get Tortas, but El Metate has some amazing Tortas that include chicken soup!
author: Jose C.

description: Good place. Great pork tamales
author: Brian S.

description: The owner Francisco is a wonderful man. Offered me the crispy tacos off his plate. A little off the beaten path but well worth it and a great value at that.
author: Andrew K.

description:
Walking down the street in a neighborhood I am unfamiliar with, I thought to myself, "I hope I can find this place. The way my cousin described it, it might blend in to a hole in the wall." But then I got to the corner and it lit up like a bright yellow beacon of delicious hope.

Wow. 

This is probably the best burrito I have had in my life. The flour shell was soft, and the thing wasn't too massive (it made up for being narrow by being long too), so I could eat it sans fork and knife. I hate eating burritos with a fork and knife. It's like eating Pizza with a fork and knife: efficient, but oh so wrong.

I had the Pork with the Verde sauce, and it was so good that I didn't care that it dripped down my wrist, past my cuff into my sleeve, and to my elbow. It's just more flavor for later, damnit. And the chips! Oh, they are good, and homemade, you can tell just from biting into them: that's what a chip should be like. I could describe it to you better, but I just want you to go here.

Oh Metate, can you come back to NYC with me? I'll adopt you and put you on the corner near some other Mexican Taquerias and you can show them how to do it right. And if they don't, well, we'll always have each other.
author: Josh R.

description:
I wanna give this place a 5 so bad, but there are a couple of things holding me back.

1. It's in the middle of nowhere.

2. It's tiny and between the time I walk in the door until I get my food, I'm never sure where I should stand. And clearly, many other customers are in the same boat.

3. The tired Mission-y clientele. You know who I'm talking about. I  thought you guys would have evolved at some point, but apparently, no such luck.

Still the food is awesome. Believe me, if it wasn't this good, I wouldn't put up with that other shit.
author: Jason R.

description: The carne asada burrito IS TOO SALTY!!! Please do something about this. The pinto beans were salty, the meat was salty, and the chips were salty.  After eating the burrito my lips were chapped. This is my second time trying a burrito and both times the burrito and tacos were salty. Having said that, if they would tone down the salt I would probably give it 4 stars because aside from it being salty the flavor was good. The guys are really friendly though! POR FAVOR NO LE PONGA MUCHA SAL A LA COMIDA!
author: M R.

description:
The only authentic Mexican restaurant in the Mission.  I cannot emphasize this first sentence enough.  The enchiladas are great, the flautas are great.  Their meat is lean and high quality, I've found virtually no gristle in the chicken, the pastor, the carne asada, and the carnitas.  The fish is absolutely delicious, I would seriously recommend trying the fish plate even if you barely like fish, which I do.  And yes, the burritos and tacos are delicious.  It's obscurity stems only from its location: at 22nd and Bryant it is a decent trek from either Mission BART station.

This place is obviously run by a big family, they are very friendly, they remember regular customers, and have always been willing to give me any extras I've asked for free of charge.  And for god's sake, stop going to Cancun and El Farolito, you have to respect your bodies more than that.
author: Harlen W.

description:
The carnitas super  burrito I had last night in the restaurant was unbelievably delicious.  The meat was browned and perfectly crispy, the salsa was nice, the ratio of beans/rice to meat was also very good.  Even the chips were toothsome, not too salty and great.

If this had been my only experience with El Metate (that's Spanish for "The Metate"), I would have given this place something along the lines of 7 stars.  Unfortunately, my other experience, which was a take out al pastor burrito was subpar.   

I suppose every place has its lackluster nights but I hope to return again soon for another seven star experience.  Aside from the food, the service was good, all of the tables were dirty - which was gross, the decor is cute, and there is no beer - which is a tragedy.  Fortunately the burritos are so good, I managed to survive without cerveza.
author: Katina M.

description:
OK, this will sound totally trite, but I am a taco purist. A real taco does NOT have cabbage, or rice (although I do like rice on the side), cheese, guac, or beans. If you want all those things, order a gringo burrito. 

A true taco to me consists of good tortilla, meat, pico de gallo and salsa. You can squeeze in some lime and add some radish, BUT NEVER anything else. 

I can't believe I have never been to El Metate before. The tacos here are simple, but the ingredients all shine (I sound like a Michael Bauer resto review). Move over Pancho Villa, I now have a new favorite taco place!
author: Clarice V.

description:
Big portions, low prices, good food.  Hard to go wrong.

I had a pork tamales plate.  A tremendous amount of food and a soda for less than $10.  If I lived in the mission this would be my cheap eats home.
author: Jared W.

description:
I love this place! 

They use grilled veggies in their burritos and it's just perfect! 

I just wrote a really bad review about a nail salon and had to write a good review so that I didn't look and feel like a total bitch ;  )

El Metate is the bomb though, really. Enjoy.
author: Jane M.

description:
Cute little spot in the Mission.  Always drove by it and never thought to go to it.  There are so many Mexican restaurants in the city, it's really hard to decide where to go.  Luckily there's Yelp.  ;)

So we did end up trying this place out and the food was delicious!  I had a fish taco and a chicken taco.  I like the fact that it wasn't too oily.  

I'm going back today for a nice CdM meal.  :)
author: Delilah B.

description:
I was really surprised after reading all the positive reviews. This place isn't horrible, or even bad, but there are so many other places to go, I'm not sure why one would choose here. I have to say that I did not get to try the fish tacos, so maybe that's what I'm missing. But I did try to have one - there are a variety of dinner plates, including two separate ones with 2 chicken enchiladas or 2 fish tacos. So I asked if I could have one chicken enchilada and one fish taco. This possibility was promptly denied without any consideration. I opted for the chicken enchiladas, which I accept may have been the wrong choice. They were edible but definitely nothing special and I wouldn't get them again. I have to say I liked the substantial amounts of guacamole, pico de gallo, and sour cream that came with the plate. My companion ordered three different kinds of tacos and was not impressed by any of them. 

If I did come back I would try some other dishes, but I don't think I will be back.
author: Lisa K.

description:
Oh Jeez, where to start.

First, they ought to change the name of the place to "La Casa Del Sal."  (The House of the Salt.)  There's so much salt in their food that you might have a stroke from even LOOKING at it.  Salt is not a substitute for actual flavor.

Number two, HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE TO MAKE A BURRITO?!  I've been in there when there are two people ahead of me and had it take 20 minutes to get my burrito.  It takes less time at El Farolito when the line is out the door.

Furthermore, how much is it for the whole burrito?  Their burritos are about a half the size of any other burrito.

Finally, you can't eat there.  Most of the time, you can't even wait inside for your food.  

I don't get why they're so packed all the time.  Truth be told, the only reason I ever eat there is because it's right around the corner and I'm lazy.  Or super starving.
author: Chris M.

description:
I'm gonna say it.
Even though I *hate* the way the steamed tortillas stick to my teeth (totally killing the courage necessary to strike up a conversation with that cute boy next to me at the counter).

Best burritos in The City.

Quick service, friendly staff, and seating for about 8, total :(
Worth the 20 minute walk from the upper mission... even in heels... maybe even rain (though you could just splurge on a cab).

What no beer?? Pick one up across the street at King's Market.
author: Tessa M.

description: My carne asada burrito with sour cream, quac, and cheese was great! I think it's called a silver bullet or something because the burrito is long and skinny-ish. Other than that, it's your typical mission-taqueria burrito with a good combination of ingredients and flavors. I'd definitely come back :) ($15 for two cokes and two carne asada burritos!)
author: Kimberly S.

description:
New in the neighborhood, we were hoping this would be our go-to spot for a quick burrito, but our luck, she did not agree.  

The menu certainly looks promising enough, and the inclusion of fish & shrimp dishes is a perk for the pescetarian bf.  Although the strawberry aguas frescas were fresh & yummy, my asada taco was dry, tough, flavorless, and served on barely warm tortillas.  Fish tacos were in an uninspired breading & also dry & barely warm.  The veggie burrito was the best of the bunch - veggies were fresh and not overly sauteed - and while I wouldn't go outta my way to get another it'd certainly do if I was in the hood & hungry.  

On the upside, on the eve of our visit the Christmas nativity window scene was in the process of being constructed and scheming about what one could do to the (empty) baby Jesus' cradle made for a few good giggles.
author: Cynthia W.

description:
I am lucky enough to inhabit an apartment within easy walking distance to El Metate. In fact, the bus (#27) home from work pretty much drops me off at their doorstep which I must admit, is both a blessing and a curse. The food here is fresh and tasty on a consistent basis, the prices are very reasonable, and the guys that work here are fast and always friendly.  

Food recommendations:  the Mexican platters are authentic and delicious. However, my favorite item is currently it's the carnitas quesadilla. My only complaint is that it's super greasy, a problem that is easily solved with a little napkin blotting (worth it). Also, while I really dig the food, it's often a little salty for my tastes. If you aren't sold by the hundreds of rave reviews, check out the pictures for some extra convincing! (After looking at them just now, I had to microwave some taquitos to curb my Metate craving...)
author: Stephanie P.

description: I've been here about a half dozen times and last night will be the LAST TIME I go here. I ordered three shrimp tacos without hot sauce. Problem 1: It came with sauce that was mild (I don't eat spicy food at all). Problem 2: There was a hair mixed with the shrimp and sauce. I have long, wavy hair and my bf's hair is super short, so it was obvious that it was niether of ours. I got disgusted and put tha taco aside and tried not to make a big deal out of it. My boyfriend thought otherwise and showed the cashier the hair. The cashier told him that it wasn't theirs since the cooks were wearing hairnets. We look over and the cooks were NOT wearing any sort of hair protection. The cashier was an idiot to have lied to us when we were able to turn our heads 90 degrees to see he lied. Problem 3: As I grabbed my third taco I found ANOTHER hair. WTF?! I had lost some of my appetite when I saw the first hair, now I lost ALL of me appetite. I stopped eating and continued to drink my horchata. Problem 4: My mom didn't finish her torta so I went over to ask for foil and a plastic bag. There were two people in line, so I asked one of the cooks (who appeared like he wasn't doing anything since he was standing around), the cook told me to ask the cashier. REALLY?!?! The cash wrap and the kitchen isn't large, the guy didn't have to walk far to get me a plastic bag. I left angry and completely unsatified. I will NEVER return again. People should go to El Farolito on 24th Street - the food is much better and customer service has ALWAYS been excellent (been going there for over 20 years)!
author: Johan S.

description: You shouldn't go to El Metate - it's so good I don't wanna share! But come on, seriously unreal good green chile verde puerco, crispy on the outside and soft ont the inside. Pozole? Oh man, better than any I've had so far in the city. Salsa bar? Homemade tortillas? OH YAH. The al pastor reminded me of the al pastor we ate in Mexico.
author: Lindsey S.

description:
Went back, and it's still good, but the so called amazing quesadilla just wasn't doing it for me. Foods turned a little salty as well. Don't get me wrong i still love the place, just not as much as I used to . 

But they did expand and create a dinning room area that looked absolutely stunning.
author: Alex M.

description: Easy street parking during lunch.  We walked in and entered the wrong door and had to walk behind the register to the other side to order.  Not reading the reviews before I came, I went the safe route and ordered a steak burrito with guacamole.  The burrito was priced under 5 dollars.  The burrito took no more than 5 mins and came out perfectly wrapped.  The steak burrito was very satisfying for 5 dollars.  It also came with a small handful of chips and salsa that was just enough for my appetite.  This place had a rack full of hot sauce to satisfy any hot sauce lover's dream.  They even had red rooster sauce (saracha).  Very nice decor inside and some seating outside.  I'll try the fish tacos next time.
author: Danny P.

description:
I came here with my cousin and his wife.  They said it was awesome, but I was a bit skeptical.  I have tried a lot of Mexican places in SF and not all those experiences have been that spectacular.  That said, I really enjoyed my meal.  

Parking: I didn't have my kids with me, so I didn't mind walking a few blocks.  If I had my kids with me and the weather was bad, I might not want to come here, just because there is not guarantee on the street parking.

I just got a carnitas burrito.  It wasn't as large as my head like some places make it, but it was VERY tasty and large enough to fill me up.  Even the rice was good, which I feel most places get wrong.  It was probably top 3 as far as burritos experiences go.  

Oh, and my cousin's wife's meal looked so good, I was tempted to start spooning food off her plate...but I didn't.  

The tortilla chips were on the thick side and a bit hard.  I like my chips a bit more crispy.
author: John G.

description:
All I can say is: BROCCOLI. In the TACOS. And it is AMAZING!!!

El Metate (aka El Metat's, sometimes Hot Metat's) is one of the diamonds in the little sparkly jewel cluster of Pop's, Saint Francis Fountain, and Roosevelt Tamale Parlor surrounding Bryant Street in the East Mission. I used to live across the way, and became well acquainted with the veggie tacos and weirdly delicious chips-n-salsa. 

Yes, there are actual grilled vegetables in the veggie tacos. You have to ask for cheese, and I recommend pouring lots and lots of the house salsa all over your food. This is the kind of place where everything shouldn't be as good as it is, but nevertheless, something about it is just precisely right.

The ambiance is cute and casual, and their recent expansion has added to the charm. The owner is the most wonderful gentleman ever. I am hoping to be adopted by him any day now. The rumor mill suggests the possibility of a full bar there one day...a girl can dream, can't she?

The bathroom is clean; the price is tremendously affordable; annnnnnd I don't want to go out for veggie tacos anywhere else. Vive El Metate!
author: Ciana W.

description:
Filling, delicious and quick.  My favorites are the chile relleno and the bisteca mexicana platter, with pinto beans, a salad, and mexican rice.  With horchata, and flan whenever they have it. Yum!

The people at the counter are nice and friendly too, and always pack a bag of nachos if you want them to.
author: Mia G.

description:
Yummy tacos, colorful tropical ambiance, large seating area with brightly painted walls and tables, and fast service. And that's more than you get at most taquerias. The racks of hot sauce choices add to the tongue-burning fun.
Need to come back to try to horchatas and other beverage concoctions.
Ohmigod, it's my 200th review. Does this mean I'm now legal?
author: Purnima M.

description: Best traditional mexican in the city. The fish torta is unbelievable. The salsa bar is on point, clean, fresh and has 10 different choices. The chicken tortilla soup is the best in it's class... and i got both the chicken soup and the fish torta for 5.75?!?! what!!! orchata is super fresh and not too sweet. i love it, i make up excuses just to get down that far in the mission. great atmosphere, nice hand painted tiles, art, and tables. great for a casual date... it is an order up front and pay and then they bring it out to ya kind of gig. No booze as far as i could see, but that isn't really the point here.
author: Jordan S.

description:
A+ 
We love El Metate. 
Great for group lunches with coworkers or super convenient for on the run to-go orders. 
I've been happy with the burritos, etc. My recent favorite is their ENCHILADA SAUCE! Delicious. 
Also, the staff is very friendly.
author: M.E. T.

description:
My new favorite place for  a burrito in SF.
The tortilla is different from the others.
They prepare it exactly the way I want...
I ordered:
Carne Asada
Easy on the Rice & Black Whole Beans
Onions and Cilantro only... no salsa
Sliced avocado.

The burrito was perfect! Awesome flavor, fresh everything.
Next time I will try the steak and potato burrito!
author: Geordie E.

description: Yeah, si se bien. Only 3 stars, but it's a GOOD 3 stars. Folks are really cool, food is authentic, got that nice neighborhood vibe. Patrons include lots of what-do-you-call-em-these-days?: millenials, Z genners, post Yup googlers, but also local latinos and embedded types. Also, chef/foodies like me and my kid and my chef buddy. The deal is they are BUSY, so there's a lot of steam table food. Plates were gorgeous with really nice pickled veggies, little lime slices, queso fresco sprinkled where it should go. Only short cut I saw were canned jalapeño slices.....hey, forgive and forget. Got my kid a single beef taco asado, but he made 5 more tacos out of my plate of bistec a  la Mexicana. Then he wasted his besito. Never really knew about these little dessert things: 2 alfajores cemented with nice, thick cajeta - Mexican Macarons! Take that ya'll Frenchies. Great salsa bar, outside laid-back eating/hanging out. Don't get there at 1pm to avoid a lunch rush. BE the lunch rush. By 1pm, the meats have dried out from steam table presence. I know for next time. : )
author: Ben P.

description:
By far one of the best places to grab a burrito in the city.  I was introduced by my house mates when I moved here in May and have been  hooked ever since.

There is not much seating for those that like to eat in but they are working on an expansion that will be able to fit more customers.  Regardless, the service is quick and if its a nice day you can always just take your food to the park and enjoy.

I suggest that if you are in the Mission or just love eating Mexican you at least try it once.    I guarantee you will be satisfied.
author: Jon K.

description:
I learned about El Metate when visiting La Tiendita next door.

I ordered a veggie burrito at El Metate, it was really fresh and delicious.  It had fresh roasted veggies (not burned), rice, pinto beans, guacamole and fresh pico de gallo.  The whole burrito was perfectly seasoned and had a great homemade taste.  It was neatly and tightly wrapped in foil.  My aunt ordered the fish quesadilla.  It has a thin piece of breaded fried fish nestled in a flour tortilla full of cheese.  I mean, really, how can you go wrong with melty cheese and fried fish...This dish was pretty good.  My husband ordered the carnitas burrito.  I'd say the veggie burrito was way superior.

My one main complaint is the guacamole, it was blended into baby food consistency.  

Overall the atmosphere is great, eat outside on a sunny weekend for lunch.  You will definitely enjoy it.
author: Burrito M.

description:
They don't grill their burritos, their salsa is a chunkless hotsauce and the chips always taste stale. 

Aside from that, Metate is pretty great. I've never gotten a fish burrito anywhere that compares and the vegetarian entrees all have grilled vegetables which is something you don't get in most places. The staff is awesome, the service great and in general probably about the cleanest taquaria you'll find. The tacos (get the fish) are a great deal at $2.00.

Oh, and for a 50 cent surcharge, you can use a credit card now. And not that I want more cars in the neighborhood, but parking is pretty doable in the area.
author: Ryan L.

description:
I had a fish burrito a couple of years ago and even though I didn't think I liked fish at the time I thought it was stellar.  Unfortunately this place was too far out of the way for me.

Fast forward to a couple of months ago, I moved in right around the corner.  I thought I was over burritos (having lived around the corner from El Papalote for a couple years) but I find myself eating at El Metate at least twice a week.  Just had another fish burrito the other day, oh my.

I wish they'd improve on the watery salsa, that would get them the extra star.
author: Rachel N.

description:
I drop into this place often to get a quick fix a block or so from my house.  I love it!  I generally get the fish burrito or the fish tacos.  They are both simple and simply delicious!  On rare occasions I've sat down and had one of their dinner plates.  DAMN!  They are so fantastic and so reasonably priced.  

My only complaint is that the place is just too small.  But, it seems that they are working on a larger restaurant in the space next door.  I'm looking forward to that.

Also, they don't sell beer there...but, they seem to have no qualms with you bringing your own and enjoying it with you meal.
author: Craig A.

description:
My taste buds feel very sorry for those of you who deem El Metate a bad tacqueria!

two words: flour chips (you have to ask for them)

This place is the freaking best! I frequent it often...... They have really good fish tacos, and veggie burritos.....

but be warned... if it's busy, it's likely that your food may not be exactly the same as it would be if they were slow. The consistency isn't always the same, but the quality is good. I mean where can you go for a veggie burrito and they cook the vegetables per order. (but not the meats. I don't think that exists.)

The price is super reasonable and you know that they're busy enuf that their food isn't sitting out all day like those taco trucks..... 

The problem that I have w/ Metate, although they still get 5 stars, is their environmental friendliness..... they pile their togo orders onto flimsy styrofoam plates! BOO!!!

They also just opened up a store on the corner of 22nd and Bryant that sells made to order Tortas..... (mexican style sandwiches).... oh lordy these are delicious.

Best taco house in the dirty south!
author: Ariel P.

description: My favorite taqueria in the Mission to sit down and eat at.  Sure there may me other taquerias with better food in the Mission, but do you really want to hang out there and eat your meal? Most hole in the wall places in the Mission are just better for take-out.   El Metate is clean and festive.  I go there for the colorful ambiance and the chicken nachos!  The staff is friendly and the food is tasty.
author: Nazneen A.

description: El Metate does not disappoint.  The food and customer service are awesome.  It's a little pricey but worth it because if you've eaten tacos in San Francisco you know that the vendors can be stingy when it comes to stuffing.  Also try the Horchata.  The BEST!
author: Shaina C.

description:
BEST BURRITO IN THE MISSION!!! 

I could eat here five nights a week. There isn't much room for sitting down (or even enough room to wait inside sometimes). For food on the go, it can't be beat.

***TIP***Call in your order and pick it up. The space is really small, so waiting for your order to be ready can get you caught in a crowd easily.

Try it, you won't be sorry.
author: Beth M.

description: I love El Metate passionately.  I wish I could marry it.  They have some of the best carnitas I have ever had, and I am not even, like, the biggest fan of meat.  I went here on a sort of boring date, and I was glad because the food made up for the awkwardness.  I also went here on Valentine's day with friends and it was such a fun atmosphere that I was in a much better mood when I left even though I was single and sick.  It is quick, delicious, and they have outdoor seating.  I have seen people call in their order while they are in line, which I think is really annoying.  I have never had to wait that long, though, they are efficient.  Also, a great place for weekend lunch, snack.  YAY El Metate!
author: Julia D.

description:
We had amazing fish tacos and quesadilla here and wouldn't mind having more. : )

Parking was a bit laborious but this spot was definitely worth it.

Don't be fooled for the handicap entry, there's another set of doors that can accommodate someone in a wheelchair.
author: Anita J.

description:
i find i don't have the same tastebuds when it comes to sf mex -- 
esp. all these high # review places...  $2.75 fish taco, not good to me, much rather have a nick's crispy taco if going for that style.  also tried al pastor, too salty.  i give up unless it's a hole in the wall...
author: Rob C.

description:
Been there a ton of times. In fact, when they just opened the owner bought some stuff at our garage sale and paid us in burritos (not all at once, fortunately).

It's a cut above the average burrito place, but so not far above to lose it legitimacy. I definitely recommend it if you're constantly in search of the next best burrito!
author: Grace S.

description:
Ambience: B
Food: C
Value: B

Note on fish tacos: Not as other worldly as some reviewers have suggested, but quite a bargain.
author: Live F.

description: I used to order take out at least once a week when I lived a block away from this place. Fast service.  Quality, fresh ingredients.  I usually get the shrimp burrito with chips and salsa.  Fish tacos are also good.  So are the steak fajitas.  I wouldn't bring guests here, per se, since there are so many other selections and staples in the city, but i go here when i need something quick and reliable.
author: Mvt L.

description:
Very safe, affordable place near my work, and freakin' awesome to look at. It's one of the more colorful places in the neighborhood. I've only eaten there once (and gotten food to go probably over 50 times), but I would def. love to eat inside again. 

El Metate is not where I would go to find flavor country if you're like me and love the heat....they just don't bring it, which is probably exactly what some people love about it. I choose to add tapatio or cholula to my food. 

The carnitas tacos get 5 stars in my book for sure...the $3.25 price for a large Mexican Coke is near horrendous however. They must fly them direct from the sugar cane fields. I'm drooling thinking about the tacos though...man I live far away! 

Unfortunately, the burritos are actually quite subpar...I would go to any number of other places in the area for my twice (or thrice) weekly burrito binge, but El Metate takes plastic so I often settle. Maybe I should listen to Michael Cane and carry more than $20 in my pocket, and be a man about it. 

Damn, those tacos are good!
author: Mike M.

description:
It's so very hard to find a good vegan burrito. They're either super bland or  "hippified" and filled with things that just don't belong in a burrito. But today I'm so happy to say (while wallowing in my burrito induced sleep coma/trance) that my search is over- I have finally found one!

I yelped this place months ago for my boss when he was around the area looking for a good mexican joint. The reviews sounded great and he ended up raving about the food. He kept going back and always asked  if I wanted him to grab me a burrito while he was there, but I always declined, not wanting to feel the bean (you know what I mean)  while working in such close quarters.

Well, today I was CRAVING a burrito and and broke down. I had to try El Metate. The veggie burrito was SO freakin' good filled with refried beans that actually had flavor, lightly sauteed veggies, and guac. The salsa was perfect and the chips were great- not greasy and nasty.

I rarely finish an entire burrito because I get sick of the flavor, but at El Metate I was able to down the entire thing- although it was huge.  And the best part is that 3 1/2 hours later I have yet to feel the effects like I do after eating  El Fart-o-lito.
author: .'antigone' ..

description:
I love el metate. Awesome guacamole, amazing meat.  I just took a buddy from New York there this past Thursday and he said its the best burrito he's ever had.

I love the burritos here because they're tightly wrapped and delicious throughout. They consistently deliver unlike some of the others that are huge, but only have a few delicious bites throughout.
author: Ed B.

description: I came here twice already and the burrito is good. The nachos was very good as well. The price is cheap. I would go back there again
author: Allan W.

description: This is my go to place for Mexican food when I'm at work! Fresh food. And great service. Can't complain!!!
author: Annie T.

description:
Still my favorite burrito in the Mission, and with other good spots having raised their prices *cough*Pancho Villa*cough* El Matate is now also the CHEAPEST burrito in the Mission.

Regular chicken burrito with avocado (yes the guacamole is no good, stick with avocado slices) for $6!?!?  Wow.  Anywhere else that same burrito is $7.50 AT LEAST, maybe even $9.

Still waiting on the delivery service though.
author: Kevin H.

description: This is by far my favorite Mexican Restaurant in the San Francisco.  Consistently delicious, the staff are fantastic, everything tastes fresh.  The tostada is amazing. I eat here all the time.
author: alex a.

description: Great vegetarian items. Love the tortas, burritos, quesadilla. Everything's fresh and done right. Only thing I would not order again is fish taco, cause they put rice on my taco. What? Doesn't really matter cause everything else is so good.
author: Kathryn G.

description:
Im gonna give this place 5 stars! I rarely give 5 stars, but this time, I was really impressed. 

A few weeks ago I went with my roommate to this place, and I opted NOT to get a Quesadilla (I was broke, and I could get one for 1/2 the price down the street).... This time I went alone however, and I was starving, so I figured, "what the hell". Im glad I did.

I got the grilled chicken burrito, and unlike other places when I say NO SALSA..this place gave me exactly that NO SALSA! THANK YOU THANK YOU!! I HATE SALSA!!!

While the burrito isnt what Id call a true San Francisco burrito (the size is not QUITE as big), it was enough to satisfy my hunger, yet not completely fill me and make me feel gluttonous. Something I enjoy is a good burrito that doesnt weigh me down.

I also must say the people who work there were fast (and the place is freaking busy), and VERY nice... And... *gasp* didnt need directions on how to make my burrito! And that scores massive points in my book!

THANK YOU EL METATE! You just made me a loyal customer...And you are closer from my former favorite place,
author: William D.

description:
Perhaps the best value in San Francisco!

This is the perfect place for a hot evening - you can sit outside in the shade.  I like that it's situated in a laid-back neighborhood, as it's a nice change from the frenetic taquerias throughout the Mission.

Minus one star for lack of a liquor license.  Not a huge deal, though, as you can grab a beer from the liquor store on the other side of 22nd street.
author: Chris R.

description: This place is still going strong and continues to be a favorite of the neighborhood and the hospital (SFGH) which is only a few blocks away.   El Metate never disappoints.
author: Michael S.

description:
Pretty damn good tacos! The carnitas was tender & juicy, the al pastor was tangy (though for my taste lacking in sweetness) and the fish had an awesome spicy crumb batter. $2.50 apiece- not cheap, but you get a generous & well-appointed helping. And the chips & salsa (complimentary) are unassailable.

The fresh horchata ($1.50 for 16oz) is a revelation! Rich and complex and not overly sweet like you get from the fountain-served stuff. Another plus is the quiet, off-the-main-drag location on Bryant St. Weekday afternoon lunch can be had outside, in the sun, with the only noise coming from the playground across the way. And they bring the food to you. :)
author: Dave P.

description:
This is the second time I got home from ordering a Super Burrito and was bummed that all it had in it was beans with the smallest amount of meat. 
I was expecting avocado and cheese as well but was totally turned off by this lousy lack luster burrito for which I payed the full price of a Super.
My suggestion is to be sure to watch them while they're making it so you actually get what you want and paid for.
The only reason I'm giving this place two stars is that my friends burrito was exactly what he wanted.
Not so sure I'll go back even though it's just around the corner from where I live.
author: Richelle D.

description: Great food, doesn't taste greasy. Had a carnitas burrito. It was $5 flat, tax included for the regular. Not sure how much more it was cost for a super. The unique thing that they roll the burrito very skinny. So it's skinny and long, not short and thick like most places. My burrito didn't have much rice in it, so every bite I was biting into was meat, which was great. Friend had pollo nachos, and it was cheap, $5.25 tax included. Definitely worth to try.
author: Robin L.

description:
Plates, plates, plates. While burritos and tacos are reasonably priced here (think Cancun, if not cheaper) and they quality of food is on its way to, say, Papalote (without the soyrizo) the plates here are so inexpensive that it'll be a while before I try anything else.

I had the chicken flautas. When I was a kid I was obsessed with French Dip sandwiches. They seemed so exotic to me and weird that if I was taken somewhere that served them, I'd have at. Later I became seduced by the Monte Cristo, an even weirder sandwich. Now semi-grown, chicken flautas are my adult equivalent. If I see them on the menu, I'll have to try. And having tried many of these, El Metates were fresh, ungreazy and delicious. 

My mom had the tamales with chile verde. Now my chile verde of choice happens to be moms family recipe. And as such, she can be a harsh critic of anyone else's chile verde. That said, we both agreed it was very, very fine.

This place is great, cool, so-far-unspoiled and just too cute. It doesn't have that patina of funk that so many taquerias acquire after years in the biz (Cancun again), but doesn't look so slick and modern (say, Corneta) that you're concerned they'll make your burrito for a Gringo. Or worse yet, someone from Baltimore.

My one gripe is that they're salsa roja was thin on the ground. Chips want solids to grip in salsa, and though spicy enough, it was basically just hot sauce.

Anyhow, I hope the expansion of this place goes well and that I can come back here a few times before their increased rent effects an inevitable price increase.
author: Jeremy W.

description: For $7.25 I got a plate of chicken tacos, rice, beans, pico de gallo, guacamole and sour cream.  This is as good as it gets.  Plus, you can bring your own beer.
author: Sarah K.

description: Wow.. The fish tacos are incredible!!!!!!!! :) Crispy breaded bass with rice and lettuce and salsa... A WARNING: DO NOT TRY THE "INSANITY" SALSA UNLESS YOU ARE INSANE!!!! I sat there with my friend for ten minutes drinking the water out of the super slow dispenser. CRAZY. Metate is nice and cheap :) and good. I looked for it for like an hour because I lost the address and no one in the Mission knew about it but it was YUMMY and WORTH IT!
author: O K.

description:
8 months after moving to the mission, I finally have my favorite mexican spot.  At one point I thought it was taqueria cancun, then el farolito, and then began my love affair with the fajitas and margaritas at Puerto Alegre...ok, I still love Puerto Alegre but had a bad run-in with a bitchy hostess, so we're "taking a break".
 
What I love about El Matate is that it bridges the gap between delicious sit-down mexican feasting and quick taqueria grub.  It has the fresh ingredients and cleanliness of a more "slow-food" establishment, and the amazing flavors and prices of a taqueria.  The nice, sunshine-yellow dining area can easily seat large groups, and get this: they accept credit cards.

I had to withhold a star for the absence of cerveza.  I need a Modelo Especial with my taco plate!
author: Kiira M.

description:
Let's just say I live literally next door and I have yet to get sick of this place. Amazing burritos, delicious horchata, and the price is reasonable (I may even go so far as to say cheap!)

HIGHLY recommended
author: Jason E.

description:
i had the torta del mar and it was delicious!

the fish was just perfect! the dutch crunch was amazing! big pieces of avocado as well! it was a little bit sweet, a little bit spicy, and it hit all the right spots!

the service was fast esp since it was lunch hour and the prices are so reasonable! my torta which also came with soup was less than $10 and burritos are around $5.

im craving one right now!
author: Jennifer C.

description: I have sampled this spot many times, as I've worked in the area for a few years.  They've got a huge menu including all the regular taqueria fare, plus tortas and some different stuff on the specials menu.  Everything I've had here is good.  To be honest, nothing, for me, is off-the-charts amazing, but they get four stars for being consistent, reasonably priced and for having lot's of choices.
author: Erin b.

description: It's just OK...nothing outrageously special especially with other taquerias and Mexican restaurants in the area.
author: A J.

description:
my husband is usually not a mexican food fan.  when we were thinking of where to go for dinner last night, he said, "hey, i heard el metate has really good veggie tacos."  of course, i jumped at the opportunity to eat mexican food, so we cabbed right over.  

around 830, it was not too crowded.  we ordered at the counter, and the guy behind the counter was super nice and helpful.  the hubby got 2 veggie tacos, and i got the fish torta.  there were a bunch of agua frescas to choose from, and the hubby got the watermelon one, and i got the papaya one.  the agua frescas were delicious and were naturally (not overly) sweet.

we sat down and waited for our food.  when the food came, i was shocked at how big the portions were.  the tacos came w/ chips, and the torta came w/ a bowl of chicken tortilla soup!!!  what a pleasant surprise.  the food was amazing, hearty, and downright tasty.  this is also a very budget-friendly place.  i can't wait to come back.
author: Helen T.

description:
Delicious, fast, affordable.
Food eaten: Wet Beef Burrito and Chicken Enchiladas with Verde sauce.
Chips were stale.
author: cc v.

description: El Metate serves the best chicken burrito I've ever had! The flour tortilla is not too thick and there's just the right amount of chicken, beans and rice. I also tried the canteloupe agua fresca which quenched by thirst. I can't wait to go back to try the quesadillas and fish tacos! Oh and the owner Francisco is super friendly!
author: Helen Y.

description: Seeing how many reviews there were and the high rating, I was expecting a lot.  I was not dissapointed.  My quasedilla with steak was very nice.  Guac wasn't the absolute best I've had in the city (Los Socios wins there) but it was still above average.  Nice salsa.  Generous portion for the exceptionally low price of $5.50, including tax (which I always like).  Decor was cool, too.  Faux-crumbling walls and nice lighting inside and very clean.  Service was friendly and fast (place was fairly empty during rainy day lunch).  Chips were tasty also.  Even with no salsa, I enjoyed them.  I had been dissapointed with Mexican food ever since moving here from San DIego 10 years ago and this place may finally be the spot that allows me to forget what I'm missing there.  Odd location I never roam into, but worth going out of the way for.  Look forward to trying new things.
author: Marc S.

description: Really good fish burritos.  Location is a little out of the way of public transportation.
author: Jim J.

description: This is what I think California cuisine is all about. Fresh, big, and colorful food. The ambiance was cute. It's like you are somewhere else. The lights added a bit of heat to the stuffy dining room. Yes, I got caught off guard with the ordering system. I entered the dining room and expected to be waited on. There was only a couple there and nothing else was happening. After a long while, we were finally told that we had to go to the other room to order. (Slap on my forehead!). Order in the kitchen or other room and then sit down in the dining room! Okay, it shows I'm such a newbie. This is what I get for circling four times around the block looking for a parking space. I'm tired and I need to sit down and eat! I love the Horchata, more creamy than usual ones. I had the chicken enchilada. It came on a big plate with guac, sour cream, Spanish rice and black beans. I love the condiment corner. They had some sort of cantaloupe condiment. I can eat a bowlful, but I had will power. By the time, I ate my plate, I was super full any way. I can't wait to go back there and try the burrito. I also loved the hard chips, which comes out wrapped in yellow paper with the order. It got my dentures cracking. I can really afford to eat here, because my order was under $10 with a little tip!
author: Helen L.

description: I ate here today for the second time and I think the food is flavorful.  The service is always courteous and fast.  The chicken burrito is where its at.  It has been consistent with its flavors and presentation.  I thought the vegetarian burrito was not so flavorful and a bit soggy.
author: natasha h.

description: Delish, I had one shrimp taco and one fish taco with rice on the side. I'll be coming back and getting one of everything else next time
author: Tien H.

description:
Cute interior with wobbly tables and standard Mexican fare. 

I got the fish quesadilla which was ok, but a little more greasy than I would have liked, and sparse on the fish. My boy got a steak and a carnitas taco, which were pretty good, but nothing to rave about. I'd definitely go back if I was in the area, but not sure I'd make a special trip with all the taqueria choices in SF or the Mission alone. 

I did appreciate the variety of hot sauces to choose from on the wall, and the decorated stairway that surely leads to an unknown world of Mexican delights.
author: Kelly R.

description:
I wanted to like this place more than I actually did.  This review is more a 3.5 stars, but I am always a bit more generous hoping for a better round two.
I ordered the fish burrito with all the stuff, as well as a Pinapple Agua Fresca and chips and salsa.
The chips were definitely of the same grain as the burrito tortilla and they were perfectly fried.  But interestingly where I appreciated the chips I found the tortilla to be a bit much.  I love me the lard like anyone else, but it was just too overwhelming.  The other problem is I barely tasted any sour cream or salsa of any sort.  I needed more of that and less rice and beans.  Also, I waited till I got home to eat my burrito which gave it about 25 minutes to sit in the foil.  The fish had definitely lost some of that crunch.
I am not giving up on this place and next time around will wait around to chow my eats.
author: Sheila Y.

description: Good but not great.  Seeing that this place gets 4 starts, I must say I had pretty high expectations.  Also I have not had Mexican food for maybe 6 months so I was starved for some really tasty tacos.  El Metate was set up for a stellar experience and review, but it disappointed.  I ordered a variety of tacos (bistec Mexicana, al Pastor Carnitas and fish).  Overall the fish taco was the best.  I was kind of hoping for more of a grilled fish taco to make it lighter, but deep fried is fine.  The beef and the pork was dry and did not have a huge amount of flavor.  For me, the difference between average Mexican food and great Mexican food is that great Mexican food can exploit the fresh and bright flavors of cilantro, lime, onions to enhance the heavier meats and cheese.  El Metate really didn't do this. The meat had good meat flavor, but that was kind of it.  It sat on your palate like a brick.  This is typically what I experience at average Mexican places.  Overall I would give this two stars but I will give it a one star bonus for a few reasons.  The fish taco was juicy and tasty (even though I really didn't want a fried fish taco).  Also the horchata was a nice refreshing drink.  Lastly, the restaurant itself was bright and welcoming (but don't expect a lot of service--this is very much of a self serve type of operation).  It would be a fun place to have some drinks and some finger food with friends, but for food on its own, I would rather go to a good taco truck.
author: Scott C.

description:
I actually came on Yelp today looking for a Mexican place to try, saw all the reviews for El Metate, drove there, and then realized that I'd been there like 5 times before (a friend lives around the corner).

It's great food and it's never been crowded when I've gone (amazing consider all the reviews it has).  Plus my boy and I got two full meals for $12.  My favorite is their chicken enchilada.
author: Katie S.

description:
I would rank this as one of the better taquerias in the city. Solid food and cool indoor and outdoor dining that's a little nicer than what you would expect at a standard taqueria.

Ordering was a little chaotic but the guys that worked there were cool and went out of their way to take care of us. Avoid the al pastor (get that at one of the more authentic places like Tonayense taco truck or take a trip over to Fruitvale) - quesadillas and veggie burrito were great. Def going to make a trip back to try the fish tacos.

They also sell Mexican coke in the bottle (Mexican coke has a little more sugar in it and is sweeter than US coke)
author: Bart C.

description:
El Metate, thank you, OH THANK YOU, for always being there for me when I needed you most.

It's easy to get lost in a sea of mediocre Mexican food in these parts, but you, well, YOU have stayed TRUE to me, never cheating or talking smack behind my back. YOU are consistently amazing and oh-so-giving with your heavenly ingredients of love.

I've taken several dates here for optimum burrito sensation, and no one has been let down. You were there for me after a day "trip" out in Berkeley with friends. You were there when I had just moved into the neighborhood and needed a quick taco after a strenuous move. You were there when all I wanted was a fish taco and no one around could oblige. YOU are there, always, with your colorful interior and quirky menu and horoscopes-on-the-tv by the register, entertaining me while I wait to place my order for what can only be described as ultra-vegetarian fare at it's best. 

Thank you, El Metate. YOU are the BEST! (As far as grilled veggie burritos are concerned.)
author: Danyell K.

description:
Same rating.  Here's why:

MINUS one star for "The best fish tacos in SF" not being the best fish tacos in SF.  Not that I've tasted more than 3 different places' fish tacos here in SF, but shit these were straight up mediocre.  Rice?  In a taco?  Perhaps beans, but why rice?  That's like putting mashed potatoes in your sandwich.  

PLUS one star for TWO things:

1. The amazingly fresh and sweet aguas frescas.  Melon, PIneapple, Jamaica, and my newly-discovered favorite, mango (pronounced "mon-go"), which was well worth $2.  Also literally the best horchata I've ever tasted, and I've made that stuff from scratch with a Mexican house mom in Oaxaca.

AND

2.  The great service.  Fast line, quick cashier, rapid table runners so you don't have to get up and grab your food.  And they brought a big plate of chips with cheese and sauce when I asked for a simple (free) basket of chips for dipping.
author: Eric S.

description:
This must be one of the best bargains in S.F. $5 for loaded burritos, $5.75 for creative tortas, $1.50 for quality aguas frescas. Plus a salsa bar with fruit salsa! Great value for great food.

I was particularly impressed with my torta del mar, a delicious combination of soft and crispy textures. I've never had a fish torta before but I'm sold on the idea now.

The only other Bay Area taqueria I've given 5 stars is El Farolito, and indeed, Farolito's food is better (in a very particular, sloppy-and-sinful kind of way). But Farolito is also a crowded, dirty-feeling hole, while El Metate has a pleasant, spacious atmosphere.
author: Mike B.

description: I get a burrito here every Wednesday with my roommates and I have yet to be disappointed. For me, I can tell when a burrito is bad, but it's kind of hard to distinguish between good burritos. El Metate has good burritos for sure, but I can't say if they're better than say El Farolito or Papalote. I usually get either the fish burrito or the al pastor and both are delicious. The al pastor is a little different and kind of reminds me of beef brisket. The roomy eating area is clean and nicely decorated, a rarity among burrito places. Overall, it's a great burrito place, but with so many good ones around the city, I don't think you really need to go out of your way to stop here.
author: Jeremy J.

description:
I finally made it here after reading so many great, and sadly, undeserved rave reviews.  

I ordered the fish burrito.  I'm used to a fish burrito that actually has some fish in it-  ya think?!  At first I thought they forgot to put the fish in there.  Oh, wait, I see it.  A narrow shard of breaded fish along the length of the burrito.  I couldn't even taste the fish.  Pathetic!! Unfortunately I did get a big taste of the guacamole- which is of the el cheapo watery variety.  For f*ck's sake, how can this place get five stars when they have this kind of guacamole?  HOW!?!

One star for the canteloupe aguas frescas, and the tasty, if small, serving of chips.  Perhaps we are too far from the border for people to know what a good burrito is.  A more likely explanation is that the Yelp staffers adore this place.
author: CAKE E.

description:
What can I say that hasn't been said?

This place has no atmosphere...which, in it's own funny way, makes it the perfect atmosphere.

Mostly take out, they have something like 8 or 9 seats inside and a few outside tables for those sunnier days.

The real reason that most people come here is because it is not so much CHEAP as it is AFFORDABLE.  If you're on a budget and want some top notch grilled fish tacos or a little dose o' carnitas or even some subtle and delicious mole, this place is for you.  

$2 tacos? No, I don't know how they do it either.  But I ain't complainin'!
author: Josh M.

description:
I have been so lucky to live less than a block away from this place.

The $2 fish tacos are my favorite and my girlfriend swears by their enchiladas. 

Everything is fresh and the guys working there really seem to be having a good time making such awesome food and they are all very nice.
author: Jimmy H.

description:
I wouldn't say this place is overated, I'd say it's much more of a customer-centric taqeria than its competiton: friendly staff, clean place, well prepared eats.

There was a Zagat card on the counter that said something like 'best all around fish taco' or something -I gotta disagree, the fish tacos here are typical but slightly upgraded. Want a kickass fish taco? Goto Papalote and be done with it. Hands-down the best.

If you're in this immediate area and want to try something really remarkable and unique, I recommend the Dona Tere van around the corner.
author: Joe R.

description:
To start this off, I consider myself a connoisseur of the "Taqueria." So  this review is T la Git.


I was impressed the first time I came here, but yesterday I returned and perhaps it's because they were getting ready to close but it didn't have the same fresh feeling that it did the first time around.

I was recommended the Super Burrito with Grilled vegetables and fish, which they will do, Gratis.  The Fish was great as well were the vegetables but they totally forgot to put the sour cream, cheese and guacamole that I paid a dollar extra for.  OOPS.

The first time I had the fish tacos and they were legit. They also sell many different salsas. Oh and they give free chips which makes them even more legit.
author: Adam L.

description:
Fish taco good.
chicken quesadilla okay.
Steak Burrito good.
Nachos okay.
