I take this place hands down any day over la taqeria.  The guy who owns this place is also a total sweetheart.  I love the chile colorado and their fish tacos. yum yum..
author: ruby r.

description: I am sure the fish tacos are great, but me, I just keep coming for the fish quesadilla. Don't know what made me try it, because on paper it doesn't sound all that great (which is probably why I haven't seen it in other places)... The colors are quite cheerful, Pinata-style (that's a plus), on the downside they are a tad slow cleaning up the tables.
author: Mathias B.

description: Oh noes, quality slippage alert at Metate! Enchiladas with red sauce were stale, the tortilla tough and with hard edges where it wasn't under the sauce, like it had been sitting out for an hour. Weirdly icky guacamole, oddly bland and funky meat. Shocking. Will give the place another chance since it's charmed me before and maybe they were having an off night, but one more meal like this and I'm out!
author: Ben G.

description: fish burrito was kinda whatever, but the vegetarian burrito is where it's at. they have legit veggies in there, not just beans rice lettuce and guac like most "vegetarian" burritos. fresh ingredients and cheap but smaller than el farolito, so it's fantastic when you're craving mexican but feeling a nasty bout of food guilt for all the fried meat and alcohol you ate over the weekend. it has veggies so it counts as healthy, right?
author: Ellen H.

description:
Yeah, when I drove by El Metate and saw a parking space out front, I couldn't resist. I was about to start cruising 24th St. to find an unsampled taco store, but E.M. has been on my list of places to try for a good while. Maybe if I had stumbled upon it and hadn't read 45 reviews of love for this place, I think I might have liked it more.
I liked the flavor and texture of the pollo asado, but I have to say, for $2/taco, I expected them to be a bit heftier. Refried beans were decent, a little on the thick side of things, and not the creamy, lardy treat I sometimes lust for. I also ordered a 1/2 pint of salsa to go, this was before I saw the different types of salsa listed on the menu. The "hot salsa" is of the watery, pureed persuasion, but wasn't overly vinegary. The salsa fresca was as it should be, but missing chile heat.
The register guy was super nice and I'm looking forward to hitting it up for lunch, trying the chile verde, and some of the other salsas. Sides of beans and salsas were more expensive than other taquerias. I do love the thick cut, salty, freshly fried chips and I feel like there could be some worthwhile items at E.M., even if they are a bit pricier.
author: Candice L.

description: El Metate means the frog, but it's the prince of Mexican food in the Mission. It's a tiny little joint with quaint outdoor seating and a friendly vibe. They're famous for their quesadillas and fish tacos, but their chile verde is a clear favorite at our house. For an extra added hook up, ask for chile verde nachos (not on the menu) -- the bomb. Funny, as I write my roommate just walked in the door carrying -- you guessed it -- food from El Metate.
author: Katie B.

description: Add my name to the list.  With all the yelping on this spot, I had to come by.  I, too, was prideful in my knowledge of what a burrito/taco should be.  I was humbled.   I'm a taco al carbon guy.  The chicken: spicy, tender, not too greasy, real tortillas.  And best of all: better meat, more meat, fewer dolares than many other tiendas in town.  Nice little homey atmosphere too.  I think the ruby red radishes add a crispy clean snap, maybe not for others, but I'm Korean.  Reminds me of spots down in So Cal near the beach, just  perfect for a hot lazy day, with boogie boards parked against the wall.
author: ed y.

description:
it's definitely good, but not the best mexican i've had.  i had the chicken enchiladas, which was good flavor-wise, but slightly dry.  i was disappointed in the chips.

... and now that i've read maria d's review, i'm thinking i should have tried the carnitas.  next time, el metate!
author: Jill k.

description: Seriously get the Torta Mexicana. Not usually a torta fan but just get it. Don't question it. Get the Torta. Why are you arguing with me? You never listen, fine your loss. They serve it with cheesy chicken tortilla soup and the torta is grilled to perfection. The carnitas is that perfect balance of crisp and then soft and moist. The best way I can describe it is like a mexican panini. Its really amazing and only $5!!!!! Their salsa bar is the bomb with actually hot, habanero salsa and a wall shelf with 2 dozen hot sauces for the using. There is nothing bad about this place, everything is perfect. Their shrimp burrito is also solid. Big shrimp, very fresh. Steak and Pastor are also very good.
author: J R.

description: Fresh Down Low Mission Mexican at it's best. Their vegetarian burrito is one of the best in the city. Fresh vegetables, a nice mexican rice, black beans, and fresh guac all combine for an amazing meal. El Metate is one of my new Mission staple joints. The watermelon juice was excellent also, not too sweet and perfect on a hot May day.
author: Phil M.

description: Hella good. No liq license. BYOB. +40 salsas (bottled), Get yer own water.
author: Joe G.

description: The food here is fresh.  You know it is because you have to wait a bit to get your order.  I order chicken and it's spiced and grilled just right.  A bit crispy, but still tender.  It's best to order "to go" because there is just no room to sit, especially during the lunch rush.  If your timing is right, you might get a table out front, which is cool, especially if you've been cooped up inside your office all day long.  The one con about this place is that they really should warm the tortilla on a comal.  I think they use the microwave or streamer because as I eat a burrito, the tortilla sticks to my teeth.  Staff is friendly.  Because it is close to SFGH, it is probably best to get there after 1 when the lunch rush is over.
author: Emilio O.

description: Great place to hit on a sunny SF day when you want to sit outside & enjoy a Mexican meal.   A friend and I went here and everything we ordered was delicious.  I had the carnitas burrito, which was a scrumptious fiesta in each bite.  Big and tightly wrapped in a fresh tortilla, the burrito was filled with a generous amount of grilled seasoned meat, along with beans, salsa and guacamole.  After reading several other reviews about the mediocre guacamole, I did notice that the side of guacamole was prepared with too much sour cream, used as a filler to spread the guacamole out.  Forgo the guac, but definitely try out the other items on the menu.
author: michele g.

description: Veggie burritos here are some of the best. The only complaint i have is that their salsa is lacking. They need to have a salsa bar or offer more handmade types instead of the shit in bottles. Love this place.
author: Franky G.

description: good, not LA good but good enough to satisfy my taco craving. tacos are much bigger here tho. 2 would suffice.
author: Viet N.

description: I found this hipsterish Mexican spot because my friend lived a block from it, but dammit if they don't have tastiest quesadillas at the cheapest price. ($4.25) The veggie quesadillas are delicious.
author: Liss C.

description: Cheap. Tasty. Clean. Friendly. What more could you ask for? Well, how about one of the best Mexican food options in the mission, perfect for when you've got a craving for some tacos al carbon, rice, beans or burrito goodness. Make sure and wash it all down with the freshly made agua fresca for the complete experience.
author: Brian B.

description: I had to try El Metate after I read about it in the Chronicle, since it is probably the closest tacqueria to my house (unless you count the truck) but I had never been. I thought I might be too old to eat there, since it was described as "very popular with the Gen Y crowd" but I was not the oldest person there. I thought the veggie tacos were great, with grilled vegetables and radishes, and I loved that they came with pickled carrots and jicama. It was great to eat outside on a great weather day, but I can see in bad weather, the 6 seat restaurant could be less appealling. I'll go back.
author: Amy E.

description:
i wish my friends liked me as much as they like the fish taco here. :-/ it's cheap AND tasty?! i'd eat it, except i'm a strict vegetarian. or am i? i must say that the crispy outer skin does look rather delicious. 
they do have a variety of vegetarian nibblings here, of which i have tried the nachos and the quesadilla. the horchata is really good, too! five stars for making me want to become a pescatarian.
author: Oleya P.

description: The only thing I've ever gotten here is the veggie burrito. Pretty good. They offer a slightly different twist by adding sauteed veggies to the regular filling. Good, fast service. They have never disappointed me.
author: Kitty H.

description: Nothing special!  We went here very excited to try their fish tacos based on several recommendations.  However, we were all very disappointed.  Food is mediocre.  There are much better places out there.
author: Nicole M.

description: Pretty freakin' good. At least, I've never been let down in all the times I've been there. And it's an oasis on Bryant, which, for the most part, is a vast, restaurantless wasteland of a street.
author: Jenn M.

description: This place is great.  I discovered this place en route to AT&T park riding on Bryant Street.  If yer driving, parking is a bit difficult, but it's worth it.  Their dish plates are delicious.  I had the two tacos w/ beans and salad and it was pretty cheap and delicious.  The burritos are good also.  On a nice summer afternoon, can't beat a meal sitting outdoors on Bryant St. in front of the restaurant.
author: Richie W.

description: Wow.  Great fish tacos as mentioned in many reviews.  The carnitas was good too but not the best.  The space is very small but it looks like they are expanding.  The thing will be if they will still be good then.  The prices are very fair and the people working there are cool.  My only complaint was that it was not very comfortable.  The seats were not comfortable and it was cold.  Believe me I am no baby but I like to have a decent place to sit and enjoy a hot meal,  not one that cools down in 30 secs due to a cold room.  I really hope that the expanison will not affect the quality of the food.  Best new Mexican for me and I will recommend for a quick meal but not for a comfortable meal.  hell I guess is all you can ask at the prices they charge.
author: Bucky W.

description: There are so many taquerias to choose from around here, but they all have something special to offer.  The fish tacos here are legendary, but I  prefer the grilled veggie offerings. They use seasonal, fresh veggies and I like eating them in burritos or quesadillas.  The quesadillas are a little greasy, but the burritos are so good that I finish them even though I'm full halfway through eating one.  Make sure to get your burrito with "the works" for $1 extra.
author: Jody S.

description: They have the BEST fish burrito I've ever had... It's so good, that I've never tried anything else on the menu (so in a way this is a pointless review if you don't like fish). I don't know what they do when they grill the fish but it's very tasty. I like the prices too. And like another reviewer mentioned, they have churros, which my friend always gets and raves about.
author: Katie h.

description:
Burritos are really small and they don't have a salsa bar.  This is a deal breaker so I don't get my burritos here anymore.

Their tortas are off the hook though.  The Carnitas and the Chicken are my favs.  Comes with a small bowl of soup usually.  $5.75 I think.

Usually a line but not that big of a wait.

Just stay away from the burritos and you won't be disappointed.
author: James R.

description:
I've had some amazing burritos at this place - their al pastor is meat poetry.  For a little while it was my favorite mexican place in the city - where I would go to whittle down my life expectancy a little bit at the end of a long weekend.

However, the last 3 times I've been there the quality has been way down.  Dry, unflavorful, poorly prepared, etc. It looks like El Metate may have to be dropped from my burrito-rotation.  sigh.
author: zeph h.

description: This is a great place for some real Mexican food.  The fish tacos are awesome, and there's something about those chips and salsa that has me chowing down like I haven't eaten in a week.  =)  People are nice, place is cute & clean.  A definate winner!
author: Jessica F.

description: El Metate has a great look and was certainly busy the night that I came for a takeout burrito, which resulted in a really long wait for a burrito.  My bistek burrito with black beans was nicelyu seasoned and with a tangy sauce.  The burrito wrap was tight, but despite that the burrito turned out a little mushy and with a hard rind on the tortilla.  It's a quality burrito, but not for the long wait.
author: Thomas T.

description: Recently expanded and better than ever!!  Oh man, their veggie nachos are the best I've ever had.  They actually top their nachos with REAL GRILLED VEGETABLES like broccoli, zucchini, and carrots, along with the usual suspects like rice, beans and cheese.  Nice atmosphere, the somewhat plump man at the counter is really nice.  They also have about a million different hot sauces there for you to dress your food with, my favorite being Cholula Brand Hot Sauce.  Mmm, come to think of it, I have some leftovers from my lunch there yesterday in the fridge that I just might warm up for dinner. Love this place!  Pretty good aguas frescas there too.
author: Nicola H.

description: This place was hoppin'! It was like THE neighborhood spot. After trying a burrito, I can see why!
author: Esme W.

description: So authentic, so friendly, so super inexpensive. Always, always frsh and delicious. I particularly like their fruit refrescos - usually have at least 4 to choose from - the cantaloupe - unbelievable !
author: Kathleen D.

description:
The burritos here seem a little different from burritos else where.  The first time I came here, it was only because it was a couple of blocks away from where I was working at the time and I wasn't expecting much.  The veggie burrito here uses 'seasonal vegetables' and I don't know if I came during the wrong season my first time, but I couldn't get past the fact that there was broccoli, carrots, and peas in my burrito.

So, I avoided it at first for a little bit.  Then I came back a few months later and asked them to use black beans instead.  This, for some reason totally changed the veggie burrito.  The sauteed carrots, broccoli, and other 'seasonal' vegetables in there were now getting in to my stomach regularly because of these burritos.

And let me rewind for a second: these are the best black beans I've had over at any taqueria (at least in my opinion).  The refried black beans at that other place are good, but those are refried.  These are just plain black beans and they do them proper. 

I've had the grilled steak burrito and that wasn't so great.  It may've been timing (in that I got the driest part of the steak that'd been sitting around for a while) but I can only say that the grilled steak sucked the one time I had it in my burrito.

I had what I think was the shredded beef burrito (the colorado sauce or whatever) and that was real good.  Funny story behind that: I was actually ordered a veggie burrito on my way back home to the East Bay but got someone else's order and didn't notice til I took my first bite out of it on the Bay Bridge (yes, I was that hungry).  In short, it was good.

I've heard, but can't say I know this as I've never tried it, that the fish tacos are really good here as well.

Finally, the salsa & chips here leave much, very much left to be desired.  Unfortunately, the salsa here is really just a blend of something with hot-sauce.

Ambiance: More of a hole-in-the-wall place though they do have a couple of tables outside where it can be really pleasant on a lot of days.  Of course, you might want to come one or two hours off of lunch time just because they might be occupied.
author: Anx R.

description: Now that there's a dining room, this place is perfect.  I love the chile verde pork tacos here.  A few tacos on a plate with some rice, beans, guac and your choice of a few dozen hot sauces... fresh, cheap and TASTY!  We love El Metate.  Gracias.
author: john h.

description: It's our favorite burrito spot since moving to Potrero Hill three years ago.  The fish burrito is damn good while my husband opts for the carnitas burrito.  When in need of a cheesy fix- the nachos are sure to please.  Clean, friendly, reasonably priced and tasty are what makes this place a hit.  Don't miss out on the homemade salsa!
author: Nikki C.

description: A great taqueria within walking distance of my house! Everything here tasted much fresher than the average taqueria. My friend had the fish taco and I had a carne asada quesadilla. Great service and ambiance resembled taquerias in LA. We will definitely be back!
author: kathy c.

description: Seriously, I wouldn't expect to find such a wonderful place the first time I went there. A good friend of mine who's mexican and always goes there once said to me that they rocked and if I really wanted to taste good mexican food I should stop there. Well, quesadillas with carne asada are simply at their best and fish tacos are superb! The atmosphere is sincerely friendly, the place is small but you won't be disappointed at all. Real, fresh, colourful food and on top of all, if you're biased about mexican cuisine and got tired of it, stop by and take care of your palate.
author: Dario B.

description: Now, this is GOOD mexican food.  My friend and I walked in here, took a seat immediately.  We literally inhaled our veggie quesadillas in minutes, and were so happy after the meal.  MMMMMmmmmmm.....food coma........
author: Joanna S.

description: My most reliable filling dinner plan :). Consistently delicious.
author: C R.

description: the tacos were yummy, the burrito (as expected) was subpar. WHAT IS UP WITH THE STEAMED TORTILLAS in SF????? i asked them to grill it because i saw the offensive steamer and KNEW that my tortilla would come out all soggy and gross...but after grilling it, they then wrapped it in foil (for a dine-in meal), which totally defeated the purpose of grilling because the burrito basically steamed in the foil casing. JESUS, the chips come in paper, why the hell can't they just wrap the burrito in paper? i'm such a jaded san diegan!!!!!
author: eve l.

description: First time I went here I ordered a carnitas burrito and about 3 minutes later I knew I got the wrong thing when I saw two hipsters carry out a ton of fish tacos.  The burrito wasn't all that, totally bland.  Tasted like the kind of Mexican food you get in Des Moines Iowa.  But I came back and got the fish tacos... hells yeah.  So the extra star goes to the fish tacos.
author: matthew w.

description:
although we've never actually ordered a taco al pastor at this place (part of our self-imposed rules for rating taquerias), we feel this place deserves a hearty mention for their incredible chile verde. it is out of this world. it is a chile verde like no other. it is the epitome of chile verde.

update: i just had their veggie quesadilla (yes yes, i know that's a lame order but i was feeling a bit meated out) and it was greasy and nothing special. in conclusion, stick to the chile verde.

update: strangely enough, while their veggie quesadilla was nothing to write home about, their veggie burrito was AWESOME! in addition to your usual rice and beans, they also throw in lots of seasonal grilled (? or maybe roasted?) vegetables, e.g. carrots, onions. a veggie burrito with actual texture instead of a giant burrito of mushiness? i'm in!

update 12/2008: similar to their veggie burrito, i'm now a fan of their veggie tacos, which contain huge mounds of assorted grilled vegetables. yum. don't worry, i'm not turning vegetarian - not with chile verde like the kind they make here anyway.
author: Angi C.

description:
Hands down the best taqueria in the Mission.
Platonic fish tacos and burritos that won't leave you reaching for the pepto.
author: Matt S.

description: Came here with a couple of frieda and one spoke Spanish, recieved excellent service. Came back a week later and ordered the same thing and my fish came out before I could take off my coat, whcih was very uncomfortable for me. I wanted freshly cooked fish and seemed to be precooked. I was very disappointed. I guess I will not come unless I have learned fluent Spanish or have a friend that is fluent. I am so through.
author: D Y.

description:
Although Metate has my favorite burrito in the city thus far, I'm giving them a three. Now, let me explain. They have the worst tortilla chips I've ever had. They're so bad I've actually handed them back, I don't want to waste the calories. Sometimes the service is slow and the decor is cheesy.

On the other hand their burritos are delicious. I always get the chili verde, super. The beans and rice are great and all the burrtio fillings mesh perfectly. Plus,the burrito isn't ridiculously over sized or over priced. They offer a variety of hot sauces, its byob and they have many traditional Mexican dishes such as tamales and pasole which I love.
author: K B.

description: i love their corn chips, the burritos..........the friendly and efficient service (i know it's just an "order in line" sort of place but i'm easily annoyed by customer service in this town, which is either too "i don't care about anything" or "overly customer servicy"), the...........tacos, the sauces......it's simple and not over done, obviously.
author: hank h.

description: I've been going to this place for a few years, and have seen them expand into the space next door, and for good reason. The prices are below most mexican places and the menu is great. The chile rojo is great on a burrito, and they have great fish tacos, the flautas are good too. No longer a secret so sometimes there is a line, but worth the wait.
author: Julian M.

description: It is, by far, one of the more health-ful choices in potrero hill/mission area.  i get the fresh-as-can-be, veggie tacos.  and the aguas frescas REALLY hit the spot in this microclimate!  it get crowded at lunch so i recommend phone order, if you can.  otherwise, grab a seat outside and enjoy!
author: Juliet P.

description: Great burrito - my new favorite in the city.  It's not thick and messy unlike some other places in the Mission.
author: Mamoon H.

description: Wow, I'm not sure why people rate this highly.  When I went I was checking out at all the beans and toppings because that's the only place I could sit, most were crusty and old looking.  I wasn't impressed by the food either.  Maybe I have to go again.  Also, parking is next to impossible around here.
author: Mitch A.

description: I've heard good things about El Metate and got around to stopping by the other night. I went with a chile verde burrito which I thought was average. Part of that may be I prefer when the tortilla is heated on the grill, as opposed to steamed. But the pork was tender and flavorful and, overall, it wasn't as greasy as some of the other taquerias in the area. Still doesn't top Paplote as my running favorite though.
author: Sig N.

description: I've tried El Metate twice and it's a good spot, but I can't quite give it five stars.  It's just missing something.  The food is pretty good and reasonably priced but it doesn't have that extra kick. Maybe it's just me...
author: Gene X.

description: I can't believe it took me so long to try this place.  It just about lived up to the hype.  My only complaint is that they didn't have whole wheat tortillas but other than that, it was a great burrito...I had the fish and it was yummy, I haven't had one like it.  It's got a great large dining area too which I wasn't expecting from the outside.
author: Debbie Y.

description: Good, fresh food, decent prices.  I like the fish tacos, beef quesadilla, and the nachos, which are great for sharing since it's enough for 3 people.  Not a big fan of their burritos though and their salsa and chips are not the greatest.  Love their agua frescas, which are so refreshing and great to wash down all that food with.
author: Stewie G.

description: I love El Metate.  I have recently stumbled on some reviews for one of my favourite Mission eateries.  The reviews complained about the food portions being small or the taqueria is too small.  This is not the place where you are going to get a pound and a half burrito and have acres of seating.  I go to a restaurant to nourish my hunger and I want to eat someone else cooking.  I love their Chile Colorado with Potatoes---reminds me of my mother's cooking.  I come for the quality and don't leave disappointed ever.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: I was looking for a decent Mexican place near where I work, and I went to El Metate based on Yelp reviews, believe it or not.  I was psyched to find a cute little place with the staff rocking out to cool Mexican songs.  My vegetarian burrito actually had vegetables in it (cauliflower?), which was much appreciated, and the rice was better than average.  Along with super-yummy chips and rich, rather powerful horchata.  I've definitely been telling people about this place.
author: Lego S.

description: Best taqueria I've been to in town yet. Their burritos are great and the decor bright and pleasant. Another plus - fairly inexpensive.
author: Valerie G.

description: Got a few tacos to go a few weeks ago -- definitely enjoyed them greatly.
author: Tal R.

description: Usually get the fish burrito from here.  the fish is battered and is nice. The burrito is huge so there's usually leftovers. The secret sauce is good. Give it a try.
author: None o.

description: I work a couple of blocks from here and for a while, I was making a weekly lunch trip to El Metate. Some hits, some misses--I have finally figured out what I like: they have amazing quesadillas--so much for so little! And their steak tacos--not super, just the steak with cilantro and fresh lime squeezed on with their incredible salsa verde...you have to ask for that. Awesome agua frescas--if they have pineapple and my order is to go, I have to will myself not to drink it before I reach my office. The owner is super sweet!
author: Dora A.

description: Great food, but a bit inconsistent.  When its on, its the most perfect mexican food in the city.  I think they get so busy that its difficult to keep it right everytime. It's definitely a weekly visit for me.
author: louda l.

description: I miss this place....I used to walk here all the time for lunch from work and now that I'm working elsewhere, I find myself daydreaming about it.  The food is just very very very good.  It's nothing spectacular, but it's very tasty, dependable, and always enjoyable.  Plus, the staff are super friendly and welcoming, which makes a huge difference for me.  The recognize you pretty quickly and I miss being greeted with a smile everytime I went.  The only drawback is the minimal seating available, which pretty much forces you to do take out if you go at prime lunch or dinner time.
author: Jessica L.

description: My new favorite taqueria, after 13 years of adoring Taqueria Can-cun on Mish @ 19th. I just have to hand it to the Metate folks. It doesn't get better than this, especially for $4.95.
author: Dan S.

description: Loved the quesedillas and the outdoor seating is really nice.  Check this place out.
author: Michelle K.

description: This is one of my favorite Mexican eateries! My one and only complaint was not enough seating, BUT NOT ANY MORE! They just expanded the dining room . AWESOME! This cute little hole in the wall is worth the trip!
author: Kent T.

description:
cowboy says: you know a taqueria sucks when its packed with white kids, straight outta maine....anyways, why does every fish burrito have to be breaded? oh cuz you fatties like it that way? don't it fatty?! i bet it reminds you of mamma's chicken fried steak, huh? get your honky asses to taqueria vallarta on 24th. the best thing i got outta this place was seeing a lady get run over by her pissed off boyfriend. thanks metate!

canary says:  broccoli has no place in a burrito.  same for you, zucchini.  Go to your home, in basically every other cuisine out there.  I want a burrito with beans, rice, onion, cilantro, tomato and avocado, smothered with good hot sauce and/or salsa.  Speaking of, you can judge a place by its hot sauce, and Metate fails.  They stock a TON of bottled sauces, but the best one is Cholula.  The rest are some crappy canned tomato bland liquid poop.  The house salsa is nasty and the chips are disgusting.  I do like the little general store next door though, and cowboy wants to sample one of them server girl's tortas, if you know what i mean.  bad cowboy!
author: Katherine K.

description: I'd been craving a fish burrito since I moved to the east coast, and El Metate was different then what I was used to, but good. The breading on the fish with a hint of cinnamon(?) was new to me, but it worked.
author: Arun C.

description: Having lived in the heart of the Inner Mission for over a year, I spent a considerable amount of time exploring new taquerias. I can say with out a doubt that El Metate is the greatest place to grab a burrito in the Mission District. Great food, cheap prices, fast, and friendly service! Having tried at least 10 other taquerias in the area, El Metate takes the gold!
author: Dan H.

description: So bomb. Ask for extra jalepenos and avocado and you're good to go. Quesdilla, nachos, tacos, and burritos all dank. Open til ten, clutch. And quick service too.
author: Sarah B.

description: Very good Mexican restaurant, but this place is more for SoCal yuppies who are into the fish taco thing.
author: Scott F.

description: Had a friend in town from New York City who wanted Mexican food we could sit down and eat at.  We shared a fish quesadilla and a veggie burrito and YUMMMM!  We were both very happy, and all for about $14!  Including sodas!  I will be back.
author: Winged F.

description: I can't actually decide whether this place deserves 4 or 5 stars. I wouldn't say its the best Mexican food I've had, but I feel like no matter what I order, its gonna be really great here whereas some of the other SF Mexican joints the quality control can be a little spotty. I will say that I think their veggie burrito trumps all others, and I'm a big fan of how they do their enchiladas.
author: Paul J.

description: Holy Crap this spot has boxed out my tried and true favorite El Farolito!! The tacos are some of the best in town and they're Chile Verde is superb, the pork just melts in your mouth. I highly recommend the house made guacamole to accompany these heavenly creations. Nice Nice.
author: Matthew R.

description:
burritos rock. so does el metate. 

veggie burrito sans queso y sour cream, +guacamole=very verry happy gnat. 

this helps me meet my burrito quota of at least 3 burritos a week. and yes, this is one of the top 3 burrito joints in s.f. 

yum!
author: Natalie C.

description: This place has some of the best Mexican food ive had in the city. I ordered the enchiladas and they came out with this gigantic plate complete with beans, rice, sour cream and guac.  Everything was absolutley delicious-- all the flavors and spices just bursted in my mouth!  The Horchata was pretty damn good as well, so I would definitley recommend that. The service was good and the food came out really fast. The best part is, this great meal was super cheap-- everything for under $8!  Cant beat that. I would definitley recommend this place for lunch, that is, if youre in the mood for eating lots of delicious Mexican food.  :)
author: Jackie B.

description: I am a lucky person to have this place in walking distance. Best in the mission, fo'sho.
author: Anita C.

description:
Yum. Delicious Tacos...fish - not fried, but with delicious tomatoes and rice. Chile colorado with the surprising addition of pototatoes...but I am flexible.  The carne was a tad chewy but also good.

They do things a little different here...ie. rice in the fish tacos, carrots in some things, so if you are married to the idea of a standard taqueria you may not enjoy it. But if you are willing to try something new, I'd give it a shot. Cheap, delicious, and great service.

Only downsides are limited seating and difficult parking.
author: Darien W.

description: This taqueria is the only place I can grab a delicious 2 buck fish taco any day of the week. Their fish taco is quite filling. I love the fresh tomato, relish and bell pepper salsa on it! It is affordable and cheap! This is the place for me to go after a great workout after the gym.
author: Helen L.

description: Great burritos (I tried fish), maybe not the best, but still rock-solid.  I really liked the quesadillas as well.  The chips, though, are where it's really at.  If they had better salsa, I think I'd be 100% sold, but still a good, cheap eat.
author: Rohit G.

description: This place pretty much has it all- it's cheap, delicious, beautifully painted and decorated and best of all, down the block from my apartment. I used to be all about El Farolito, and I still eat there once in a while, but they raised their prices and are always packed. This place is tiny and while there are always people there, it's not as highly trafficked. Fish tacos, burritos and quesadillas rock. I left a star off because the tortilla chips have been a little overdone the last couple of times.
author: Nicole A.

description: REALLY REALLY good nachos! You actually finish them and leave nothing on the plate. All the meats are really good too, there's no need for all the extra stuff on the tacos though (a serious pet peeve of mine with some of the taquerias out here). Burritos are tasty too!
author: Gina R.

description: I always come eat here, the poeple are really nice and the food is great. it's not expensive and tastes really fresh and good. i love the nachos, quesadillas, and burittos, oh and the fish tacos are coo too. it's a coo little spot to kick it with friends
author: Victor G.

description:
its really a perfect lunch spot.  the food is delicious, fresh and affordable.  with just $6.75, i get enough food to have leftovers for dinner.  I usually get the fish tacos but you really can't go wrong with any of the dishes.

the staff is very accomodating and nice! I'm lucky that I don't live in the Mission, otherwise, I would gain a ton of weight eating El Metate.
author: lasok o.

description: Two stars because the guy at the counter was friendly.  One star for the food.  Completely uninspiring veggie burritos, bad veggie quesadilla and overcooked chips.  A friend had warned me, but we were close and in a hurry.  Oh, and the guac was like goose poop.  Go to La Taqueria or Papalote.
author: Geoff L.

description: Had to try it with all the hype here in Yelp. Gotta admit, it's damn good. I had the Carnitas burrito. As advertised, the carnitas were just right and oh so tasty. My wife and I also tried the fish tacos. Also tasty. Lastly, she had (and I sampled) a Prawn burrito. Muy bien. Not 5 stars, though, in my book. The main reason is that they don't have good salsa. They give some watery salsa-like fluid and then have all those bottled hot sauces around to augment/alter the flavor of your meal. Not that I don't love Cholula, but I could have really gone for some of the Farolito green salsa with that fantastic carnitas burrito. Food gets 5 stars, overall gets 4.
author: Scott M.

description: One of my favorite places to eat in the mission.  The owner is such a sweetheart and the service is great.  This isn't the place I go to order a burrito (although my boyfriend thinks they are great), but everything else is delicious!
author: Katie V.

description: Great fish tacos and fish burritos - pleaseant decor and friendly guy behind the counter.  The perfect tacqueria.
author: Marc B.

description: There are only things to like about this charming neighborhood taqueria.  Tastes "fresh" for whatever that's worth and always has a special or two that's tempting.  Unless you live in the 'hood and i don't, it's a bit away from the hubub, but i always come away feeling happy that i went the extra mile.
author: Ryan D.

description: yummy and cheap. There's only two tables and a counter inside so get it to go. Love the quesadilla.
author: Veena S.

description: I love this place! For the year when I lived just down the street, I ate at El Metate at least three times a week. Everything from their burritos to the quesedilla were always top notch and had very distinct flavors. It also helped that the food there is very affordable. It's been a couple of years since I paid a visit, but I'm sure the food is just as great.
author: John B.

description: Beautiful enchiladas and beautiful prices! No alcohol so byob I think. Count on a great meal when you go here! I love this place. I leave full and satisfied for under $10. Outstanding!
author: Jenn L.

description: This was one of the first places I ate when I move to San Francisco.  It's in my neighborhood and delicious.  The staff there are so nice and helpful.  The carnitas platter is not to be missed.  I used to get the chicken tacos until I discovered the carnitas.  You will need several gallons of water for the rest of the day but it's so worth it.  Now that they've expanded the restaurant, you can sit and enjoy instead of doing take away.  Yummy!
author: Shanni L.

description: What can I say about my local favorite Burrito?  Love this place.... I recommend the chili Colorado burrito with the addition of seasonal grilled vegetables.  The ague frescas are yummy, try the strawberry.   The usually have a decent selection of hot sauces in the dining area.
author: Francis B.

description: Super fresh and tasty. Can be a wait, but not too bad usually. Chile verde and fish quesadilla off the charts!  Love this cute little place - probably go way too often, but it's just so darn good!
author: Andrea S.

description: good: fish tacos and enchiladas and huge portion of nachos and mexican coke and nice employees and huge portions in general
author: Edmund C.

description: Hands down some of the best Mexican food SF has to offer.  Friendly staff and great location(next to my house).
author: Eric B.

description: I liked the food and it is affordable but lack of customer services. There is also not parking.
author: G M.

description: I've never even seen or heard of this spot until my friends brought me here for dinner one night a few weeks ago. I will have to say that their burritos are quite tasty and definitely above average compared to the taquerias in the Mission.
author: Hans H.

description: wonderful food and if your kid's in one of the many spanish immersion programs, a great place to let them practice their Spanish!  The owner is super nice and really happy to ignore the gringo parents and engage ther bilingual kdis in conversation!
author: cheryl h.

description: A great place for lunch and dinner - I drop by at least once a week for the chicken or shrimp burrito, though the other dishes are equally delicious. The only thing missing is breakfast burritos (or just breakfast in general), but the owner says he's working on a recipe. Speaking of which, the owner and his staff are great - always friendly and pleasant, and if you're a regular, always asking you how you've been and making small talk before asking for your order. This isn't like the other "fast food", greasy spoon Mexican places - El Metate's food is always fresh and tasty.
author: Elena O.

description: Been there about dozen times, small joint with good 'authentic' Amex food. But there are a few other places where the food is as good, and you get much more convenient indoor eating.
author: Juhani P.

description: El restaurante Metate hace la mejor enchiladas en mi barrio (el mission: entre calle 19th y calle 23rd y cerca de Harrison y Bryant)
author: Jen L.

description: i don't do quesadillas. i can make those at home, BUT NOT LIKE AT METATE. I don't know what kind of mojo they sprinkle in there because I have NEVER been able to replicate their tongue-blisser of a vegetarian quesadilla.  Everything else is sublime, so no more about that, but that vegetable quesadilla is toe-curling-no-you-can't-have-a-bite AWESOME. I love you Metate. Don't go changing.
author: Nini M.

description: The tacos here are so good and the guys behind the counter are awesome.  It's cute too.  I used to go to El Farolito, but now I come here.
author: Janut B.

description:
Wow. Yes, it is clean, a little too clean on the inside, but they make a F'in  A+ awesome burrito. The rice bean mix is great, and yes, they use guacamole, but it is good. Very good chicken in my burrito.

My only diss on this place is that their salsa are piss poor. 

I intend to buy a crapload of salsa from Papalote and use it on my burritos from Metate. 

Is cross-eating allowed?
author: Rahul T.

description: If you want a tasty fish taco plate - go to el metate. Although the tasty  morsels could do with a tad less breading, they are delicious along with the refried beans and flavorful rice. service here is excellent. the main man behind the register is such a delight, i would go there just for one of his pleasant smiles and an agua fresca. def worth a try. oh, and their chips are thick and crisp-o-liscious and perfect with the fresh salsa.
author: Nathalie P.

description: Cute place, fresh food, good size portions (but not too big), good chips and amazing salsa. In the running for best Mexican in the city!
author: Paige B.

description: Two fish tacos for $5. Delicious fare and now with a larger seating area. El Metate is like the Nirvana of fish taco joints. I love to purchase and eat fish tacos from El Metate. Did I mention the fish tacos?
author: Donovan W.

description:
estoy honrando el metate del el escribiendo esta revisin en espaol.

lo que sigue es todo lo que usted necesita saber sobre el metate: 
1 - los burritos de los carinatas la roca
2 - pesque del tacos la roca
3 - barato

pienso que los trabajadores me estn comenzando al recoginze... que hace me la sensacin especial!!
author: scott s.

description: Every Thursday, my office in the Mission has Burrito Day. Of all of the burritos that I've tried, El Metate's are among my favorite. Though the carnitas is supposedly the way to go, I am always partial to a grilled chicken burrito (I live an exciting life, I know) and El Metate's is delicious! Some people claim too much rice, but I think it's the perfect combination of beans, rice and whatever else they shove in there. I also find the burrito to be deliciously moist, but not soggy. Service is quick, the staff is friendly, and the burrito (if you don't get all fancy) is under $5.
author: Rachel L.

description: I shiver with delight when I anticipate sinking my teeth into an oh-so-yummy burrito/taco/etc. from this place.
author: Liver W.

description: This is the best Taqueria in the city.  Tacos El Pastor muuuuy buenos!!  I take off half a star for bad atmosphere in the dining area and it still gets 5 stars.
author: Kurosh H.

description: This place is incredible. I don't know how food this good and fresh can be so cheap! Very clean, great food. I highly recommend it!
author: Sarah C.

description: This place is fantastic - clean, affordable and tasty. Another reason I love to give them my business is that the owner is a really nice guy. oh and they actually cook up veggies to put in your veggie quesadilla/burrito etc.. yum!
author: Kathy B.

description:
The best. 
That's all. 
No attitude, cheap, outdoor seats, nice people, good food.
The best.
author: Stacy J.

description: You cannot deny the chili verde.  This place has been feeding us for years, and we love it to death.  How Cancun continues to walk away with "Best Of" honors year after year is baffling, especially in light of the existence of El Metate.  Long live Francisco.
author: Sneaky's B.

description: This is my new favorite taqueria in the Mission.  The portions are big, the prices are cheap and the food is delicious.  I especially like the veggie tacos.  Yum yum!
author: Jen H.

description: Truly as good as it gets for authentic taste and flavor.  I grew up and still live a mere 4 blocks from El Metate. Always leaving the city I never really noticed the place til a year or two ago although they've been there for quite some time now. I've ordered many items from their menu and the food never disappoints. The agua fresca is the best in the city in my opinion, not too sweet. I use to frequent other taquerias like La Corneta and Pacho Villa, etc. But keep coming back to Metate and really dont even go anywhere else for Mexican food anymore. Its always fresh and full of flavor. I read some of the comments below and just laughed when some floks complained about the place yet their bad experience had nothing to do with the food. Like getting booted in the shoulder with a soccer ball outside or not getting enough chips. To those people I say we dont want you here anyways, GO AWAY! Like I said I grew up in the Mission tried many different places on 24th, Mission St, and other spots yet havent found anywhere that comes close to the food here. Im not Mexican but many of my friends are and they agree its authentic like abuelitas cooking.
author: Luis R.

description: Can't believe it's only 2 blocks from me and I just found it yesterday !  Fantastic.  Had the carnitas burrito $4.25 which was inexpensive, had excellent beans and even better rice.  They reheat the meat when you order, WOW !  The guac was fabulous and the mild salsa was perfectly mild.  Will be going back tonight for the fish tacos $2.00.  Highly Recommended - 7 days a week 10a-10pm , even better  !
author: Beautiful B.

description: For me, it's a tie between the quesadillas and the fish tacos.  The basic chicken quesadilla is very good and for a change, I like to get the chile colorado as the meat in my quesadilla.  The fish tacos are cheap and filling and wonderfully seasoned- not bland or tasteless as some fish tacos can be.
author: P-Rock F.

description: Yay for good, cheap food in big quantities! My biggest complaint is that if you go there when it's at all crowded, you'd better plan on a "to go" order, because there's precious few places to sit down. In good weather, the sidewalk seating is available, but the unnatural heat wave of '06 can't go on forever.
author: Jere K.

description: Go on, drag your white ass into this place.  Sure, you're blatantly gentrifying the outer mission by doing so, but gentrification should always be this cheap and delicious.  Oh well, hopefully it will remain delicious.
author: Gabriel E.

description: Better veggie burritos than Pancho Villa.  Also, none of that veggie burritto =regular meat version just minus the meat. Nope, these have real (whole) veggies inside, rather than just beans, rice, salsa, and cheese. It's also great that you can sit outside to eat when the weather's nice.
author: SL N.

description:
I really don't get the hype.  Their carnitas Burrito tasted nothing like the namesake. The meat all but disappeared in the rice and other accouterments.. Carnitas are supposed to be  succulent and crispy. No such thing here. The meat was tender and flavorless. There is a sauce they use that doesn't help improve the lack of flavor in the meat and seemed to be on my wife's order of tamale as well.

My wife's tamale was unevenly cooked, if that is even possible, some parts of the shell were dried out. Nothing special.  

The chips had a bitter aftertaste as if the oil was reused. Overall I wasn't too impressed. The positives is it was cheap and fresh. Overall totally passable inauthentic mexican fare. We did take out so can't speak for the service.
author: Arun R.

description: Every muthaf*****r on here that gives this place less than 5 stars is out of their mind.  This is, hands down, the best taco place I've ever had the luxury of eating at.  Mouth watering.  Squeeze a little lime on it.  Even better.  Reduces me to a child like state.  And all I want to do is eat, eat, eat.   Amazing.  Hands down!  Amazing!!!!!!
author: Michael S.

description: Great tacos, especially the Pork with Chile Verde, Chile Colorado (with potatoes!), and the breaded Chicken Milanesa. Super all the way... A staple of comfort Mexican food that doesn't leave you feeling sick afterwards. Staff are really friendly as well...
author: Will P.

description:
ok. i have a lot to say about this. 

first of all, the guacamole is a joke. its NOT avocado. its that paste stuff that you add water too or something and then they try to be tricky and add pico de gallo to is so it seems real. its LAME. and avocados are my favorite part of mexican food. LAME. 

ive been here a lot. and im on the fence about the 2 or 3 stars because what i have eaten there is pretty good. a steak quesadilla. its ok. i like that they use multiple cheeses. i like the quality of the tortilla. i like the chips. i like that it comes with sour cream, pico de gallo and that stuff the call guacamole. i like the decor. the steak is...well its often a bit tough. but its ok. the overall texture is good. i enjoy. 

but........well, ive been here a lot. and every time i leave im disappointed. and im not exactly sure why. i need to try the burrito i think. and  i will. i promise. i hate to give it less than a stellar rating because its so well received! the people - they love it! and the first time i tried it i LOVED it. and then i tried taqueria cancun and my world changed. so. el metate i say step up your game. and start with avocado. 

ok, i have to mention just one more thing. all those bottles of hot sauce are verrrryyy appealing. i like tons of spicy and different sauces. but most of them are empty. and reallllllllly gross. today i opened one up and about a dozen gnats flew out of it. it was so traumatic that i didn't say anything to anyone about it. not even the guys i was with. so thats something that probably needs to be addressed.
author: Lindsey B.

description:
I tried this place a few months ago and was not impressed *at all*.
At least not by their burritos. Way too salty.

Tried it again last night. Even worse than I remembered. 
I ordered a chicken burrito with black beans... my standard fare.
Burrito was greasy -- I mean *dripping* grease. Tough meat, barely recognizable as chicken. And the thing was pencil-thin; not much of anything in it. Too salty. Again.

I had to ask for salsa. Counter guy gave me one container. Begrudgingly gave another after I asked for more. Wouldn't give me a third. I really needed the third to mask the taste of the thing.
Salsa was thin and oily.

Needless to say, I had to throw the whole thing out after a few bites.

Horchata was so-so. A bit too sweet.

Maybe their other menu items are palatable, but I doubt I'll be going back to find out.

The taqueria closest to my house is El Farolito on 24thSt/Alabama; I'll stick to it. I didn't realize how good it really was until I had the second unfortunate experience at El Metate.

Zero stars.
author: Judith B.

description: I eat a lot of burritos, and these are great.  It is close to my house, so convenience plays a factor, and perhaps it is not my all time favorite taqueria in the city, but it is close.  My girlfriend is a vegetarian and swears the veggie burrito IS the best around.
author: Nathan M.

description: This place is fantastic. They have awesome aguas frescas and the staff is always super friendly. They let you bring in your own alcohol and the tacos are delicious.
author: Courtney F.

description: Had the pork tamales with rice.  It was very good!  I'm not a Mexican food fan but this place may have just changed my mind.
author: Grace L.

description: El Metate took up the mantle of best taqueria in the Mission after Taqueria Cancun on Mission St. got worse.  Everything is good, you have the option of tortas nextdoor at La Tiendita, Francisco is an awesome dude and every so often there will be live music or a performance of traditional Mexican Aztec dances.
author: Jon Z.

description: Best Mexican in the Mission. Their burritos are amazing, and the nachos are definitely worth being overly full for. Aguas frescas are super fresh and not too sweet. We moved to the Marina, and this is literally the only thing I miss about living in the Mission
author: RJ B.

description:
i really love the fish tacos here!

the soup from the el metate market is absolutely the best in the city. they always have two homemade soups available. 

you MUST try the soup!!
author: Sally Q.

description: This place is very cheap and the food is good. They cook right in front of you, so that you can see how everything is prepared. It is a good place to go if you don't feel like cooking and need something quick. Taco plate is pretty good. Sometimes this place can be pretty crowded.
author: Sophie N.

description: El Metate saves my life just about twice a week when I come home from school cashless and so hungry I can't think.  They have super amazing burritos and they almost always get my weird-ass order right, even over the phone.  The guys who work there are so nice I kind of want to marry all of them.  And the salsa.  It is the best salsa in the whole Mission, that's what I think.  What I am saying is: go to El Metate!  Go!
author: lizzy a.

description: The fish tacos here are the best!  Hands down.  Always fresh cooked and always yummy.  It's hard to want to order anything else here, but every so often I go for the veggie burrito or the chicken enchiladas with both the red and green sauce and am always satisfied. The lines can be long, but it's always worth the wait.  Don't forget the crazy hot sauce selections on the wall. I've been a fan of this friendly neighborhood place since they opened!!!
author: Erik A.

description: Wonderful food, and service, not much room though for a large group, but management is working on expanding, visit on a sunny day and try to miss the lunch rush (before 12 after 2)  for a spot to sit.
author: Isaac D.

description: I love their taco plate. Everything is fresh and well-seasoned. I crave this at least once a month, which is a lot for me. It is a tiny place but the people working there are really nice and on a sunny day you can sit outside.
author: Catie S.

description: Really great. Good enchilada sauce, good salsa, and sour cream and guacamole come WITH the enchilada plate! There's really not much more I could ask for.
author: Jennifer S.

description: the best taqueria in the mission. fresh, tasty, fun and colorful. go there!
author: P L.

description:
El Metate is about 4 houses away from where I live.  I used to go there all the time for their yummy carne asada burritos and tacos.  I stopped going there after I became a vegetarian..but to my surprise they now have vegetarian options which are just as good!!!! The place is a bit small and crowded for the time being...they are going to move 2 houses down to the corner of bryant and 22nd soon and make it more of a restaurant with more seating available...woo hoo!!
Really good food for a cheap price!!
author: Caroline G.

description: I am loven El Metate it has become my " go-to" spot for burritos. My old spot was la taq and I would swear by it but 15 dollars for two tacos and drink is just crazy I don't care how good it is.  At El metate I used to only get the fish tacos which are excelent but now it's all about the carne asada super burrito!! They have expanded and La Tiendita on the corner is a great place to grab a salad only make sure they put enough dressing on it.  Hint. sometimes you can mix orchata with juice and it is goood.  Also I have to say that the owner is good peoples allways friendly and glad to see his loyal customers...
author: James S.

description: i love the food here, always good! francisco who is almost always there at the register, is so good at what he does. i have been getting food there on a regular basis and they have always gotten my orders right when i have called them in.
author: Linda M.

description: El Metate is definitely my favorite Mexican restaurant in San Francisco. Clean, friendly, and authentic. Their shrimp dishes are amazing, with super big, juicy shrimps.
author: Kathi E.

description: El Metate satisfies my burrito desires like no other. The rice is never over cooked and has just a hint of flavor so as not to overpower. Whole pinto beans served with very little "sauce" keeping the wetness strictly linked to the salsa and guac. Panfried fresh veggies cooked to a crisp but not burnt. and all for under five dollars. a small slice of vegan heaven.  Plus, the owner thinks i look like Donny Osmond.
author: Alex D.

description: Good burritos, pretty wide array of menu options.
author: Camille H.

description: This place probably has the highest percentage of white patrons of any Mexican joint in the Mission. Which I don't consider to be a good thing for a Mexican place in the Mission [Disclaimer/Conflict of Interest: I too am white]. The food is not really bad, but it's not particularly good either. If you must come here eat the fish. The rice is too dry, which makes the burrito too dry. And nothing seems particularly fresh, despite the fact that in the time it takes to get the burrito they could make everything from scratch. If you have an extra ten minutes go somewhere good, like Taqueria Guadalajara, where the juke box is extra loud and the soccer/telenovela can get intense.
author: mathew p.

description: my favorite place for tacos.  A bit small for groups but it looks like they're soon expanding  -- they bought the place next door and have been setting it up for a while.  $2 tacos are now $2.50, but still worth it.
author: Mic L.

description: veggie burrito+special sauce in the veggies+fast+1 block from my house=favorite mexican restaurant!
author: Bea H.

description: simply the best taco place not only in the mission, not only in the city, not only in the state, BUT IN THE WORLD.  they make my head explode and my stomach happy.  seriously, cheap and good good good!  i love el metate!
author: church B.

description: hands down el metate is my favorite taqueria in my part of the mission.  i live right around the corner and it comforts me to know that if i am hungry i can go there in two seconds and get the best tasting, veggie burrito around.  the warm veggies inside are what makes it special. i think you don't even have to make it super although the sour cream does compliment it so well. the quesadillas are the best around and my only complaint is that the guacamole is sometimes a little runny/soupy.
author: Kristie P.

description: 3 months in the city...And this is my go-to place for a burrito. Hailing from down south it is very hard to compare the Mexican food between San Diego and San Fran so I have finally given up. Both cities have their own take on what a truly good burrito consists of so therefore this burrito is based on the "San Fran" burrito (steamed pressed, wrapped in foil w/ rice and beans) On that note, El Metate is great and I absolutely love the service. Everything on the menu is great and affordable. I usually go with the Chile Colorado (think carne asada burrito w/ potato's and enchilada sauce) and a tall Modelo from the Liquor store down the street - can't go wrong. I've also had the fish tacos (No SD by any means) as well as an 'old trusty' if you are in the know. Both are great. I would give El Metate an additional .5 star if they had better salsa/hot sauce - though tasty, their one hot sauce (salsa) is not spicy. In the end, 1. Grab a beer in a brown bag 2. Order what you want 3. Sit outside and enjoy...
author: Stan W.

description: living in the mission it all starts to taste the same after awhile, and pretty soon you're burnt out.. as far as el metate goes, most of the things i've had here are pretty decent, and YAY super fish tacos! um, i also live right across the street..need i say more?? oh and p to the s to all the whiners about how itty bitty it is..they just opened up a dining room.
author: Angie B.

description: Simply the best food and sweetest people ever.  The chile verde pork is really the *only* thing to get here since it's so damn good (ok ok, the other stuff is good too but i mean c'mon.  Conviently located near Mission Cliffs so you can grub after a hard training session... its the stuff!
author: Ashkan S.

description: First fish tacos! it was really good. The place was unique and clean. It is really cheap for the quality and quantity. Would definitely go back!
author: Alda H.

description: My boyfriend says it's the best authentic Mexican taco in town.   "Con el sabor de Mexico" the inside large menu on the upper wall reads.  It's true.  The tacos, burritos, and quesadillas are all excellent.  3 years ago when we first found this taqueria, there were never lines, and the prices were about 25% cheaper.  Now every night at 6pm the tiny little space, recently expanded with some redesign, has a line out the door.  Though missing the slightly cheaper prices and yearning for that feeling like it's your own little spot no one else knows about, it's great to see that it's been fully discovered.
author: Beth S.

description: Great eats. Always fresh. It won't break the bank.
author: Nick H.

description: Wow. What an outstanding burrito. I'll be back. At least twenty or thirty times.
author: Frank T.

description: My dad goes here all the time and orders sometimes fish tacos, nachos with carnitas, carnitas burritos, vegetarian burritos, and tortilla soup. Every time they have always served him very well and it has always tasted delicious. There is no comparison to the taquerias that you find everywhere in the mission. The price is very affordable and the portions are very generous. MMMmmm delicioso!
author: Danielle L.

description: deeeeelicious. oh man their tacos, their TACOS! i had the carnitas and bisteca mexicana taco plate and it. was. divine. i'm still happy almost twelve hours later. plus it's the kind of place you can hang out with a few friends for hours and not feel bothered. great little space. not to be missed!!!!
author: rachel m.

description: Place is hella bootsy.  WTF My burrito was a super burrito with steak and potatoes but all it was was SUPER gross, all bland beans, dry steak, avocado at the bottom.  Hurt the crap outta my stomach too.  No good people, no good at all.  Only good thing here is the fish.
author: Chris H.

description: i'm not sure i was at the right place. it was a mess inside and the service was strange.  pleasant, but strange.  there was a real limited choice of salsa's. i'm used to a lot more choices.
author: Michael V.

description: This is the best fish burrito I've ever had. I've had a few... Very clean and relatively quick service, given that there's generally a line. Carne asada burrito is nice too.
author: Gym W.

description: very, very, good veggie burritos. great off the beaten path mission locale. strangely detached dining area.
author: casey c.

description: great, fresh Jalisco food in a low key neighboorhood makes a perfect setting to eat with friends and have a beer. some tacos pescado are my pick.
author: James-Jimm P.

description: i'm a big fan of the carnitas tacos here.  i think their carnitas might be some of the best around.  it's cute, tiny, very neighborhoody, but unfortunately for me, it's a little off my path, so i don't get to eat it as often as i'd like.
author: brian g.

description: wow! love this place... cheap, tasty, giant portions, fresh ingredients, just the way I like it. so tiny inside, so get ready to bump elbows, but it's worth it. WORTH IT I SAY! Tacos rock, and the burritos are epic! The owner is such a sweet guy too, don't be afraid to ask him for recommendations!
author: Jeremy H.

description: so delicious. so wonderful.  so spectacular.  when you go there, order one of everything on the menu.
author: Melissa Y.

description: El Metate rocks.  Cheap prices, quality food, small but cool atmosphere, great spicy saucy stuff to put on your food, FANTASTIC frescas.
author: Jon B.

description:
this place has some fantastic tamales, arguably the best i've had in the mission.the extensive array of hot sauce bottles on the wall makes for a good conversatin piece -- and a good laugh if you should dare to try the "temporary insanity" flavor.

i also like that their prices include tax...so very efficient of them.

now if only there were more than three tables inside...
author: Mia L.

description: I've become full-out addicted to the veggie super burrito, I fear. I honestly crave one daily now. It's good and fresh and includes a good variety of veggies (i.e., not just cabbage or something) and delicious and satisfying and, really, there's pretty much no time at which I'd be offered one but turn it down. Ever. Plus, six bucks! Makes it extra hard to resist.
author: Tea B.

description:
for me, it's all about the fish tacos.  the red salsa too, very good.  the service is friendly and they've just opened up a nicely themed courtyard like room, too.

their various meat burritos fail to rise above the pack of mission offerings. the horchata is okay (check out la torta gorda on 24th for the best horchata i know about)
author: Combi C.

description: El metate is by far my favorite taqueria in SF. It's clean and everything's really fresh and flavorful. It's been way too long since I've been there!
author: Photo D.

description: Oh my God. Had the best burrito here last week, with super fresh cheese and guacamole. Thought I'd built it up in my head, so went back for a repeat visit a couple days ago. Yum! Can't figure out what makes it so damn good. And can't wait to try the fish tacos.
author: Midori S.

description: I first discovered El Metate shortly after moving to the neighborhood.  I was headed down to 24th St. in search of a burrito one Saturday after being out a bit late the night before.  On my way, I noticed a place across the street with a string of lights above the door.  I was wondering if perhaps it was a restaurant when I saw a fellow walking out of it with a stack of "to go" trays!  I was very excited because this is very close to my house.  I walked into El Metate and immediately fell in love with place.  I love the bright decor and the selection of different hot sauces on the wall.  I ordered my buritto to go and took it home.  When I finished it, I immediately called my good friend back in Wisconsin and raved about my new favorite taqueria that's practically right around the corner from my house.  I've actually tried several different menu items there and while the burritos are still my favorite, I would recommend anything.  The guys who work there are friendly and the prices are reasonable.
author: Sara H.

description: Love this place. It satisfied my craving for tacos last night. I had a bite of the tamales...I may just have to return in the near future to get a tamales plate all on my own.
author: Gina S.

description: AWESOME veggie tacos. Awesome chips. Awesome lots of stuff actually... Not so awesome salsa, be forewarned, it's more like hot sauce and not so good on chips... lost a point there...
author: Burleigh Girl G.

description: i hesistate to add to the raves.   best mexican food in the city, and yes, i am an expert, thank you.  can sit outside with the  humans and enjoy things too.
author: buddy b.

description: Definitely a fan!  Good ambiance (especially since they opened more eating space next door), fast, efficient and yummy food.  My go-to place when i'm too lazy to cook. Love their menudo (only avail on weekends) and chicken tortilla soup.
author: Ai M.

description: Vegetarian taco platter with refried beans is amazing. I love that the refried beans are vegetarian. The veggies in the taco are fresh but just greasy enough to make you feel like you're getting what you need. This is currently my favorite mexican place. Service is great but parking is horrible.
author: Sarah J.

description: this place is delicious! I'm a sucker for the carne asada nachos! yum!
author: Christina S.

description: One of my favorite SF taquerias.  Great staff, atmosphere, food, prices.  The veggie burrito is fantastic, even with no cheese! I go here several times a month.... hearts.
author: E F.

description: This is the best taqueria I've even been.  When I crave for a real good carne asada or fish taco with a delightful fresca, I can't help myself to stop by this clean and friendly place.  It's been 2 years and I'm anxious to find out when will their dinner restaurant open.
author: Mary S.

description: el metate can, without question, make a super tasty, super cheap vegetable burrito.  most importantly the vegetables are always crisp, never overcooked.  the lack of a five star rating comes because of the chips.  yeah, so they're only chips, but when they're no good it just ruins the whole thing.  so, just don't get the chips and, atmo, you've got the best vegetarian burrito in the city (yup, that's right, it beats mariachi's and papalote hands down, even with their fancy tofu and fake meat).
author: William L.

description: I just moved in a few blocks from this place, so naturally I decided to check it out. Now I have their number programmed into my phone! Their veggie burritos are very tasty, and once I accidentally picked up someone else's order...it was a burrito with some kind of seafood in it, maybe fish? Whatever it was, I need to figure it out because it was delish.
author: Jenny Q.

description: i hate to be a debbie downer, but this place was terrible! the guac tasted like the cheapo safeway variety (watery brownish green with a few chunks of aging tomatoes inside). two of the four items we ordered were incorrect. the chunks of chicken in my burrito were pink in the middle and they didn't add the cheese, sour cream or guac that i was charged for to my super burrito. the chips (which will make or break a mexican restaurant for me) tasted old and weren't even salted.  don"t believe the hype.
author: Sushi K.

description: Sometimes the super burritos aren't that super (chintzy on the guac, maybe because I was there toward close), but I have one recommendation: Super Prawn Burrito. ohhh man.
author: Kate F.

description: I've never had a bad meal here. Anything with fish in it is good. Pan sauted vegtables are also very good in everything here too. But 5$ for a cheese quesadilla that probably cost them 50cents. please
author: jeremy r.

description: Hot diggity!  When not bursting its seams with a long line of hipsters, this is arguably the best mexican food in sf.  "Arguable" does not mean it is (cancun takes that spot).
author: pauline e.

description: This place rules. Friendly staff. Cheap, good, and filling food. Not too many hipsters. What else can I say?
author: dan s.

description:
this place rocks b/c:
-atmo is charming. walls & tables beautifully painted. no i wouldn't want that style in my house, but i love a cheery restaurant.  it's in a nice yellow bldg on the corner.
- clean & gorgeous bathroom.
-incredible alfajores- each in own container so they won't get soggy sitting on the counter all day.
-carnitas tacos - very tasty.
-fresh sliced radishes on the side - a nice touch.
-normal chip portions.  really- a huge basket isn't always better.
-the owner - i assume it's him @ the cashier - is very nice & welcoming.
my only tiny complaint - the fish tacos. i want to love them, but theyr'e not GREAT. they're just ok.  i know i have the vision of the southern cali fish taco w/ fried fish, slaw & whiite dressing & i know these are different, but these could be better, w/ bigger chunks of fish, more spice on them, more veggies in there - esp finely shredded cabbage - sure charge an extra few bucks.
if the fish tacos were improved, this would end my search.
author: Kim Y.

description: great neighborhood tacqueria, but their guac used to be better. still, it's better than most tacquerias in sf.
author: gary a.

description: best fish tacos in the friggin world. period. and the horchata is nice too.  love the service, and their salsa is slammin.  i've also had other  tacos, but when i'm outside of san francisco, i'm not home again until  i've had an el metate fish taco.
author: Latrice B.

description: like a taqueria, but a little classier. the last two visits i got a fish burrito with black beans. a craving for fish is usually the reason i choose this place over cancun or farolito. nice large assortment of hot sauces to experiment with.
author: Horrible H.

description: i dont understand all the hype with this place, i lived  3 buildings down from it for the last 3 years. maybe because i dont eat the meat, but everything there to me seems bland, the only thing good about it isnt on the menu, flour tortilla chips. those rule.
author: Greasy w.

description: serious mexican food for serious eaters. excellent prices for a good amount of food. i wish i lived next door!
author: Gen E.
